Like virtually all games of this type MemGame is played on a grid and players take turns turning over a pair of cards. If the cards match the player scores a point and gets another turn. The winner when all cards have been revealed is the one with the most points.

The AI opponent has three skill settings, there are three sizes of game area and two sets of cards

sample_screenshots.caption: The start of a game. Here the player is selecting their opponent

A game in progress
This game is being played under WIN 3.11 with 256 colour support

title: MemGame

description:
The Adventures of Ninja Nanny & Sherrloch Sheltie is an educational, interactive novel for ages 12 and up. The story follows a cow named Norbertina who lives on a farm near San Francisco but aspires to travel to England and become a nanny. In her quest to save enough money to make the long journey, she gets a minimum-wage job at an ice cream parlor working for two pigs -- names Hog and Doss -- and is later pursued by a variety of villainous characters, including Baron von Moribund.

Occasionally while reading the story, there are a number of "hotword" selections that the player can click on and trigger a graphical scene depicting crude drawings of characters with odd voice clips and sound effects. Throughout the course of Norbertina's adventure, there are also tangential references to geographical and historical items of interest -- such as the Golden Gate Bridge -- which the player can learn more about by reading entries in the game's "DictioPedia NinjaNannica," a dictionary/encyclopedia hybrid that features a number of stock video clips and images.

A sequel was planned but never released.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sometimes the game uses short videos for illustration
For example, in this screen we can hit the fisherman by clicking on him
The main content of the game is plain text
Some additional information about the Golden Gate Bridge

title: The Adventures of Ninja Nanny & Sherrloch Sheltie: No. 11 Downing Street

description:
PC Trivial Pro is a typical Trivial style game, with a lot of multimedia content (photos, video, audio clips, etc.).

The program contains 8500 questions divided in three difficulty levels. The objective of the game is to win the eight thematic sectors (like in the original Trivial Pursuit). The game allows until eight players simultaneously.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Question (With A Video Clip) About History.

title: PC Trivial Pro

alternate_titles.title: Myulk i bitar : kampen om det öppna landskapet

description:
Myulk is a combined adventure and farming management game, in Swedish (mixed menu text & un-captioned spoken language).

The adventure part is a classic point&click adventure with 2D characters in Myst-style 3D rendered backgrounds with a few animations, where the protagonist has inherited a decrepit farm 'Öppnaäng' (Openmeadow), and needs to get it up and running. This involves a gnome-like figure from the Swedish folklore; a 'Tomte' called Yul, who is traditionally helpful, provided the farmer treats him right; and in this game he gives you advice about the farms various animals and warns you about an ill-meaning tree creature called 'Slymmer' who is trying to make the farm fail and turn into a dark forest.

The farm and fields are initially overgrown with roots originating from this 'Slymmer' character, and you need to pick up items, navigate mazes and find a means to remove these roots, eventually removing Slymmer from his den (but he is not yet defeated). This takes up the first year of your farming career.

The second part of the game involves more of a dairy-farm management game, and you have two more years to make the farm economically sound. The actual farm work is not directly interactive, but is represented by the advancing clock/calendar and icons showing the work being done, your job is allocating your time & money to farming tasks of varying urgency.

You are also supposed to get a number of documents from the nearby 'Någelunda' (Sumwhat) town archives to first prove ownership of the farm, then get a bank loan to purchase farm machinery and cows, and you also need a veterinary certificate for your cows so you can lab-test & sell their milk to the Swedish dairy producer Arla (who is also a sponsor and publisher for the game). Of course the administrative tasks are a bit convoluted, and requires both flattery and trickery to get the civil servants to do your bidding.

Things can also break down on the farm, some things can be repaired by yourself, but for other faults you have to call repairmen and to not lose time you may need to hire a farmhand helper to succeed. The time for farming tasks are partly pre-defined, you always need 8 hours to sleep, and 3 hours to milk and feed the cows, but the rest of the day can be used as you wish or need; plowing/seeding/fencing the meadows/mending broken items etc. There is a weather-predictor device (that you have to make work) that tells you of the weather for the next six days, which sets limits on how long you can spend on harvesting on your own, or if you need extra help in case of impeding rain.

During the second and third years you also have to find more items for a magic weapon to finally banish the evil Slymmer from the farm. The final battle is a series of simple action sequences, and only after a successful battle you will get the blessings of Yul to continue running the farm, provided it also is economically viable.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu (demo) - you can only use the town section and the handbook in the demo.
Inside the milkbar you can talk to the attendant. (demo)
The bank teller. You need to get some documents before you can get a loan. (demo)
In the court house is a legal expert, who can give you a certificate of ownership for the farm, if you can show him a copy of the will from the city Archive. (demo)

title: Myulk: kampen om det öppna landskapet

alternate_titles.title: The Pagemaster: O Mestre da Fantasia

description:
The Pagemaster is based on the movie of the same name. Richard Tyler (the movie's protagonist) is sent back to the library world because the Pagemaster has been kidnapped by Mr. Hyde. Now Richard has to help his old friends Adventury, Fantasy and Horror by traveling to their domains and setting things right - and of course ultimately rescue the Pagemaster.

This is a classic point & click adventure using much animation similar to the movie. The player controls Richard's action through a mouse cursor which is moved through the static images. When passing over an interactive part, the cursor changes its form and clicking starts an action such as collecting an item or moving to another room or a closer view. Puzzles are typically solved by using inventory items. Clues are often scattered around as text excerpts from classic works of fiction.

A central part of the interface is the "decision star" which is used when interacting with other characters and has three options: "yes", "no" and "what". Depending on the answers, points are added or detracted (being a good person pays off) from the overall score points. Solving puzzles or finding clues also change the score. Some puzzles are optional or have alternate solutions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose between three worlds to explore

title: The Pagemaster

description: Golly! Ghosts! Goal! is a remake of the puzzle game Color Lines featuring characters from Namco's arcade game Golly! Ghost! Like the original Color Lines the game is played on a nine by nine grid where balls of different colours appear. The player attempts to create lines of five or more balls of the same colour which are then removed from the game board. This is done by moving balls around one at a time. New balls will then randomly appear on the board until it is full and no more moves can be made. The aim of the game is simply get the highest score by clearing as many balls as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: More balls appear on the screen

title: Golly! Ghosts! Goal!

description:
Jiji the Cat has been travelling the world looking for the country of fish. One day he lays down to look in the sky, and he notices how much the clouds look like fish. If only he could get the fish down from the sky, maybe he could eat...?

This game is a Breakout-style game. The player uses the mouse to control Jiji the Cat at the bottom of the screen. Bouncing the ball off of fish knocks them down, and collecting a falling fish grants the player a point. Aside from the fish, the player must watch out for rocks; the player loses a life if they try to catch a falling rock.

sample_screenshots.caption: Jiji smiles when the player catches a fish.
The fish fall down after Jiji hits them with a ball; the player gets one point per fish.

title: Jiji's Osakanakuzushi

description:
Jiji the Cat continues on his journey to the land of fish after Jiji's Osakanakuzushi. He sights a flying school of fish and chases them into a deep forest. As he walks deeper he finds himself getting lost; Jiji will need to explore the forest and get to know its residents in order to cross through it.

Jiji and the Mysterious Forest is the first of three child-friendly RPGs in the Jiji series. The player directs Jiji using the mouse cursor and selects options from a mouse-driven menu. It features simple Dragon Quest-style combat and a simplified inventory system.

sample_screenshots.caption: Jiji's portrait changes to show his current health.
The mouse-based battle interface gives the players four options. Who wouldn't want to take lunch during battle?
The game features random battles with dogs.

title: Jiji and the Mysterious Forest: Chapter 1

description:
Jiji the Cat continues on his journey to the land of fish from where chapter 1 left off. After helping Little Red Riding Hood bring a pie to her grandmother in the last game, he travels deeper into the forest to follow the school of flying fish he saw and find his way to the land of fish.

Jiji and the Mysterious Forest is the second of three child-friendly RPGs in the Jiji series. The player directs Jiji using the mouse cursor and selects options from a mouse-driven menu. It features simple Dragon Quest-style combat and a simplified inventory system.

sample_screenshots.caption: Is following that strawberry down a hole really such a good idea, Jiji?
The water's much too deep for a cat!
There are a few paths Jiji can't take in this game.
Jiji invites the player to come back any time when they quit the game.

title: Jiji and the Mysterious Forest: Chapter 2

description: This sequel to Jiji's Osakanakuzushi finds Jiji the Cat taking to the air to find fish to eat. In this sidescrolling shooter, the player controls Jiji using the mouse and meows to stun the fish using the left mouse button. Jiji must dodge rocks and alive fish while collecting the fish that he's stunned with his meows. This is the first Jiji game to feature hand-painted artwork instead of the pixel artwork from earlier entries, and the first to be released under the Katyfraise label.

sample_screenshots.caption: Jiji stuns fish by meowing at them; the fish nearest to Jiji can be caught.
Jiji's meows travel across the screen as a little word balloon.
Start of the game - fish and rocks are flying towards Jiji, and Jiji must collect fish.

title: Jiji no Osakanakuzushi 2

description:
This compilation published under the label of a German TV magazine includes 3 games:

  • Hell: A Cyberpunk Thriller
  • Genesia
  • SuperSki Pro
title: Mega Pack

description:
In the year 2052, in the midst of a world in political crisis, a young man known only as T.C. stumbles into an encounter with a mysterious android named Rema. Built to resemble a young woman, Rema has the capacity to learn and experience human emotions but appears to be a blank slate. T.C. impulsively decides to help her escape from the people who are pursuing her, and they set out on a journey that will shape the person she grows into becoming.

Rema plays like other visual novels; the story is largely linear, and the player is able to choose actions from a mouse-driven menu. The story is presented via detailed traditionally-painted artwork using the character designs of Toyō Ashida and Isamu Imakake, with music by reknowned composers Masahiro Kajihara, Keishi Yonao, Ryū Takami, and the late Ryū Umemoto.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game opens with a view of a space station.
Pulling that capsule out and loading it onto the truck can't have been easy.

title: Rema the Truth

description:
Striker: Occulta Lapis is an adventure game presented in the style of an interactive "talkie" comic book. It is set in a post-apocalyptic future, where the Solar System has been colonized but the Earth lay in a state of decay and abandonment under an authoritarian alien rule. Striker, the protagonist, is an escaped convict who does not even know what he had been imprisoned for and ventures through the ruins of the old world in search of answers.

The game interface is an essential point-and-click on a series of images styled like comic book panels, therefore varying in perspective. Every clickable object can be interacted with in one way only - such as walking, talking or using - with no choice of verbs for the player. A multiple-choice interface governs both the dialogue with NPCs and situations where a problem can be dealt with in more than one way.

The entire game features spoken narration and dialogue (in Italian) throughout.

sample_screenshots.caption: The protagonist, Striker, escapes from prison.
Consulting a terminal in the city archives.
A guard droid sounds the alarm.

title: Striker: Occulta Lapis

description: Command & Fight is an unofficial add-on disc with extra levels for Command & Conquer. The CD also includes several editors, cheats, saves and utilities.
title: Command & Fight

description: Monte Carlo Intimate is an installment of the Virtual Casino series of erotic-themed casino simulations. There are two games available, Roulette and Blackjack. The player starts with 200 chips and gains or loses money in the course of gambling. The player has the option to "tip" the female croupiers — with enough tips, they can be persuaded to strip off their clothes in a video sequence. The croupiers actually cheat every now and then, and if the player suspects foul play, he can accuse them of cheating — catching the girls in the act will trigger a bonus erotic video. A training mode is provided for beginning players.
title: Monte Carlo Intimate

description: SinkSub is an action game which is a variant on Depthcharge. The player controls a battleship, moving left and right on top of the screen, while a number of hostile submarines appears beneath. The player can drop depth charges from the right or the left side of the ship. A depth charge destroys a submarine instantly if it hits, but the charges are rather slow while the submarines move fast so it can be tricky to hit them. A maximum of four charges can be released at a time. The submarines occasionally launch floating mines which move upwards, and if they hit the ship the player loses a life.

sample_screenshots.caption: A plane occasionally appears, reminding you to register
Game over - entering a high score

title: SinkSub

description:
Lucky Charms Memory Machine is a Simon Says type of game in which the player has to repeat an increasingly long pattern, here shown in illuminated marshmallow shapes. It has two difficulty settings and each setting can be played at five speed settings.

A game consists of six rounds, starting with a sequence of three and ending with a sequence of eight. As the player completes each round a portion of "Lucky the Leprechaun" is revealed.

The game is freeware, mouse controlled and recommended for children aged 4 to 8

sample_screenshots.caption: The game plays in the small central window but fills the whole screen
As each round is completed more of the Lucky the Leprechaun's picture is revealed
The game area is the same for both difficulty settings. The player must click on 'Play' to start each round

title: Lucky Charms Memory Machine

description:
David Bellamy's Endangered Wildlife is an educational title which is designed to raise awareness of endangered animals and what the threats to their survival are.

The title comes in three parts;* The first part is the an animated message to the player from the future where animals are scarce and the environment is in trouble

  • The second part is the Discovery Tour in which the player is shown a world map, they click on a continent to get a closer view and this brings up a map with hotspots for a number of animals. Clicking on a creature gives a picture below which are tabs that give details on Habitat, Food, Lifestyle etc
  • The major part of the title is The Discovery Game and for this the player needs to create an identity and sign in so that their progress can be recorded. This starts with a screen showing twenty plus animals whose names are displayed when the mouse cursor rolls over it. Clicking on a creature brings up a screen with a curious tiled grid that is actually a series of cunningly disguised mini games. The object is to remove the tiles and display a picture of the animal beneath;
    • Some tiles just disappear when clicked.
    • Some tiles disappear when the player clicks on and turns over another tile with the same picture as in a Concentration style game
    • Some matching pairs of tiles, the Fun Fact tiles will display a piece of information about the creature before disappearing
    • Other tiles are letter tiles, clicking on one of these highlights a row of tiles and a question appears at the bottom of the screen. When the correct answer is entered, as in a crossword game, the tiles will disappear exposing more of the picture
    • Other tiles uncover a jigsaw, a sliding block puzzle, a word search puzzle or a game of tic-tac-toe.
    • Others present more facts about the creature before they go

The game has four difficulty settings All Easy; Progressive - getting harder the more the game is played; Variable - some easy some hard; All Challenging. Once an animal's picture has been cleared it can be viewed again but the games cannot be replayed by the same player

sample_screenshots.caption: The paler tiles are where the answers to crossword clues go. Clicking on one tile in the row/column brings up a clue in the green bar at the bottom. If answered correctly the tiles are removed

The first title screen.
This is overlaid by a series of animal snapshots until the second title screen appears
When a player has cleared a grid and revealed the animal they cannot go back and play those games again. Of course other players, with a different login can play it
The Discovery Tour: Here Australia has been selected and this gives a choice of two animals

title: David Bellamy's Endangered Wildlife

description:
Boxcars Casino is a single player, mouse controlled, shareware collection of gambling games.

When the player has signed in and set themselves up with a bankroll and a stake the menu gives them access to the following games with Keno being available via the menu bar;* Craps, Baccarat & Roulette: Each of these games plays with three bands of player bet, one uses $5 - $500 bets, another with $20 - $2000 bets and the last with $100 - $10000 bets. Players are only offered all three bands if they are carrying sufficient cash so, for example, a player with just 450 could play in bands one and two but not the third.
Players are given a stack of coins/tokens which they drag onto the table to make their bets.

  • Poker: This offers Five-Card Draw; Five-Card Stud; Seven-Card Stud; Hold 'Em and Dealer's Choice variants of poker. Each can be played with or without wild cards against three or five AI opponents.

  • Slots: The game offers a Regular or Progressive slot machine and a choice of four stakes. The same machine is used for both games but the Regular machine has a single win line while the Progressive machine has three win lines

  • Blackjack: The player can choose between single-deck blackjack; 2-deck blackjack; 4-deck blackjack and 8-deck blackjack with the same three stake bands as are used for Craps etc.

  • Keno: This is not a game that a player can opt to play at will. A Keno game starts every five minutes so, for example, when a hand of poker has finished the player can select the Keno option from the menu bar and, if their timing is right, they can complete a Keno ticket. The game is described in detail in the manual, it supports a standard selection of eight numbers and the use of groups.

Whatever game is in progress when the Keno game starts is suspended as the keno card is displayed alongside the numbers being drawn

The game requires 256 colours and will not play in anything higher. It has three game speeds and the option of No Sound; PC Speaker Sound; or Soundblaster Sound.The main menu sits in the centre of the screen, it is overlaid by a smaller window while the player accesses the bank. Each game plays in a window which replaces the main menu in the centre of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing a game of poker. In between hands a Keno card is being completed
The first screen is the shareware nag screen. No order form was included in the .zip file that contained this game so presumably the complete game was issued and relied on honesty
A game of roulette in progress

title: Boxcars Casino

description: Meet Chuck! Chuck is a five-year-old horse who lives together with his owner Jen. This educational quiz game introduces the player to their lives while also challenging their knowledge of horsemanship. In the primary quiz mode, two horses race around a track. Players take turns answering questions, and their horse moves forward if they answer successfully. The first player to complete a lap wins. Players can also read short stories about Chuck, paired with reading comprehension questions, and view a photo gallery of the real-life Chuck and Jen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu - players name themselves and pick a horse before choosing a game mode.
The main game mode takes place on this racetrack.
Looking at photos of the real Chuck in the gallery.
How up are you on your horse body language?

title: Meet Chuck

description:
A compilation disc containing the following Windows 3.1 games:

BlackOut, Blitzer, Boink!, Brain Games, Castle of the Winds, CuBic, Destroyer, Double Match, DuckHunt, Emlith, Fifteen, Gatling, Ghost Cemetery, Hangman, Jewel Thief, Link Four, MacBlaster, Mah Jongg, Maze Master, Medieval War, MicroMan, Missile Attack, Missile Master, Neko, Paulie Python, Pentonimo, Robots, Runner, Second Conflict, Simon, SinkSub, Skifree, Sokoban, Space Walls, Stellar Empires, Super Snakes, TailGunner, Tank Tracker, The Palace of Deceit, Tiles and Tribulations, War Boats, Warheads, WinAgrams, WinFight, Win Pool, WinRoach, WinShooter, World Empire II,
title: Best of Windows Games: Collection of Favorites for Windows!

description: Bow and Arrow is an arcade game where the player takes on a role of a skilled bowman, on a quest to challenge the dreaded Black Archer. The player can move the archer up and down, and shoot an arrow by clicking. On most levels the goal is either to successfully hit specified moving targets (with a limited number of arrows available) or to survive a wave of dangerous flying objects, which can be avoided or shot down (with an unlimited number of arrows). The player can save in-between each level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 7: shoot down the vultures before they intercept your messenger pigeon

title: Bow and Arrow

description:
Attax95 is a freeware, variant of the Attax game for Windows.

Always starting with a 7x7 board, the rules of the game are always the same. By default, blue color starts. Each turn, a player can either move one of his pieces two spaces away, or clone one of his pieces onto a neighboring cell. If the newly moved or cloned piece ends up adjacent to some enemy pieces, it converts them into its color so that they go under the player's control. You win if, in the end, you have more balls than your opponent.

Attax95 also features a Block Editor Button to design your own block sets.

sample_screenshots.caption: The block editor allows you to create your own board layouts

title: Attax95

description: Box World is a Sokoban variant where the player has to push boxes to get them into designated spots. The boxes will mark in red. Once every box is on a marked spot, the player will go to the next level. Boxes can only be pushed one at a time, so two boxes next to each other cannot be pushed together. If the player gets stuck with the boxes during a level, he can make one move back (using undo), and if he fails, he will need to start the level from the beginning.
title: Box World

description: Da Tang Shi Lu is a game constructed with elements of pure Chinese classical painting style reflected in the story, plot, music and characters. Throughout the game there are puzzles about music, chess, calligraphy and painting. It can also increase the player's knowledge about Chinese traditional culture. The game visuals adopt an authentic Chinese flavor with famous ink landscapes and pieces of calligraphy, coupled with traditional music. A total of 66 Tang poems were used in the game. The game also brings the poetry recitation of ancient literati and Mohists into the game. The dialogue is heavily influenced by poetry and prose as well.
title: Da Tang Shi Lu

description:
Гулливер в стране великанов (Gulliver in the Land of Giants) is a Russian educational game based on the second part of Jonathan Swift's satirical masterpiece best known as "Gulliver's Travels" (1726). These Gulliver's adventures in the land of gigantic proportions contain several modes available from main menu as follows:

  • Animated Audiobook - The player may take a brief look at the original masterpiece's plot.
  • Game (for girl) - The player should control Gulliver in a point-n-click graphic adventure with a mouse, collecting and using the inventory items.
  • Game (for boy) - The player should control Gulliver in a side view arcade with a keyboard, fencing with insects and dwarf's hand.
  • English lesson for digits - The player should point a proper quantity of objects seen on the picture on a request from 1 to 10 in English.
  • English lesson for colors - The player should point a proper color on a request for seven English color names (black, white, red, green, blue, yellow, or brown) .
  • Painting Book - The player can paint a one of five available Gulliver pictures to store or print them later.
  • Audio Drama - The player may listen to the adventures without any visual representation.

sample_screenshots.caption: Adventure Game - Using your magnifying glass to scare the dwarf
Bird has carried the house with Gulliver inside (Russian)
Title Screen and Boy / Girl player selection (Russian)

title: Gulliver v strane velikanov

description:
Nemesis is a vertical scrolling shooter where the player controls a small spacecraft and must shoot incoming asteroids and spacecraft. It takes place in the far future of 2654 where a region of space called the Gamma Sector is under assault by an evil Nemesis Robot and its Dragon Force. The game features a variety of weapons including a laser, plasma cannon, proximity bomb, and missiles. Powerups include weapon upgrades and deflector shields. In total there are nine stages to complete.

This game is unrelated to the Gradius series, which also goes by the name Nemesis in some markets.
title: Nemesis

description: Splatt is an arcade-style action game where the player takes the role of a garbage man named Big Foot. Each level takes place on a city street, where twelve people are throwing garbage out of buildings. Six of those twelve people throw objects that Big Foot is supposed to catch with his garbage can in order to accumulate points. The other six of those people throw garbage that Big Foot should avoid, because it causes the player to lose points or kills the player. Catching a ball with the garbage can allows Big Foot to shoot the ball upwards to hit certain dangerous wildlife such as bees. Other common obstacles include oncoming traffic and beetles. The objective is to complete levels and score as many points as possible before losing all lives.
title: Splatt!

description: SAIL 2000: Yacht Racing Simulator is a sailing simulation. Play against the computer or another player via split screen or internet in training or competition mode. A detailed weather model with a lot of different parameters is being simulated.
title: SAIL 2000: Yacht Racing Simulator

description:
EZ Language is a compilation of six language products, all previously released individually, aimed at teaching Americans basic phrases in preparation for foreign travel. The titles on this disc are;* EZ Language: French

  • EZ Language: German
  • EZ Language: Italian
  • EZ Language: Japanese
  • EZ Language: Russian
  • and EZ Language: Spanish

A single installation process installs all products onto the users machine in a single program group and gives the option of transferring/not transferring the sound files in the process.

sample_screenshots.caption: All six applications install into a single program group. There is no help file and no supporting documentation
The installation screen. Installing the sound files is optional - disc space was scarce back then

title: EZ Language

description:
EZ Language: French is one of a series of language teaching programs aimed at teaching Americans basic phrases in preparation for foreign travel.

All the titles follow the same format. The tutor opens up with a main menu on which there are eight language lessons Basic Phrases; Arrival; Eating Out; Shopping; Sightseeing; Hotel; Public Services and Sports while another eight lessons, Animals; Food; Nature; People; School; Ocean; Essentials and Having Fun, are tucked away on a second menu screen. Each lesson consists of;* Word Drill: There are six tiles on the screen with a picture in each, the word in the foreign language is in a caption strip across the top of the tile while the word in American is in a similar strip across the bottom of the tile. Clicking on a tile triggers a voice-clip of the word being spoken in the foreign language. There are usually two screens/twelve tiles to the Word Drill

  • Phrase Drill: As the name suggests this teaches useful phrases with the foreign language phrase on top and the American equivalent beneath. No pictures this time just caption strips and clicking on the foreign language strip triggers a sound clip of the phrase being spoken

The Word Drill and Phrase Drill sections are repeated up to four times. In between the sections is a picture or a nugget of information such as "Disliked by the french is sauce anglaise 'English sauce', better known as catsup"

During these sections the player can, if appropriately equipped, record and play back their attempt to pronounce the word/phrase they've been taught.

When the lesson is over there are the tests, these start with.

  • Noun Test: A word in the foreign language is in a caption box at the top of the screen while the remainder of the screen holds six picture tiles along with their appropriate American word and the player has to select the tile that matches the supplied word.
  • Phrase Test: Here the caption at the top of the screen is a foreign phrase and beneath it are four American phrases from which the player must select the one which translates as the supplied phrase.

In all tests clicking on the foreign word/phrase triggers a sound clip of it being spoken. If the player answers/guesses correctly they are rewarded with the ding of a bell, incorrect answers get a hooter. The game keeps score and at the end of the round gives a message along the lines of "Seven correct, that's not bad" or "Almost made it. You only missed one."

In all lessons the player has the option of just going through the Nouns and Phrases, i.e. Skipping the tests; Nouns Only; Phrases only; or Tests Only.

sample_screenshots.caption: Phrase Drill. A single phrase per screen
Word Drill: Clicking on the picture tile or either the French or American captions will trigger the sound clip. The Mouth and Ear icons in the lower left are used for record and playback
Noun Test: Find the picture that matches 'le beurre'
Between sections there are pictures or bits of general information. This is a bit of information
Between sections there are pictures or bits of general information. This is a picture, it doesn't look much now but back in the day this was pretty good

title: EZ Language: French

EZ Language: German is one of a series of language teaching programs aimed at teaching Americans basic phrases in preparation for foreign travel.

All the titles in the series follow the same format. The language tutor opens up with a main menu on which there are eight language lessons Basic Phrases; Arrival; Eating Out; Shopping; Sightseeing; Hotel; Public Services and Sports while another eight lessons, Animals; Food; Nature; People; School; Ocean; Essentials and Having Fun, are tucked away on a second menu screen. Each lesson consists of;* Word Drill: There are six tiles on the screen with a picture in each, the word in the foreign language is in a caption strip across the top of the tile while the word in American is in a similar strip across the bottom of the tile. Clicking on a tile triggers a voice-clip of the word being spoken in the foreign language. There are usually two screens/twelve tiles to the Word Drill

  • Phrase Drill: As the name suggests this teaches useful phrases with the foreign language phrase on top and the American equivalent beneath. No pictures this time just caption strips and clicking on the foreign language strip triggers a sound clip of the phrase being spoken

The Word Drill and Phrase Drill sections are repeated up to four times. In between the sections is a picture or a nugget of information such as "Beer is the national beverage of the Germans. Over 1.2000 breweries operate within German borders, more than the rest of Europe put together"

During these sections the player can, if appropriately equipped, record and play back their attempt to pronounce the word/phrase they've been taught.

When the lesson is over there are the tests, these start with.

  • Noun Test: A word in the foreign language is in a caption box at the top of the screen while the remainder of the screen holds six picture tiles along with their appropriate American word and the player has to select the tile that matches the supplied word.
  • Phrase Test: Here the caption at the top of the screen is a foreign phrase and beneath it are four American phrases from which the player must select the one which translates as the supplied phrase.

In all tests clicking on the foreign word/phrase triggers a sound clip of it being spoken. If the player answers/guesses correctly they are rewarded with the ding of a bell, incorrect answers get a hooter. The game keeps score and at the end of the round gives a message along the lines of "Seven correct, that's not bad" or "Almost made it. You only missed two."

In all lessons the player has the option of just going through the Nouns and Phrases, i.e. Skipping the tests; Nouns Only; Phrases only; or Tests Only.

sample_screenshots.caption: Noun Test: Find the picture that matches 'Ehefrau'
Phrase Drill. A single phrase per screen

The main menu.
Clicking on the 'More Lessons' button brings up a second set of lesson tiles.
The clock sets a recording timer
Entire Lesson can be changed to 'Nouns Only' etc

title: EZ Language: German

EZ Language: Italian is one of a series of language teaching programs aimed at teaching Americans basic phrases in preparation for foreign travel.

All the titles in the series follow the same format. The language tutor opens up with a main menu on which there are eight language lessons Basic Phrases; Arrival; Eating Out; Shopping; Sightseeing; Hotel; Public Services and Sports while another eight lessons, Animals; Food; Nature; People; School; Ocean; Essentials and Having Fun, are tucked away on a second menu screen. Each lesson consists of;* Word Drill: There are six tiles on the screen with a picture in each, the word in the foreign language is in a caption strip across the top of the tile while the word in American is in a similar strip across the bottom of the tile. Clicking on a tile triggers a voice-clip of the word being spoken in the foreign language. There are usually two screens/twelve tiles to the Word Drill

  • Phrase Drill: As the name suggests this teaches useful phrases with the foreign language phrase on top and the American equivalent beneath. No pictures this time just caption strips and clicking on the foreign language strip triggers a sound clip of the phrase being spoken The Word Drill and Phrase Drill sections are repeated up to four times. In between the sections is a picture or a nugget of information such as "The Roman hill Capitoline, one of the seven hills Rome was built on, was the centre of ancient Rome and the heart of the classical world. The site of the ancient government there is commemorated by the word capitol to this day"

During these sections the player can, if appropriately equipped, record and play back their attempt to pronounce the word/phrase they've been taught.

When the lesson is over there are the tests, these start with.

  • Noun Test: A word in the foreign language is in a caption box at the top of the screen while the remainder of the screen holds six picture tiles along with their appropriate American word and the player has to select the tile that matches the supplied word.
  • Phrase Test: Here the caption at the top of the screen is a foreign phrase and beneath it are four American phrases from which the player must select the one which translates as the supplied phrase.

In all tests clicking on the foreign word/phrase triggers a sound clip of it being spoken. If the player answers/guesses correctly they are rewarded with the ding of a bell, incorrect answers get a hooter. The game keeps score and at the end of the round gives a message along the lines of "Seven correct, that's not bad" or "Almost made it. You only missed two."

In all lessons the player has the option of just going through the Nouns and Phrases, i.e. Skipping the tests; Nouns Only; Phrases only; or Tests Only.

The clock sets a recording timer
Entire Lesson can be changed to 'Nouns Only' etc

description:
Double Dynamite Video Slots is a single player, shareware slot machine game, it gets is name from the dynamite symbols that appear on the reels.

This is not a simulation of a slot machine game you'd find in a club or a casino, it was designed as a computer game. The game area consists of a 3x3 grid, when the reels spin the player can win if any of the horizontal, vertical or diagonal lines have identical winning symbols. In addition there is a bonus pool which increases with each spin the player makes, this is won of any of the eight pay lines contains three world symbols. There is also a free spin feature if six smiley faces are showing.

When the player lands a winning line they are given the option to either collect or gamble their win. The gamble feature consists of a pyramid of fifteen boxes;* one box will multiply the winnings by five,

  • one will multiply them by three,
  • another will multiply them by two,
  • two will give hints to the top multiplier,
  • three say 'Try Again'
  • and seven contain toilets which lose the player's winnings.

Other options tucked away in the menu bar are the save/load feature, statistics, options to change the banner text; the colour of parts of the screen; borrow money from the bank etc. There is also a comprehensive manual that explains the controls and a winning strategy.

sample_screenshots.caption: There's a comprehensive HELP file that's accessed via the menu bar

The main game screen.
The player clicks on the BET button to add multiple coins per spin
Lots of options hidden away in the menu bar
The game starts with a shareware reminder
The Big Blast Board is where the player gambles their winnings. In this case the player hit a toilet with their first go and lost their recent win. The game then reveal what was in each box
The payout information opens in a new window, here line one has three winning symbols. Now there's a chance to double the winnings (or more)

title: Double Dynamite Video Slots

description:
Extreme Slots is a single player, shareware slot machine game, it is named after the 'extreme sports' symbols that appear on the reels. It is also part of a three game compilation of the same name.

This is not a simulation of a slot machine game you'd find in a club or a casino, it was designed as a computer game. The machine emulates a traditional one arm bandit with a single payout reel. All payouts require three identical symbols, however there is a 'Magic Mover' symbol, effectively a wild symbol, which if it appears above or below a potential winning line will nudge its way onto the line so that the player wins. The game also has a bonus pool which increases with each spin the player makes, this is paid when the player hits the jackpot - three racing cars.

Other options tucked away in the menu bar are the save/load feature, statistics, options to change the colour of parts of the screen, the game's speed; borrow money from the bank etc. There is also a comprehensive manual that explains the controls.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game screen. Lots of options tucked away in the menu bar. The grey 'To Order Call' box changes and can offer more registration options or adverts for other products
The game starts with a shareware registration screen
The game has a comprehensive manual
Although Extreme Slots was released as a functionally limited shareware game it was part of a three game compilation

title: Extreme Slots

description:
Jackpot Slots is a single player, shareware slot machine game. It was released as a functionally limited game and is also part of a three game compilation of the same name.

This is not a simulation of a slot machine game you'd find in a club or a casino, it was designed as a computer game. The machine emulates a traditional one arm bandit with a single payout reel. The big payouts require three identical symbols, however the game will also pay out if one or two cherries appear in the leftmost reels. The game also has a 'Treasure Chest' bonus pot which increases with each spin the player makes, this is paid when the player hits the jackpot - three pots of gold.

Other options tucked away in the menu bar are the save/load feature, statistics, options to change the banner text; the colour of parts of the screen; borrow money from the bank etc. There is also a comprehensive manual that explains the controls.

sample_screenshots.caption: There's a comprehensive manual. It is accessed via the menu bar ans opens in a new window
The game displays a registration reminder when it loads
The game screen. Lots of options tucked away in the menu bar

title: Jackpot Slots

description:
Bonus Wheel Slots is a single player, shareware slot machine game, it is named after the game's bonus feature.

This is not a simulation of a slot machine game you'd find in a club or a casino, it was designed as a computer game. This advertises itself as three games in one; Bonus Fruit; Bonus Bars & Bonus Sevens although it is more like one game with three different sets of symbols. In all games there are three reels with a single payout line, also there is a wild symbol which triggers the bonus reel feature in which the player's stake/winnings can be multiplied by up to twenty-five times.

Other options tucked away in the menu bar are the save feature, options to change the basic stake; the game speed; borrow money from the bank etc. There is also a comprehensive manual that explains the controls.

sample_screenshots.caption: The player can borrow from and repay the bank through this screen
there is a comprehensive game manual, it is accessed via the menu bar and opens in a separate window.
The game loads to a shareware registration reminder screen
The Bonus Bars Slots pay-table. This is accessed via a menu bar option and it tpp opens in a new window on top of the game window

title: Bonus Wheel Slots

description:
Dominate is a board strategy game very similar to Ataxx except it plays on a 8x8 grid and players can only jump over opponents tiles horizontally or vertically, not diagonally. Players cannot jump over the stone pyramids.

The game is played on a 8x8 black board with red and green pieces. There are several board layouts to choose from, with varying starting positions and with stone pyramids in different places.

sample_screenshots.caption: Green lost the game, CPU wins
It's not going well for green, CPU player is dominating
Click options for different board layouts, toggle sound and music
Starting a game, red computer player made a move now it's green's turn

title: Dominate

description:
Tang Chi is a single player, mouse controlled, tangram puzzle game.

The game opens in a window in the centre of the screen, however it is not fixed in this position and can be moved around the screen but it cannot be resized.

Tangram puzzles use seven tiles to create specific patterns and this game is no different. The target pattern is displayed as silhouette in the upper left and the player uses the mouse to position and rotate the tiles to recreate it. All puzzles are timed

sample_screenshots.caption:
The game contains a version of the origins of tangram puzzles that runs to four screens

Demo version

The game uses the keyboard for system operations and the mouse for gameplay

Demo version

The opening game screen. The game does not start with a puzzle pre-loaded

Demo version

title: Tang Chi

description:
Shih Dao is a single player, mouse controlled, shareware, solitaire board game played with tiles. It also goes by the name of Ishido .

The objective is to place all of the tiles onto the board and obtain the highest possible score by following specific rules of play. Tiles can only be placed next to another tile of the same colour or of the same pattern. The player positions them by dragging & dropping with the mouse. As the game area becomes more crowded the player will often have to place a new tile next to two, three or four other times all of which must match in one way or another. This makes the game very strategic in nature as the score for a two-way, three way and a four way match is significant.

The game has sound, a high score table and an undo feature, it will also optionally show available moves.

sample_screenshots.caption: An impressive and possibly perfect score can be achieved by the built-in game demo
The game has an interactive help file which fills the whole screen
The game will optionally show available moves
The beginning of a game. The red stars show the available positions. Putting the next tile (the blue one in the little window - top right) anywhere else will give an error message

title: Shih Dao

description:
Pirate's Plunder is a non-canonical mix of a memory game spiced along with action elements. The main objective of the game is to gather the ten hidden treasures and survive the various dangers along the way.

Movement is tile-based and the player can only move one tile in any direction. Traveling to a hidden tile may reveal a treasure, an enemy, various hazards, helpful items or a blank space. Whenever a enemy is uncovered, a battle automatically starts and the player can only make use of the various weapons available at the time. The player can restock weapons and repair the ship by taking supplies form the nearby islands.

The memory game aspect comes into play due to 3 helpful items: the map which reveals the closest treasure, the sextant which reveals the nearby threats and the spyglass which uncovers a 9x9 portion for a short period. Memorizing these hints offers the player the upper advantage as health pick-ups are limited.

Pirate's Plunder is part of a bundle of games named Fortune Pack. The pack includes four games: Fortune Raiders, Pirate's Plunder, Desert Curse and Cash Quest. Pirate's Plunder and Fortune Raiders were made available as shareware games. Registering the games would have given the user access to the whole pack.

sample_screenshots.caption: Finding a Whirlpool means bad luck. You will lose some of your treasures.
The about screen from the Shareware version of the game.

title: Pirate's Plunder

description:
Mankind has almost completed its exploration of outer space, and has established base stations on various planets. These base stations send out super-modern explorer ships to distant, unknown planets in order to discover and exploit the raw materials which are becoming scarce an earth.

You are on board of one of these explorer ships with a perfectly conceived life support system, as it takes off to search for valuable raw materials in the solar system »Wassili 1«.

The adventure starts: take up your position an the bridge, head for the solar system, send out probes to the four planets which circle around the central star »Wassili 1«, and bring back samples from the planets for examination an board. The super-modern spaceship laboratory contains all appliances and utensils required for chemical analysis of the raw materials.

A laboratory manual is available at any time to provide detailed information about all basic chemicals, metals, non-metals, gases, chemical analysis methods and test structures. Here you can also learn the ten basic rules for safe experimenting. You will receive danger warnings and all the information required for correct, appropriate disposal of the waste products developed during your examination.

Surprising results in your laboratory work and unexpected happenings an board your explorer ship will provide you with many hours of excitement an your journey of discovery to the solar system »Wassili 1«.

sample_screenshots.caption: Should we go to this planet?
Drone is returning from the planet to our spaceship with a probe on board. It will be transferred to the laboratory automatically.
Would you like to send a drone to the planets surface?
Welcome to start a new journey to a solar system far far away.

title: Kosmosoft Chemistry

description:
Kosmosoft Physics is very similar to Kosmosoft Chemistry in concept. The game is about teaching basics about physics to a young audience. The player has to analyse physical phenomenas.

The player's objective is to travel in a as short as possible time span with a set amount of energy and below a defined level of pollution caused by his means of transportation in the fictional country of Kosmoland. The destination can be reached via several vehicles on earth, through the air or on the water. During his travel the player is challenged with several tasks about physic as civil engineering, hydrodynamics, electricity, optical science etc. When the player is successful in solving his challenges, the inhabitants of Kosmoland will provide him some gifts and he can go faster to his destination. But there is always the possibility of an unexpected surprise or obstacle that will complicate the trip through Kosmoland.
title: Kosmosoft Physics

alternate_titles.description: original German title of the 1st release
alternate_titles.title: Miniatur-Golf

description: Minigolf is a classic mini golf simulation. You can choose to play on your own or have a challenge for up to four human players. Seven sets of courses are provided.

sample_screenshots.caption: These courses are part of the London set.
Vents can make the ball fly through the air in a direction. This is sometimes quite useful.
An archeologist would say: X marks the spot (to open the little gate.

title: Minigolf

description:
An adaption of the game show, Wheel of Fortune features over 5,000 different puzzles with full motion video of Vanna White and also digitized video of the contestants, The game show is actually hosted by Vanna White herself.

Players can compete against two other human or computer players. The computer players have three difficulty options to pick from (slow, average, or smart).

Gameplay revolves around what is to be expected from spinning the wheel and picking letters in order to solve the puzzle. Spinning the wheel is done automatically, the player just has to choose how much power they want to spin it with simply by clicking on a spot on a spin meter. The game records the ten highest earnings for posterity. Also winning three separate games will enshrine the player in the "Wheel Hall of Fame".

sample_screenshots.caption: Vanna welcomes you to the game
The final game results are displayed
Solve allows you to type in the missing letters
Vanna uncovers the letters as they are filled in
Charlie knew the word and won the prize (not specified unfortunately)

title: Wheel of Fortune

description: Sorority House is an adult-themed adventure game that presents using a "choose your own adventure"-type interface. You play the role of a fraternity pledge who needs to infiltrate a sorority and obtain certain specific items. You need to avoid security guards, the house mother, and for some reason, a pool boy.
title: Sorority House

description:
Windows Yahtzee is a mouse-controlled, shareware implementation of the classic board game. This game can be played by up to six players. In each match the players' objective is to get the highest score across three concurrent scoreboards, shown as three columns on the player's scorecard. The highest total for all three columns wins the game.

Players click on a cup to roll the dice, then they drag-and-drop the dice to be re-rolled back into the cup and do it again for a maximum of three rolls per turn. The game scores in three columns for each player and scores can be added into any vacant column whenever the player wishes. For example, suppose a player rolled four identical dice in their turn and added their total into the first 'Four of a Kind' column, if on their next turn they rolled another four of a kind they could add it into the second 'Four of a Kind' column. There is no requirement to complete column one before adding scores into columns two or three.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game comes with a comprehensive help file which opens in a new window
A player's scorecard at the start of a game, they click on the cup to roll the dice
At the start of the game the number of players and their names must be specified
When all entered have been added the winner is announced in a separate window

title: Windows Yahtzee

alternate_titles.title: Explora el Barco y Conviértete en Polizón

description:
Stowaway!: Stephen Biesty's Incredible Cross-Sections is an educational CD-ROM title. It provides a visual cross-section explosive view of an 18th century British naval ship. Slicing the warship vertically into ten, finely-detailed sections (Bow, foremast, belfry, forehatch, amidships, waist, main mast, mizzen, aft and stern) and cutting each of those sections horizontally by deck level (hold (bilge), orlop, lower/middle/upper deck, forecastle, quarter deck, poop deck, mast/sails), users could explore each and every part of the ship, and examine life on board a 1700s man-of-war empirical military vessel at the height of its powers.

Gameplay elements are introduced by having to locate stowaways on the ship, hiding somewhere in the scenery.

sample_screenshots.caption: The effect of a direct hit
The incredible detail each cross-section goes into. Every deck of every slice of the man-o-war goes into great detail about life onboard the ship
Choose the cross-section of ship you want to explore
Congratulations! You've found each sighting of the stowaway. Now you must chase him into his hidey-hole, and rat him out.
The grisly, grotesque section of the surgeon's operating theatre, showing the primitive medical procedure of amputation (where dismembered limbs were chucked into a bucket)

title: Stowaway!: Stephen Biesty's Incredible Cross-Sections

description:
Gateway 2000 was included with Gateway 2000 PCs as a restore disc for use if the system needs to be reinstalled. This OEM bundle contains a set of otherwise ordinary product installers like one would find on a retail bundle CD. The products included are:* Microsoft Dinosaurs

  • Microsoft Arcade 1.0
  • Microsoft Publisher 2.0
  • Microsoft Publisher Design Pack 1.0
  • Microsoft Entertainment Pack for Windows
  • Microsoft Entertainment Pack 2
  • Microsoft Entertainment Pack 3
  • Microsoft Entertainment Pack 4
title: Gateway 2000

description: Piper is an adaptation of the Pied Piper of Hamelin. It moves the action to the Old West, following a piper who takes on the job of ridding the town of Midas Valley of rats. When the rats find the map to a secret gold treasure, the rat hunt turns into a race to see who can find the gold treasure first. Divided into four TV-style episodes, Piper plays mostly non-interactively with short mini-games at key parts of the story.
title: Piper

description:
Fortune Raiders is a game of luck in which the players take turns to uncover hidden treasures. The main objective of the game is to be the fastest spelunker to reach the 1 million dollar mark.

The gameplay is turn-based and takes place in 16x16 object screens. Each object hides treasures, items or various forms of danger. Every step is against the odds as the treasures collected are not safe until the player leaves the screen. Once both players have exited the cave (or when one of them uncovers the bomb), a new screen is generated and the race goes on.

Fortune Raiders is part of a bundle of games named Fortune Pack. The pack includes four games: Fortune Raiders, Pirate's Plunder, Desert Curse and Cash Quest. Fortune Raiders and Pirate's Plunder were made available as shareware games. Registering the games would have given the user access to the whole pack.

sample_screenshots.caption: When the bomb explodes the round resets instantly (loosing your active site money).

title: Fortune Raiders

description:
Astor, an alien from the planet McMars, makes first contact with Ronald McDonald and his friends in order to request permission to land and explore McDonaldland. Unfortunately, his spaceship collides with "the first dinosaur in space" on his way and crashes on Earth with his spacecraft in pieces. Ronald and friends step in to help out, setting out on a mission to locate all of the pieces of the spaceship.

This point-and-click adventure game features a heavy focus on minigames. The player character moves around the screen on their own, following the player's cursor. Each area features a different player character, giving the player the chance to control the whole cast. Players can click on various items around the screen to interact with them. Aside from the McDonald's hub restaurant, players can travel to four different areas, each of which has its own minigame and a piece of the spaceship to find. After collecting all the pieces of the ship, players can then travel to McMars.

sample_screenshots.caption: Astor makes his way to Earth...
North Pole. Yep, Santa is here.
This little interactive calendar lets players see events and holidays from Australia or New Zealand.
Okay, why is Ronald awake this late?
Dinosaur Island. That's one big dino.

title: Mission to McDonaldland

description: This simple children's adventure game has players accompanying Ronald and other McDonalds characters through different locations in McDonaldsland. It features simple puzzles and various mini-games.
title: Adventures Through McDonaldland

description:
This compilation contains the first two games in the Virtual Murder series:

  • Who Killed Sam Rupert: Virtual Murder 1
  • The Magic Death: Virtual Murder 2
title: The Virtual Murder Mystery Series

description: In Reading Blaster: Invasion of the Word Snatchers the evil Illitera has robbed the Earth of its words and the Galactic Commander has sent Blasternaut and Spot to stop her and retrieve the stolen words. There are five mini-games included in the game. First leaking letters must be collected in a shooter mini-game, while collecting fuel and warding off fuel suckers in order to board Illteria's ship. Once on board, the player must coordinate creatures in a complex, dispose of splatterpods and pass an alien-filled maze. Finally an instructions mini-game must be completed so Blasternaut can infiltrate the control room and capture Illitera.
title: Reading Blaster: Invasion of the Word Snatchers

alternate_titles.title: Alicia en el País de las Maravillas

description: Based on Lewis Caroll's classic novel published in 1865, in this video game adaptation of Alice in Wonderland Alice travels through a strange world different from her own. This interactive animated storybook game was created using Klik & Play and contains four mini-games and John Tenniel's book illustrations. Each page of the storybook has clickable, interactive surprises. There is also an option for the book to be read automatically. It is the first entry in the publisher's Living Classics series.
title: Alice in Wonderland

description:
Pop superstar Julia has chosen to cryogenically freeze herself to wait for a musical director who is worthy of her talents. Prove your musical prowess and awaken Julia by completing the game's 41 musical tests!

The Music In Me is a rhythm game aimed towards young children; the player is challenged to replay melodies on their computer keyboard by following on-screen cues. The game's most unique feature lies in its story elements, which allow the player to explore cartoonishly styled 2D environments and click on various objects to see humorous animations. Players occasionally have to solve simple puzzles to unlock more instruments to play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Octave mentions wanting to visit Julia with some frozen foods, and the player is given control of the cursor.
The game's first musical mini-game. The gameplay is a keyboard based rhythm game, where the player hits the buttons at the times they reach the onscreen indicators.
It is up to YOU to prove your worth in music and have Julia return
We managed to create a new room exit.
A flute mini-game similar to the previous Harmonica game, only using more keyboard keys.

title: Music Chase 1: The Music In Me

description: CyberXperience is an adult first-person action title in which you take part as the personal cyborg of Nikie in order to help her recover her sexuality. Nikie is trapped on a secret base located on "one of Jupiter's planets". She is the result of generic experimentation and has been stripped away of any sexual desire.
title: CyberXperience

description: How to be Perfect is an FMV trivia game hosted by Bobcat Goldthwait. Your goal is to graduate from Perfect University and become Mr. Perfect by answering 20 questions. The categories are dating, health and hygiene, manners, relations, school and office, and family. The questions are made from clips of old public domain training films, where a part of the clip is cut off and you need to fill in the correct blank. Answering the question correctly will resume the clip, improve your character's look, and progress you towards becoming Mr. Perfect. Answering the question wrong will resume the clip with obviously dubbed dialog and make your appearance worse.

sample_screenshots.caption: This happens when we choose the wrong answer
We have to answer the question

title: How to be Perfect

description: Peter Pan is an interactive storybook made up of nine chapters based on J. M. Barrie's book. Each chapter has pages with picture backgrounds, animations, narration, sounds, clickable objects and definitions for difficult words. There are also four mini-games including "Marooners' Rock" (pop quiz), "Tinkerbell's Tasks" (puzzle), "Fairydust Fantasia" (multi-directional shooter) and "Woodland Challenge" (action). Lastly the player can play the audio on a CD player.
title: Peter Pan

description: Based on Mark Twain's 1876 story, Tom Sawyer's adventures take him from truancy to treasure hunting. This interactive animated storybook game was created using Klik & Play and contains a single game made up of three mini-games. Every page inside the interactive book has clickable, interactive surprises as well as definitions for difficult words. Some pages contain hidden mini-games. There is also an option for the book to be read automatically and a bookmark for the player to get back to the most recently read page.
title: Tom Sawyer

description: Based on Victor Hugo's 1831 story, Quasimodo and Esmeralda withstand the hardships and cruel world of 15th century Paris. The interactive animated storybook game was created using Klik & Play. Each page of the storybook has clickable, interactive surprises and sometimes a hidden mini-game. There is also an option for the book to be read automatically. It is the last entry in the publisher's Living Classics series.
title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame

description: This take on the fairy tale "The Gingerbread Man" is designed for children aged 3 to 6 years, which teaches them how to read and connect spoken with written words. Narrated by English actress Daphne Oxenford, the game incorporates Klik and Play. Each page comes with objects that react to being clicked, text that can be re-read and has an easy interface to navigate through the storybook.
title: The Gingerbread Man

description: This adaptation of the fairy "Goldilocks and the Three Bears" is designed for children aged 3 to 6 years, teaching them the concept of reading and relating spoken words with written ones. The game is narrated by English actress Daphne Oxenford and was created using Klik & Play with an easy to navigate interface. Each page comes with objects that can be clicked for interaction as well as re-readable text.
title: Goldilocks and the Three Bears

description: Uncle Julius and the Anywhere Machine takes the protagonist on an adventure to visit the residence of Uncle Julius and find the missing scientist with the aid of his latest invention - The Anywhere Machine. The player will travel into different dimensions including Inimica, the Desert World, the Island World and the Monastery. The game requires the player to explore rooms, solve puzzles, collect items and ducats. Whenever a puzzle seems difficult, there is a hint system to clue the player on the solution.
title: Uncle Julius and the Anywhere Machine

description: Venture is both a utility and a video game. It comes with an editor for making your own adventures (savable and playable if registered) and also comes with a couple of ready made adventures: The Caverns of Makalu which focuses on treasure hunting and Starbase Varga which is about surviving an alien invasion . The mechanics in the game consist of octagonal rooms, 9-square grid to interact in each part of a room, a dialogue system for interacting with characters, enemies, a simple combat system, an elaborate inventory system and certain programmed puzzles in the adventure.
title: Venture

description: Mamba 2 is a variant of QIX. You control a small spider that needs to fill a certain percentage of the screen by drawing rectangles. The screen is also populated by one or more snakes which can destroy the spider as well as the thread it spins (as in: the line it draws).
title: Mamba 2

description:
Addit is a collection of four mouse controlled solitaire card games in which cards are removed from the play area if they total a specific number.

The games in this collection are:* Tens: The cards Ace through to nine are removed in pairs that total ten. The ten of any suit is discarded on its own while the jack, queen and king are discarded in a three card sequence. The pairs of cards can be cards of mixed suits while the run of jack-queen-king must all be of the same suit. * Elevens: In this game cards are discarded in pairs of cards that total eleven, six and five; ten and ace etc. Jacks, queens and kings are removed by collecting one of each, neither the pairs nor the jack-queen king trios need to be in the same suit.

  • Thirteens: This is a more common form of solitaire. The cards Ace through to Queen are removed in pairs of the same suit that total thirteen eight and five; Queen and Ace etc. Kings are removed on their own
  • Fifteens: The cards Ace through to nine are discarded in groups (not pairs) of same suited cards that total fifteen. The remaining cards Ten-Jack-Queen-King are removed in runs of four cards also of the same suit

All games are scored but there is no high score table and the scores are not preserved.

sample_screenshots.caption: When the game loads the play area remains blank until a game option has been selected. The choice of games is made via the Games drop down menu in the upper left of the screen
Tens: The high cards are removed in a run that must be of the same suit
There is an in-game help file. It opens in a separate window
Fifteens: groups of cards must total fifteen

title: Addit

description:
Black Jack is a simple, single player implementation of the popular casino card game.

This game plays in a fixed sized window starts the player off with a $1000 stake. The game configuration options are;* play with one, two, four or an infinite number of decks - one deck is the default setting

  • A slow deal - this is not enabled by default
  • Dealer hits soft 17 - this is not enabled by default
  • Starting cash of $100. $500 or $1000 - $1000 being the default setting

There are no alternate card backs, no save function and no record of wins/losses is kept by the game.

sample_screenshots.caption:
Pairs can be split.
Some you win, some you lose
All player interaction is made by clicking on the grey control s at the bottom of the screen
There is an in-game help file

title: Black Jack

description:
Checker Board Puzzles is a collection of jigsaw-like puzzles in which the player has to arrange a thirteen or fourteen pieces to create a standard eight by eight checker board. Pieces can be dragged into position and rotated with the mouse though the rotation can only be done before the piece is placed on the board.
The game has a save/load feature

sample_screenshots.caption: There are ten puzzle sets. Whether there is more than one puzzle per set is not known 'coz I couldn't solve any
A better attempt but still rubbish
There is an option to change the colour. This attempt completely ignores the checker board pattern
There is in-game help, it opens in a separate window

title: Checker Board Puzzles

description:
Worm War is a single player, freeware game Centipede game.

The player has five lives and moves around the screen firing upwards all the time. New centipedes appear at the top left corner of the tree strewn game area and make their way down the screen changing direction when they encounter an obstacle. When shot each centipede will break into two pieces. Trees can also be destroyed but they will regenerate. It is the player's task to destroy the centipede and any other falling nasties to score points.

There is no sound, no high score table and no save game option.
title: Worm War

description:
Winvade is a shareware, Space Invaders variant from Australia.

As with the original game the player controls a vertically firing canon which they can move horizontally across the bottom of the screen, the object being to shoot the descending alien hordes before the land.

This implementation of the game has a couple of novel twists:* because screen sizes vary the developer has provided a scaling option which can be used to make the game area two, three or four times larger than normal

  • the game has a choice of craft;
    • Traditional - which look similar to the original Space Invader craft
    • Modern - a new kind of happy little alien
    • Microsoft - which uses Windows, or Windows-like, icons instead of the descending aliens and Bill Gates' head as the bonus alien craft.

The game records a single high score for each session but it is reset for each new session. The game does have sound but this is limited to an electronic pop when the gun fires and a series of pops when the alien(s) land.

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing using the Classic craft and a scaling factor of two
This shows the game about to start. The default settings use the Modern space ships and a scaling factor of one
A close-up look at the Modern craft using a scaling factor of four

title: Winvade

description:
3-D Tic Tac Toe is a game in which the player plays against the computer in a tic-tac-toe game. The objective being to place four counters in a nine horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

The game is mouse controlled and player may can choose to play first or second as either 'X' or 'O'. The game does not record the number of victories for the machine or the player.

sample_screenshots.caption:
The game boards before a match commences
The game can be played in a smaller window but the developer's notes say this may cause a problem

title: 3-D Tic Tac Toe

description:
Maze Master is a single player, mouse controlled, shareware maze game.

This is quite literally a mouse controlled game because once a maze is drawn the player uses the mouse to guide a mouse through it. There are four difficulty levels Beginner; Intermediate; Expert and Monster, a high score table which records the best time/score for each player, an option to watch the computer solve the maze and another option to print mazes to solve with pencil and paper.

sample_screenshots.caption:
The player completes the maze by left clicking and dragging the mouse to the exit
There's a bonus score for a quick completion on the left that runs down very quickly.
The game records each player's best scores
Some of the in-game configuration options

title: Maze Master

description:
Windows Command is a single player, mouse controlled, Missile Command variant.

In this game the player must use their stock of Patriot XXXX missiles to defend their cities from waves of attacking Klingons. The game has sound, a high score table and four levels of difficulty, as the game progresses those dastardly Klingons may send it stealth bombers and starships..

sample_screenshots.caption: The shareware version of the game is free and limited

title: Windows Command

description:
CuBiC is a single player, shareware, Rubik's Cube game.

The player starts with a standard cube and selects the 'Scramble' option from the menu and waits while the game does its job of messing the cube up. Then the player has to unscramble the cube or ask the game to solve it for them. The game is mouse or keyboard controlled, it allows the player to change the cube's colours and it has a manual save.

sample_screenshots.caption: The colours on the cube can be changed
The cube can be rotated and/or manipulated by both keyboard and mouse
The game has a manual save option

title: Cubic

description:
Wa-Tor is a shareware population simulation game.

The game is based on an article in A. K. Dewdney's 'Computer Recreations' column in the December 1984 issue of Scientific American entitled Sharks and fish wage an ecological war on the toroidal planet Wa-Tor. The game starts with a population of fish and sharks. The player can adjust the age at which each species breeds and reproduce and how long a shark can go without feeding before it will starve. These factors determine how fast each population grows and is eaten. The object of the game is to tinker with these parameters and find a stable population dynamic.

The game is played using the mouse and there are usually two windows present, the main window and one of the graphs which monitor population, age profile and predator/prey ratios

sample_screenshots.caption: The game is shareware and so starts with a payment reminder
Other graphs are available, all graphs are optional
The game has an accompanying help file which opens in a separate window. This is the page that describes the game and its origins.
The game starts with two windows, the main game area and the population graph

title: Wa-Tor

description:
Tiles and Tribulations is a shareware, single player, keyboard controlled, falling block puzzle.

The player is faced with a game area in which there blocks fall relentlessly from the top of the screen. Each block is coloured and the player must catch them using a paddle which they can move horizontally via the keyboard. The paddle can hold five tiles only but as well as catching tiles the player can also place tiles in the bins beneath the paddles. By dropping tiles into the bins to make columns, rows or diagonals of the same colour the player scores points.

The full game has fifty levels each with its own specific goal. The player has three lives and they lose one life for every tile that is not caught.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game has a help file that opens in a new window.
The game is shareware and this is the nag screen that is shown at the beginning
The title screen and main menu. A welcome message and the game's credits scroll right to left across the central white bar
Game Over! The bins are full.

title: Tiles and Tribulations

description:
Tank Tracker is a single player, shareware, mouse controlled shooter.

In this game the player sits inside a tank and destroys other tanks by clicking on them with the mouse, much like a Whac-A-Mole game. The game plays in a small, fixed sized window and has four different .wav file sound effects.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen and shareware reminder. The same screen is displayed on exit

A game in progress.
Despite the dials the player's tank does not move. Enemy tanks appear and the player must click on them to shoot them

title: Tank Tracker

description:
World Empire II is the forerunner of World Empire III and World Empire IV and aside from having fewer features it plays in much the same way. The game can be played with another person or against the computer. It consists of just two screens, the World Screen Map which is where all computer play takes place and the Continent Screen Map which is where the player fights individual battles.

It is the first version of the game to play under Windows and features one hundred and thirty-nine countries, double that of the previous version. This is a shareware Risk-like game in which the player starts as the ruler of one country and sets out to rule the world playing against up to six computer opponents at once.

In this game world opinion has coalesced into four political movements The Populist Movement; The Militarist Ideology; The Socialist Ideology and The Realist Movement. The player starts the game with fifty-six divisions in a random country and expands by conquering and assimilating other countries. The player starts the game having been assigned to one of the four main political movements. A randomly selected number of other countries around the world are also assigned to the same movement, these are not allies but they will be easier to conquer than countries aligned with opposing movements.

sample_screenshots.caption: On aborting the game my general is cast away on a desert island
Each human player is assigned to a political movement

A game in progress
Note the grey buttons beside each continent, clicking on them brings up the relevant continent map
The title screen and shareware reminder

title: World Empire II

description:
Fortress is a single player, shareware, wave shooter.
