The player is in a fortified base on a distant planet which they must defend against enemy walkers that approach from all directions. The game display tells the player that an enemy is approaching from a bearing xxx degrees and the player has to rotate their turret and destroy the attacker before moving on to the next target. The turret is rotated with the left/right arrow keys and the mouse is used select and aim the guns.
The game has three levels of difficulty, optional sound but no save game feature and no high score table - at least not in the shareware version.

sample_screenshots.caption:
A game in progress.
The enemy walkers are very very small targets in the central window
The game has three levels of difficulty and optional sound
This is a shareware game so when the game starts up the unregistered player is held here for around ten seconds or so
There is an in-game help file that explains everything

title: Fortress

description:
Merlin: The Quest For The Wand is a game in which the player takes on up to three AI players on board game like quest.

In this game the computer rolls a dice and the player(s) can move that number of spaces around the game map but only in one direction. The object of the game is to travel around the map of the islands opening treasure chests looking for Merlin's wand which they must then take back to the blue castle to win the game.
On level one the players search the map for a specific treasure , a key, which they must take to 'The Gate Of Billium' which will open level two. Level two plays in exactly the same way but this time the search is for the wand.

Treasure chests can only be opened when the player lands on them - it is not enough to just pass over them. Chests may be empty or they may contain gold or silver bars which are used to pay for things in the game such as travelling on a ship between islands An added complication that if one player lands on top of another then they rob that player of all they are carrying so finding the wand is one thing but keeping it and getting home safely is another.

sample_screenshots.caption: The player has landed on a treasure chest
A game in progress. Look hard - the player is the light blue dot below the blue castle above and to the right of the centre

title: Merlin: Quest for the Wand

description:
Solitaire Golf is a single player, mouse controlled, charity-ware card game.

Golf Solitaire is a simple, classic solitaire game in which cards are disposed of based on number only, the suits being irrelevant in this game It starts with thirty-five cards dealt face up, seven columns of five cards. The player then turns the cards from the pile of remaining cards over one at a time. These cards are used to match to the face-up cards and hopefully clear runs of cards in one go. Card matching is best explained by example; so if a ten is turned over from the card stack it would match to either a nine or a jack on the rows of turned cards. If the player matches to a jack then they can either match that to another ten or to a queen among the face up cards. This process is repeated until there are no more cards that match.

This game has no scoring system and no sound.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen and charity ware nag notice
There is a choice of card back

title: Solitaire Golf

description:
Stellar Explorer is a single player, shareware Star Trek variant, based on a game from the early 1970's. In this implementation the player commands the USS Enterprise and must explore a universe map consisting of 10x10 quadrants where each quadrant has 10x10 sectors. Within these sectors are enemy ships which must be destroyed and star-bases where a damaged ship can be repaired and re-provisioned.
The aim of the game is to rid space of the enemy scourge and liberate the galaxy

sample_screenshots.caption:
The game area
All the buttons on the left are duplicated in drop down menus
In the right hand grid we are the grey ship and the red ship are the bad guys
There is a detailed help file
A starbase has been located. Soon we'll be repaired and will have a full complement of torpedoes
This is the shareware version so naturally it starts with a nag screen

title: Stellar Explorer

description:
Space Interceptor is a shareware, single player Asteroids game produced using Klik & Play'

The shareware version of the game has five levels whereas the full, registered, 'Deluxe' version of the game has fifteen levels, cheat codes additional weapons and aliens.

The game is keyboard controlled, the arrow keys move the ship and the CTRL key fires the weapons. To progress to the next level the player must survive the aliens, mines, meteors and destroy the 'Warp Pod'

sample_screenshots.caption: The full game has more levels and features

We must be doing something right because this is the next zone

Shareware version

The game begins
The ship is just visible in the centre of the screen

Shareware version

The screen quickly becomes more crowded

Shareware version

title: Space Interceptor

description:
Jackpot Jubilee is a single player, shareware, slot machine game.

The shareware version of the game has a single, traditional, three reel fruit machine with a single pay-line whereas the full registered version has three differently themed machines and a reel hold option. The game screen shows the machine being played in the centre while to the right is the player's stack of coins, the player clicks on a coin to transfer it to the machine so that they can play. An unusual feature of this game is the way cash is paid out, if/when a player wins and collects their cash the coin stack on the right is updated immediately while the coins collected do a little dance across the bottom of the screen before eventually disappearing.

The game is played with the mouse and has optional sound effects

sample_screenshots.caption: There is a detailed help file. It an be accessed while playing the game , it opens in a new window

title: Jackpot Jubilee

description:
Super Concentration is a single player, mouse controlled memory game in which the player has to match pairs of cards in order to clear the deck and win the game.

The game has four levels of difficulty based on the number of cards dealt;* Level 1 has eighteen cards

  • Level 2 has twenty-eight cards
  • Level 3 has thirty-six cards
  • Level 4 has fifty-two cards

Levels one and two were released as shareware.

sample_screenshots.caption:
As pairs of the same rank are uncovered they are removed from the game area

Shareware Version

The start of a level one game

Shareware Version

A level two game in progress

Shareware Version

title: Super Concentration

description:
WinPoker is a single player, mouse controlled, shareware, video poker game.

The shareware game is a simple jacks or better game whereas the full registered version has an alternate card back and seven more game variations Jokers Wild - Two pairs or better; Deuces Wild; Tens or better; Bonus Poker; Aces and Eights; Jokers Wild - Kings or better; Deuces and Jokers Wild all with an optional double up feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can change the window color (v1.0)
The game opens with a shareware reminder

title: WinPoker

description:
Ecneuqes is 'Sequences' backwards. This is a single player, mouse controlled, card driven version of five-in-a-row with two skill levels.

The player is playing against the computer. Players are dealt six cards each and have a game area on which there are pictures of all the cards in the deck (except the jacks because they are wild). Players take turns to play a card from their hand and for each card they play they place a token onto the game area. The first player with two lines of five tokens is the player that wins.

Jacks are wild and can be used to remove an opponents token but the player who laid the jack cannot play one of their tokens until their next turn.

sample_screenshots.caption:
Game Over!
There are two difficulty settings and This was the Beginner setting
I have a row of five in the lower left - but only because the Joker cells are free

The game starts with a shareware reminder

Unregistered version

title: Ecneuqes

description:
Topsy And Tim Go To School is an educational title for children aged four to seven years old. The title consists of a number of activities;* The Story: There are two story activities, in the first the player reads trough the story page by page from start to end while the second activity allows the player to access any of the fifteen pages individually

The story itself is a short, positive, story about Topsy and her brother Tim and their first day at school. Each page has a couple of short sentences on it which can be read by the child, adult or by the game. Many pages have interactive hotspots so, for example, when they enter the classroom the player can click on the clock and watch the hands move round, or on items on the table and watch eggs hatch, the snail move, flowers wilt and grow back etc. It's effectively a guide for pre-schoolers showing what they can expect.

  • Jigsaws: There are five jigsaws to be played but these are not traditional jigsaws. Players pick a picture from a many and when it is shown on the screen the picture is still more or less whole but several shaped pieces have been removed and it is the player's task to replace them. This is a game for young children so all the pieces are shaped differently - there's only one star, one circle etc.

To play the game the player clicks on a piece and it is then 'stuck' to the mouse cursor so there's no need to hold the mouse button down while dragging the piece into position.

  • Painting: This activity has seven line drawings from the story and some simple point and click painting tools
  • Games: There are two games available. The first is a Rock-Paper-Scissors game which can be played as a one or a two player game. The two player game makes use of a single screen so player one makes their selection and a curtain comes down to cover up their part of the screen. Player two then makes their selection which is also covered by a curtain then the game reveals both player's choices and there's a short animation as the winning character (on screen) jumps up and down.
    The single player game is played the same way with the computer making their selection without waiting for the player.

The second game is a weighing game in which the player picks up objects with the mouse and tries to find two that weigh the same. The range of objects is quite diverse a pen, newspaper, bunch of grapes, sausage, light bulb etc.

The game does not transfer the contents of the CD to the player's computer, the installation process just creates a program group with links to the programs on the disc.

sample_screenshots.caption: This scene really dates the game. The books were written in the 1950's when free school milk was available. This was stopped in the 1970's way before the game was developed
Paper-Scissors-Stone: A two player game has been selected. Topsy has made her choice - it's hidden behind the curtain
Basic instructions. Once this section is opened the player must continue until the EXIT button appears
The Choose A Game selection screen

title: Topsy and Tim Go to School

description:
Diamco is a puzzle game in which the players must arrange the letters scattered around the level into the target word(s), built from left to right or top to bottom.

Letters can be moved in any of the four cardinal directions but will only stop when coming in contact with another letter or a wall. Letters can be selected either by clicking on them with the mouse or with the Tab key (or Shift + Tab to cycle backwards) and moved with either the mouse or the arrow keys.

A limited version of the game was distributed as shareware and contained only 6 levels, compared to 60 for the registered version.
title: Diamco

description: Extreme Chess is a chess game based on the famous Fritz chess engine. The main drew is the ability to compete against the engine in game, but a detailed analysis is also provided for every move. Tournament conditions are simulated through a clock. The game contains a database of 50,000 games annotated by chess grandmasters. There are search options and filters for the games, to look up games based on the player, tournament year, annotator, ranking and more. There is an option to expand the database further through an internet connection.
title: Extreme Chess

description: Wesoła Układanka is a typical puzzle game for kids. The game includes 10 different puzzles, with 2 difficulty levels (10x10 and 20x20). New pictured may be purchased after completing all the pictures available. The game uses adjustable window with drop down menu system.
title: Wesoła Układanka

description:
This compilation contains three games:

  • Schiffe versenken (Battleships)
  • Minenfelder (Mine Fields)
  • Grid War

Schiffe versenken is a version of the classical Battleship game. 5 ships with lengths from 1 to 5 will be randomly placed on a 15x15 grid. Now both the computer and the player will try to find the opponent's ships by clicking on any of the fields. Hits and misses will be marked accordingly. The first player to sink all enemy ships has won.

In Minenfelder, the player has to cross a grid of 20x20 fields and reach the other side without hitting randomly placed mines. It's possible to choose from three different vehicles (varying in the amount of mines the player can hit before the vehicle is destroyed) and select the difficulty. The vehicles contain a radar which indicates when one (yellow) or more than one (red) mine is located within one of the 9 adjacent fields. The vehicles also provide a one-time use mine detector, showing the position of the mines for a very short time.

In contrast to the other two games, Grid War is a real-time game: on a 17x20 field, the player has to shoot the opponent. The ship will move between grid fields, the direction will only be changed when the ship has reached the center of a field. As it will take some time to completely move to the next field, this makes the ship vulnerable to attacks during that time. Each player's ship can fire an unlimited amount of "bombs", but the next bomb can only be used when the previous one is not on the field any more.
title: Spielepack 4

description:
Chinese Strategy Games is a collection of four Chinese or Asian board games:* Chinese Chess

  • Go
  • Gomoku
  • Renju

Each game can be played against either another player or a computer opponent with a choice of four skill levels. Hints are available anytime and show the recommended move for the current turn.

All games are presented in a top-down 2D view, except Chinese Chess which lets the player choose between a 2D and a 3D view.

Games of Go can be played on 9x9, 13x13 or 19x19 boards, and with either Chinese or Japanese scoring.

Games that are in progress can be saved at any time for completion at a later time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Each game is introduced by a short pre-rendered 3D animation
A game of Chinese Chess in 2D
The end of a game of Gomoku

title: Chinese Strategy Games

description:
My Very First Software is a video game in three parts for very young children learning how to use a computer for the first time. The software comes in three parts, or separate applications, as well as a demo for the video game adaptation of the book The Escape of Marvin the Ape, by Caralyn and Mark Buehner, also by Vroombooks.

Players will be greeted by Cybee, a flying robot with a penchant for all things outer space. She will guide players through the "activity selectivator", which has four games per app. The first three teach important computer skills, and the fourth reviews new words and terms in a more scholastic setting. In the fourth game of each app, a calmer female voice spells out words like "mouse", "cursor", "double click", "monitor", "keyboard", and "spacebar", followed by a purple cartoon alien character interacting with the computer part, first incorrectly, and then correctly.

In application one, Cybee has games to teach kids how to point with the mouse to reveal images (pointing removes squares covering the image), clicking where the cursor makes sound, and clicking on what object is making sound. In application two, Cybee teaches kids how to double-click and click and drag. In application three, Cybee teaches kids about the keyboard, including pressing random keys to see what happens, using number keys to select music, and painting lines with the arrow keys. The instruction game also teaches about Caps Lock, the spacebar, and the backspace or delete key.
title: My Very First Software

description:
This compilation includes two virtual comic games:

  • They Call Me... The Skul
  • The Suit
title: 2: They Call Me... The Skul / The Suit

description: Wortspiel: Classic Version is a word puzzle game and similar to Scrabble.
title: Wortspiel: Classic Version

description:
Make The Grade! Vol 1 is a two title compilation of educational games containing;* Mazlo's Spelling Adventure

  • In Grandma's Attic

There is no installation menu, instead there are two installation processes SETUP which installs Mazlo's Spelling Adventure and SETUP1 which installs In Grandma's Attic.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen for Mazlo's Spelling Adventure.
Multiple versions of In Grandma's Attic are installed while only an English version of Mazlo's Spelling Adventure is installed

title: Make The Grade! Vol. 1: Mazlo's Spelling / Grandma's Attic

description:
Geography & More! is a compilation of geography themed shareware titles for DOS and Windows. It contains over fifty titles with a strong emphasis on Canada and the U.S.A. though there are some titles that pertain to Europe and Vietnam.

The games are accessed via a menu system which runs from the CD. This splits the titles into two groups, DOS and Windows, lists them in alphabetical order and can be used to either install the programs or copy the filed to the hard drive as appropriate.

Some of the titles are factual such as the atlases and the 1993 CIA World Fact Book whereas others are geography based educational games and quizzes.

sample_screenshots.caption: The menu system showing some of the DOS programs
"Explore The World Of Software" is the brand name under which Rocelco publish shareware compilations
The "Explore The World Of Software Inc." cataloge us extensive. These ate factual titles but there are many games compilations in the list
The menu system showing some of the Windows titles

title: Geography & More!

description:
U.S. Geography Tutor is a single player, mouse controlled, quiz based on the geography of the United States of America.

The game screen shows a green map of the U.S.A on a white background, state boundaries are shown but the states are not named - nothing is. Principal rivers and lakes are shown in blue. When the test starts a question appears in the left of the bottom menu bar and the player has to either click on a state, river, lake or an answer from a pick list. There are four kinds of questions: The State questions and the Lake and River questions take the form "Locate the state of xxx" or "Locate lake xxx"* and the player answers by clicking on the map. The player is told if they are correct and if they are incorrect the appropriate state/feature briefly flashes white

  • The Capital City and Largest City questions take the form "Identify the capital/largest city of xxxxxx" and the player is given a list of five names to choose from

The player can select any or all of the four categories and the test continues until all questions in the chosen categories have been asked, there are one hundred and fifty-nine questions in total, or until the player stops the test by asking for their score.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts with a shareware reminder screen
An example of a State Capital question
The score at the end of an incomplete quiz
The game has a help file which opens in a separate scrollable window

title: U.S. Geography Tutor

description:
Learn USA Geography is a single player, shareware, educational title which contains six maps of the USA based on the 1990 census together with population graphs. In addition to the factual information this title has a quiz section in which the player can answer questions on States, Capitals, Bird, Region, Flower, Abbreviation, year of Statehood, Nickname, Song and Tree.

When the quiz starts the player is asked how many questions they want to answer. All questions are asked in a daughter window, some questions put a cross on the appropriate state so the question window changes position so as not to obscure it. In all cases the player must type their answer. An example of a 'States' question would be "What is the name of the highlighted state?". A cross will be shown on the map of the USA and the player must enter their reply, correct spelling is important but answers are not case sensitive

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts with a shareware reminder
The player decides the length of the quiz
The screen was blank until this basic map of the United States was selected from the Maps drop-down menu. Now it's time to select a quiz subject

title: Learn USA Geography

description:
Name the States is a single player, shareware, quiz game based on the states in the United States of America.

The game is played in a window that starts in the centre of the screen, it can be moved but it can not be resized. It starts with a grey background upon which is a white map of the United States of America showing the state boundaries. There are two levels to this game:.* Level one: a state on the map is coloured blue. The player has to identify the state and select its name from a pick list and if they are correct the state is coloured green otherwise it is coloured red and the player is told the correct answer.

  • Level Two: this is the same game as Level one but after identifying the state the player is asked to select the state capital from another pick list.

After completing a game it is NOT possible to play another immediately, the player must exit the game and start afresh.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level One: This is the first state to be identified. The player selects the name from the pick list
The game screen before the start of a game
Level One: The end of the game and the score
Level two: After answering the 'What state is this?' question the player is asked for the state capital

title: Name the States

description: WinWorld is a shareware quiz game for up to four people/teams. Quizzes can be as short as five questions or as long as fifty questions. There are six topics to choose from Cities, Populations, Currency, Languages, Capitals and Areas and the player(s) can use any or all of these. The game has sound and uses pictures and maps in it's questions.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is a shareware game released on BBSs in the USA and Canada

title: WinWorld

alternate_titles.title: The Quest for the Unfinished Movie

description: In Gordi's Magical Movie Adventure you play as the animator of an animation studio on a deadline to create several finished cartoons using the tools and props found around the studio. Gameplay consists of navigating around the studio using the mouse cursor to move from screen to screen. On each scene a number of objects can be selected and added to the inventory and in turn added to a list of missing bits of reference images. The needed objects are spread out over the entire studio, and some of them requires solving mini-games in the form of simple puzzles to unlock.

sample_screenshots.caption: The paintings are very simple puzzles that rewards us with objects
We can also pick hair types and facial make-up to complete the look - and change the reference sketch into other characters.
The prop room contains all of the sets
Glicking the little green face has Gordi introduce give us a brief introduction to the in-game menu
The camera for animation by taking photos of each drawn frame

title: Gordi's Magical Movie Adventure

description:
Flight Simulator Flight Shop is an add-on product for Microsoft Flight Simulator 5.x. The flight simulator must have been installed before installation of this product can proceed. Though the flight simulator is used in DOS this product requires Windows 3.x or Windows 95.

There are two parts to this product, the Aircraft Factory and the ATC Workshop.

  • The Aircraft Factory: The name is fairly self explanatory, here the player can create their own aircraft from scratch designing each component and linking them together to make an aircraft. It comes with a default aircraft the North American T6-Texan which can be built, painted, modified and exported into the flight simulator for use.

The menu has been designed to look like the map of an aircraft factory with separate functions for parts, components, structures, assembly and paint shop. There in-game are tutorials to guide the player through the lengthy process of creating an aircraft.

  • The ATC Workshop - This allows the player to create their own air traffic controlled adventures, flights from one place to another, with APL - the Adventure Programming Language.

The installation process of this product will upgrade Microsoft Flight Simulator 5.0 to version 5.0A as well as bringing in other changes such as new instrument panels for prop and jet planes allowing up to four engines and a MACH number on the airspeed indicator. Installation also adds two options to the Flight Simulator's drop-down Options menu:

  • Design Aircraft - which allows the player to edit the flight dynamics of aircraft they create
  • Adventure Factory - which lists the flights the player creates

sample_screenshots.caption:
The Flight Simulator's Options drop down menu after installation.
The Design Aircraft option is greyed out because a plane has not been built
Half a dozen adventures have been installed
Starting in the Import/Export department where there is only one plane to build
Progressing through the plant reveals more and more complex information
The Flight Simulator's Options drop down menu before installation
This is a blueprint. Had we been making a new plane we'd have designed each element from scratch, then assembled these into components to create, say, a wing.

title: Flight Simulator Flight Shop

description: Wetten Dass..?: Die schönsten Wetten zum Selberspielen is a game based on the German TV game show known in Britain as "You Bet!" and in the as US "Wanna Bet?". The game is a collection of mini-games. It puts you into the role of a contender and lets you experience over 100 game variations. There are sixteen original bets and seven levels of difficulty that lead you to the title of bet king of the year. Up to four players can compete against each other.
title: Wetten Dass..?: Die schönsten Wetten zum Selberspielen

alternate_titles.description: Alternate title from the Apollo store page
alternate_titles.title: Adventure Collection 1

description:
Flight Adventures 1 is an add-on for Microsoft Flight Simulator (v5.0) Though the simulator can be run in both Windows and DOS this package must be installed via Windows, additionally the add-on required Flight Simulator Flight Shop is required.

When installed the player finds that they have one new aircraft a DH DASH 8-300 in Sim Air livery. The box cover claims that over fifty IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) are installed with this product with the main adventure being a full flight from New York to Boston. All flights, including the New York to Boston adventure are located in the main drop down menu within the Adventure Factory option. By default, when started, the New York/Boston adventure uses the standard Flight Simulator Learjet with its jet aircraft flight panel, this can be changed within the Flight Simulator configuration options but, disappointingly, the supplied Dash 8-300 uses the same flight panel as a Cessna and not a jet aircraft panel. The Flight Simulator's 'Land Me' option cannot be used with the new aircraft.

When the main adventure starts the default aircraft is sitting on the tarmac at JFK airport, New York, however the action does not begin immediately as the player is taken through a series of configuration options which determine the difficulty of the flight. Each option is announced by a warbling bleep and the player must make their choice within six seconds as the setup process automatically advances from one option to the next. The options are;* To fly with NO HELP at all press 'm'

  • For displayed CLEARANCES, press 'CTRL-p'
  • For in-flight HELP, hit 't'
  • For CO-PILOT to change RADIOS, hit 'f'
  • For a shorter flight, hit 'h' - if this option is selected then the next two questions are not asked.
  • For A Martha's Vineyard flight, hit v
  • To fly at 7000, not 15000, hit 'k'

After passing on all these options the player is told they are at JFK airport and that the full flight is 'very hard', even with all help enabled and the short flight selected the player is warned that this is not for the novice. A further warning states that a pen and paper are essential - this seems to be to keep track of headings and radio frequencies throughout the flight.

When the adventure starts the player is given the tower's frequency and once they request clearance to take-off they are given both on-screen and audio instructions for the headings, altitude and in-flight frequencies to use and they're off.

Should the player crash, a booming voice announces 'Nice flying, Ace' and the adventure is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: After installation this Flight Simulator drop-down menu shows an Adventure Factory option and within this lies the New York to Boston flight
Sitting in the Learjet on the JFK runway at night answering the configuration questions
We swapped to the DASH prior to take-off and when loaded it was airborne and spinning, however the tower's instructions 'Cleared, take-off, 700 feet, expect clouds' etc came through loud and clear
This is the aircraft that is installed with the adventure. Disappointingly this uses the same flight panel as the Cessna
The installation process isn't fully automatic, some users will need to take additional action

title: Flight Adventures 1

description:
Rescue Air 911 is an add-on for Microsoft Flight Simulator (v5.1). Though the simulator can be run in both Windows and DOS this package must be installed via Windows, additionally the add-on required Flight Simulator Flight Shop is required, a maintenance upgrade for this product is included on the disc taking Flight Shop to version 5.01

The installation process runs in two stages. The first stage runs under Windows and copies files from the disc onto the users machine, when this is done an 'Installation Complete' message is displayed after which a DOS window opens and a file extraction process begins.

Once installed the player will find three new aircraft, a DH DASH 8-300 in white Sim Air livery, a twin engine Air Rescue Cessna 414-A and a single engine Rescue Air Cessna 182 RG - the last two are in red livery. In the Adventure Factory drop down menu there is an entry for "Rescue Air 911 - The Game", the new adventure which is described as a mix of flying skill and strategy. The game is set in the town of Simville which has eight areas containing injured people. The player's task is to fly rescue missions to bring the injured to the Mallard Memorial Hospital before their fuel runs out, the plane having enough fuel for forty minutes flight and no more. Completed missions earn money and the tame's objective is to earn as much as possible before time runs out.

The game communicates with the player with audio air traffic control messages as well as text which appears in a bar above the instrument panel.

sample_screenshots.caption: The installed aircraft appear in the simulator's drop down menu
Messages in the text bar are not spoken. One of the first text messages is "By the way the slew control is disabled" - attempting to re-enable it results in a fine of $100
The twin engine Air Rescue Cessna 414-A
The adventure is in the Adventure Factory menu
The  single engine Rescue Air Cessna 182 RG

title: Rescue Air 911

description:
Morphman is an interactive video game, running via Microsoft Video, where the player plays as Morphman who has the power to change into different creatures. He is on a mission to rescue Professor Roberts, a physicist from performing military experiments. Morphman must take his jet to a mysterious castle on a mysterious island to rescue the Professor.

Morphman plays on a single screen where a video file plays in the top-left corner. He reacts to different circumstances by picking the correct ability when a challenge appears on the screen. The player has a short time to select the correct button press at pre-determined points in the video adventure. During the adventure Morphman is able to absorb the forms of various creatures to help him which are then shown on the interface.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sampling an animal allows Morphman to assume its shape.
Morphed into a fish and jumped into the water.

title: Morphman

description: Pumuckl Superspiele is an edutainment package released in German speaking territory only and containing the puzzle game Pumuckl ist wieder da, the painting game Pumuckl, der Malermeister and the memory game Pumuckls Aquarium with the licensed protagonist Pumuckl by the German author of children's literature Ellis Kaut.
title: Pumuckl Superspiele

description:
Diva X: NJ de Bahia is an installment in the Diva X series where you meet a French woman named NJ de Bahia.

The game uses TFUI 2.0 (Touch and Feel User Interface), an icon-based 3-D interface that mimics human spoken language. You are allowed to touch and sexually interact with NJ, in real-time, from a first-person view. You should stimulate the woman with advanced sexual functions: tongue, self-stimulation, special toys as well as your hands and body.

The game also includes X-Director which allows the player to record and stitch together various TFUI interactions to create a own custom video. A long form adult video, static photographs of NJ and a blooper reel are also included on the disc.

sample_screenshots.caption: Still images from a photo shoot.

title: Diva X: NJ de Bahia

description:
Dominoes For Windows is a computer version of the Dominoes variant "Sniff". Players compete across a series of rounds, trying to be the first to exceed a minimum score.

During each round, players extend the chain of dominoes on the table by placing dominoes from their hand on either of the chain ends; dominoes can only be placed next to pieces with matching dot numbers. The first time a double-sided domino (with same dot number on both ends) is placed during a round, it becomes a Sniff, and it can be used as a starting point for two additional chain branches. A player gains points when the number of dots on all the chain ends adds up to a multiple of 5. When a player empties his entire hand, he receives bonus points, the table is cleared and the next round begins.

The game offers three difficulty levels for the computer opponent, an autoplay (computer vs computer) option, an advise option that suggests a move, and a few minor rule variations.

Later versions of the game add a second Dominoes variant, "Fives & Threes", and the option of a domino set with up to nine dots.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beginning of a new game. Pick a bone to see who deals first (v4.2)
The "About" box, with color-changing company logo (v2.4)

title: Dominoes For Windows

description:
This compilation includes the three episodes that form the game Dare to Dream:

  • Dare to Dream Part One: In a Darkened Room
  • Dare to Dream 2
  • Dare to Dream 3
title: Dare to Dream

description:
Daisy's Garden 2 is a side-scrolling puzzle game with vibrant, cartoony graphics. Daisy must pick all the flowers and fruits in her garden and avoid touching the marmoset or caterpillar. Also for some reason, she instantly dies if she touches water or the top of a picket fence.

The game was distributed on many shareware CD's throughout the 90's, though the majority of levels were locked behind a registration password. By purchasing the full version, you would obtain the password.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the first of the gardens for beginners, move Daisy to the question marks to learn about the basics.

title: Daisy's Garden 2

description:
Baby Brats: Super Play Room is a single-player, shareware game which is an enhanced version of the earlier game Brats. This is a whac-a-mole game substituting babies for moles and a bottle of milk for a hammer. The game is time limited and has a high score table.

The developer is very keen to point out the differences between this game and the earlier game, compared to the original game this game has:* a 640x480 screen;

  • continuous sound effects;
  • more crying babies to feed;
  • improved feeding sound effects;
  • more animation during play and at the start of the game;
  • the shareware game is limited to thirty seconds while the registered game timer runs to six minutes.
title: Baby Brats: Super Play Room

description:
Blackout is a single-player, shareware, mouse-controlled game that is described as 'a fun way to learn how to use the mouse'.

The game starts with a game area full of multicoloured tiles some of which contain a target symbol. The coloured tiles change colour but when one of them turns black it stays black. The player's task is to click on all of the target tiles to complete the level before all the other tiles turn black. In addition to the target tiles there are other special tiles;* Bonus tiles. These are coloured tiles that, briefly, change to show a bonus which range from 2X to 5X, clicking on these boosts the player's score. Clicking on a bonus tile just after it has changed back to a coloured tile causes it and surrounding tiles to turn black.

  • A Replay Arrow. This consists of a tile showing three chevrons. This tile moves rapidly and randomly around the screen, clicking on it causes all black tiles to become coloured again however, as with the bonus tiles, clicking and missing causes more tiles to turn black.

  • The Boogeyman: This is a black tile with a blue face in it, it bounces around the screen occasionally restoring targets that the player had removed. When it appears the player is unable to score until they click on it and remove it.

sample_screenshots.caption: The high score screen appears in a new window
The shareware nag screen appears at the start and end of the game
The start of a game. The bonus tiles disappear quite quickly and, because 'The Boogeyman' is on screen (upper left) the player cannot score

title: Blackout

description:
Once upon a time in the far future the world was ruled by an evil overlord who liked killing and driving cars. Eventually he became bored with both so he combined the two, thus creating 'The Demon Car' and happily drove around killing as many people as he could. Eventually he died and his son took over as king. The new king had the 'The Demon Car' upgraded ad he happily followed his father's example.

The new king eventually grew old but had no queen and no children. Who was to succeed him? He came up with a plan, whoever could drive is demon car the best would take the throne.

Thus begins the game. The player has been summoned to show their skill, and complete disregard for human life, by driving the demon car and killing as many serfs as possible within a limited time. The game is keyboard controlled and is played on a single screen. People pop up randomly and the player's job is to run them down. Once hit their target it turns into a cross which then becomes an obstacle in the race to find the next victim, as the game progresses the number of crosses grows and the game becomes harder.

The game has four skill settings, a high score table and a choice of screen sizes.

sample_screenshots.caption: As the game progresses the crosses make it harder to reach the next victim

The title screen
A little animation shows the car running across the screen left to right and claiming another victim
The configuration options are tucked away in the menu bar
Demon Car is a shareware game

title: Demon Car

description:
WuKung: A Legendary Adventure is a point-and-click adventure game based on the popular Monkey God mythos of ancient China. The Emperor is seeking The Book of Governance, an artifact containing all the wisdom necessary to rule a kingdom in a just fashion. He dispatches the monk SamChang on a quest to find it. Along the way, SamChang meets WuKung, an extraordinary and magical monkey. When SamChang disappears, it's up to WuKung to track him down with the help of his friends Eddy (a pig demon) and Seamoure (a river demon), then together find the Book sought by the Emperor.

The typical adventure gameplay involves solving puzzles to progress the story. Eventually three characters become available and it is possible to switch between them. Four actions are available as part of the HUD. There is also an inventory system where items are stored.
title: WuKung: A Legendary Adventure

description:
Based on the popular TV series starring Angela Lansbury, Murder, She Wrote: Mystery Jigsaw Puzzles is a murder mystery game starring the famous detective Jessica Fletcher, albeit without the participation of Lansbury herself.

The game features four different murder cases, in which the facts of the case are first presented to the player via audio narration and FMV cutout dialogue among the various characters (though Fletcher is just presented as a static Lansbury headshot and voiced by a different actress). The player must then assemble a jigsaw puzzle of the crime scene and examine it for the clues which can implicate the guilty party. Once the player has selected the character they believe is the murderer, Fletcher then reveals the culprit along with further explanation on how the crime was committed.

The jigsaw puzzles have several configurable gameplay options, including background color, piece shape (curved or square), and sound effects. The puzzles can also be cut into 24, 48, 80, 130, 154, or 187 different pieces to vary the difficulty level, with 187 being the default.

sample_screenshots.caption: The stories are told as audio dramas with a few FMV videos thrown in

title: Murder, She Wrote: Mystery Jigsaw Puzzles

description:
Intelligent Strategy Games Volume 2 is a collection of five games from Oxford Softworks, they are;* 4 In A Line

  • Chess
  • Go
  • Renju
  • Reversi

The installation process offers the option to install in French or German but the game's readme file states that the games help files are not available in these languages.

sample_screenshots.caption: The end of a Reversi game
This is the loading screen. Once a game has been selected this is displayed for a short while the game is being prepared.

The game of 4 In A Line.
I let the computer win this one
The chess board with some of the game's configuration options. Chess can be played in 2D or 3D
The installation process creates a game group with separate entries for each game. However the games are not installed on the player's machine and are run from the CD

title: Intelligent Strategy Games: Vol. 2 PC

description:
Atom Killer is an adventure game in Italian. The game tells the story of Atom Loew, from his childhood in a future version of the city of Bologna, to his adulthood, when he's transformed into a cybernetic killer with an atomic heart.

The game is divided in three sections, which you can access at any time. One of them is an interactive database where you learn about the world and the protagonist, with text, images, and voice recordings. The second one is a traditional point and click adventure, done in a mixture of pre-rendered 3D graphics and 2D graphics, and with complete voiced dialogues. And in the third one, you guide Atom in a series of action sequences, where you control what happens by influencing him as if you were his "guardian angel" (that's the term used in the guide in-game).

sample_screenshots.caption: Adventure game section, Atom's parents' room
Adventure game section, checking a telephone

title: Atom Killer

description:
In Kung Fu Kim the player controls a martial artist standing on a pillar, who needs to protect himself from objects flying at him. The player needs to press arrow keys to block incoming objects before they hit Kim and drain his health. Losing all the health means game over. Occasionally, bonus items fly by (health refills, and "stones of protection" which ward Kim from nasties of a specific color); they must be picked up by pressing "down".

The game consists of nine levels, with different objects to defend from on each level.
title: Kung Fu Kim

description:
Once the world of light was beautiful. Now it and all its inhabitants are threatened with ruin. The evil witch Grisa wants to abuse nature and thus destroy the world of light. Grisa is holding the beautiful nature fairy Natasja, guardian and protector of the world of light, captive so that she, the evil witch, can realise her sinister and destructive plans.

The player needs to help Natasja and the world of light. You need the seven magic stones to break the witch's spell and banish her from the world of light forever. In this fairytale world you explore an old castle, a park, dark underground passages, an abandoned house, a herb garden and a hedge maze.

sample_screenshots.caption: Backpack with a glass of water

title: Lichtwelt

description:
Ego: La Leggenda del Drago Distruttore is an adventure/strategy game in Italian. The story takes place in a fantasy version of the Middle Ages, where the evil Arakh, High Priest of the Cult of the Spider, seeks to conquer the world. Gerard, a paladin of Charlemagne who also appears in the game La Spada della Foresta Vivente, recruits Ego, the titular dragon, to fight against Arakh and his cult.

You play as Ego, and gameplay involves selecting different destinations on a map of the world. On these destinations, appearing as fixed pre-rendered 3D images and sometimes with short animations, you will find items and allies who pledge to fight alongside Ego, but also enemies that you can fight in simple turn-based battles, while also meeting with Gerard and helping him get to different places. You also have 5 different stats which you can replenish in some destinations: Flame, Vigour, Perception, Virtue and Karma.

In addition, there's a "Hypertext" section that acts as a historical index where information can be found about dragons and different places, myths and legends of the world.

sample_screenshots.caption: The other attack... is kind of psychedelic and I'm not sure what he's doing
Ego flying from one destination to another at night

title: Ego: La Leggenda del Drago Distruttore

description:
Search&Play Plus is an "interactive database for computer games" published by the German Federal Agency for Civic Education (FACE, abbreviated BpB in German). It contains descriptions, reviews (often by children that played the game) and pedagogical ratings of contemporary games, including several scientific articles about video games in general.

Users were not only able to browse the database, but could also add their own reviews or completely new games, guided by a (customizable, e.g. for school classes) wizard. The reviews could then be sent to the federal agency or even uploaded to their web server directly. The same way it was possible to download or import new games or reviews from FACE.

Along with the reviews the disc also provides several games:

Full version:

  • Eco Quest II: Das Geheimnis des Regenwalds (Lost Secret of the Rainforest) in German; this is the first (and to date only known) release of the German version of the game.

Demo versions of commercial computer games:

  • Aufschwung Ost
  • Der König der Löwen (The Lion King)
  • Descent 2
  • Die Siedler 2 (The Settlers II: Veni, Vidi, Vici)
  • Earthworm Jim
  • Lemmings
  • Nascar Racing 2
  • Sim City 2000
  • Simon the Sorcerer II
  • Super Streetfighter II Turbo
  • The Even More Incredible Machine
  • Warcraft II
  • Worms

Educational games:

  • Auf dem Weg nach Europa
  • Courage
  • Dunkle Schatten
  • Dunkle Schatten 2
  • Energie-Manager
  • Enviro Kids
  • Hilfe für Amajambere
  • Let's talk about ...
  • Tim & Nina

Shareware games:

  • Andromedas Erbe
  • Commander Keen 4
  • Das Telekommando
  • Telekommando II
  • Das tödliche Gemetzel der Mörderspinnen
  • Golph
  • Jazz Jackrabbit: Holiday Hare 1995
  • Pretty Good Solitaire 2.0
  • Putt Putt Goes to the Moon
  • Sherlock
  • Skyroads
  • Squarez Deluxe!
  • Wacky Wheels
  • WinBrick
  • WinPac 1.8

Games developed by teens:

  • Die Story
  • Stunk

sample_screenshots.caption: Quite a lot of reviews were added to the entry for <moby game="Doom">Doom</moby>, ranking from high praise...
A custom "MobyGames" game entry with all possible icons for appending a video, game demo, audio file and walkthrough on the bottom left
It's possible to filter the games by age group, genre, topic or whether a demo is included.

title: Search&Play Plus

description:
Pizza Face is a single player, mouse controlled, shareware, whac-a-mole variant. In this game the player is presented with a face on which grow zits that the player has to pop with a needle. Points are scored for each zit popped however zits that are missed turn into scars.

The game has six different faces but only one, Joe Pimple, is available in the shareware version. It also has many customisation options; the round time can be varied from ten seconds to one minute; it has three levels of difficulty; and the maximum number of scars that trigger 'Game Over' can be varied between zero and one hundred.

The only sound effect used is a ding when the timer runs out and the round ends. The game ends after ten rounds or when the scar limit is breached.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game screen before the game starts
The game's help file opens in a new window that appears on top of the game window but is a completely different size

title: Pizza Face

alternate_titles.title: Smok Anatol na Wyspie Gula Gula

description:
The chameleon Shades and his pal JB (Jitterbug) take young players on a tour around the workshop to learn about colors and shapes in a variety of six fun activities:

  • Colors and Shape Song - A song that introduces eight different colors and shapes and has JB paint pictures.
  • Coloring Book Game - Determine how a story goes by choosing from one of six colors.
  • Find the Colors - Find a color in a picture that corresponds to the chosen color bottle.
  • Match the Shapes - Find a shape in a picture that corresponds to the highlighted wooden shape.
  • Build-A-Toy - Assembled colored shapes on to a diagram to build a toy.
  • Pattern Game - Create a pattern with a sequence of shapes and colors.
title: Shades & JB's Colors and Shapes Workshop

description:
La Spada della Foresta Vivente is an adventure game with some RPG elements in Italian. It's a medieval fantasy story in which you take on the role of the squire Gerard (a character who also appears in Ego: La Leggenda del Drago Distruttore), and you are tasked to free the knight Orlando, who was imprisoned by the magic of the Dragon Malsoffio during a mission on behalf of the King. Graphics are pre-rendered in 3D.

The game was distributed on newsstands, a common practice in the Italian video game industry of the 1980s and 90s.
title: La Spada della Foresta Vivente

description:
In 3D Pumpkin Puzzles, the player has to reassemble a torn apart pumpkin. In order to do so, the pieces have to grabbed with the mouse and dragged to the correct position on the screen. The goal is to finish this task as fast as possible (the game only counts the minutes, though).

Besides choosing the number of pieces (three options), there are also three difficulty levels available:

  • Easy: As described above.
  • Medium: The pieces may have to be rotated.* Hard: The unassembled pieces regularly rotate.

sample_screenshots.caption: We have to assemble the pumpkin

title: 3D Pumpkin Puzzles

alternate_titles.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea: Climb Aboard the Nautilus!

description:
20,000 Leagues Under the Sea is a digitized version of the novel of the same name by Jules Verne. It adds multimedia features such as narrated text, word definitions and interactive fishing which leads to an encyclopedia entry.

The game portion is a quiz. The player has to answer multiple-choice questions which address knowledge of the chosen chapter. After answering all questions, the player receives a rating based on the number of correct answers.

sample_screenshots.caption: The novel is illustrated with pictures

title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea

description:
The Adventures of Busy Billy is a puzzle game aimed at children between 3 and 8. Players choose between two mechanically identical scenarios after starting the game: Busy Billy Wonderland and Busy Billy Fantasy. The story is also the same: Billy finds a magical remote control and is transported into a fantasy world with four mini games:

  • Billy is standing in one of four single-screen pictures. The player chooses between eight items (e.g. a hand, a magnet or a flashlight) and clicks on visible items. A short animation triggers when a valid combination is found.
  • One of the four screens is broken up into nine scrambled segments. The player has to recreate the correct picture by switching two tiles at a time.
  • Billy is presented with an obstacle and the player has to choose the correct item in order to proceed. This is the only mini game which has a different graphical representation in the two scenarios.
  • Up to eight items are lined up on a film reel. Depending on the choices, different animations are played afterwards.

sample_screenshots.caption: The representation is different, but we still have to choose the correct item for the problem
Billy starts his adventure in an attic
...and start an animation by clicking on the computer

title: The Adventures of Busy Billy

description: AI (Alien Invaders) is a single-screen shooter. The player's spaceship is constrained to the bottom of the screen and can be moved left and right. The alien invaders, always in waves of six, enter the screen from the top and move towards the player. However, they'll veer when they almost reached the player and only hurt with their shots. The player can only shoot one missile at the time towards the alien ships. It detonates as soon as the player stops pressing the shoot button and only the explosion harms the enemies. After killing three waves, the scenery changes and the difficulty rises. The player loses a ship after receiving one hit and the game ends when all are gone.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fighting with aliens in the first level

title: AI (Alien Invaders)

description:
Amazing Animals: Activity Center is an educational game based on the TV show Amazing Animals. It features five mini games:

  • Copy Cat is a Simon Says variant with cartoon animals.
  • Matching Pairs is a Concentration variant with photos of parent and baby animals.
  • Match the Facts: The player needs to choose the correct animal which fits the given facts.
  • Pixelator: A picture of an animal is shown in pixelated form and the player needs to choose the correct animal.
  • Photo Safari: The player receives a mission to photograph a certain kind of animal, e.g. plant-eaters. Animals show their head from the bushes and if it fits the bill, the player moves the mouse cursor over it and clicks. Correct animals give points, wrong animals give negative points and cartoon animals give bonus points.
  • Scrambler: A picture of an animal is scrambles into multiple parts. The player needs to reassemble it by switching the tiles.

Every time a task is finished and a certain condition is met, e.g. a number of points by working fast and without mistakes, the player can optionally participate in a quiz. If the multiple-choice question is answered correctly, a sticker for the encyclopedia is rewarded.

In addition there are a four non-game sections:

  • Amazing Animal Expert: An animal encyclopedia.
  • Amazing Masks: Players can save animal masks to disk in order to print them and make actual masks.
  • Animal Movies: A collection of 30 video clips.
  • Stationary Folder: Creating postcards, business cards, etc. with animal pictures.

sample_screenshots.caption: If we manage to answer the question correctly...

title: Amazing Animals: Activity Center

description:
Evil female aliens constructed a space station in the vicinity on Earth. From there they project a ray which causes a blockage to all men - they can't cum anymore! The player takes the role of Captain Cock who has to travel to the space station in order to destroy their transmitter.

The game is a simple single-screen shooter. The player moves the cross-hair of a weapon in first-person and uses it to shoot naked, female aliens which pop out from the rendered background. If the player is too slow, they manage to shoot back and lower Captain Cock's health bar. Sometimes there are also naked men which should not be shot, but doing so has no adverse effect except wasting ammo. Health and ammo can be refilled by shooting the corresponding symbols flying around. After finishing the shoot-out successfully, the player has to solve a puzzle before moving on and eventually being rewarded with a hardcore porn clip.

On the disc are also four trailers (hardcore and softcore) for the publisher's web and phone sex services. They can be accessed from the main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: We need to shoot female aliens
Shooting the ammo box refills ammo

title: Ass Troids

description:
In the year 2031, Earth loses contact with its colony CLOO7. This is bad because it produces a majority of the Uranium used on Earth. The player takes control of the seven robots which were sent to CLOO7 to investigate what happened.

Atomic Chill is a flip-screen puzzle platformer. The robot is able to jump and shoot. The goal is to traverse the screens solving puzzles. Said puzzles usually consist of pressing buttons or using collected items at the correct place. Being shot by enemies or stumbling into the environmental traps reduces the health bar and the robot is destroyed when it becomes empty. Then one of the other remaining robots embarks on the journey. The game ends when all of them are gone.

sample_screenshots.caption: A rendered robot from the intro cinematic
We managed to press the button (directly above the robot) and are about to enter the second screen

title: Atomic Chill

description:
Alley Cats is a mouse-controlled one-player bowling game with a pin-up twist. The goal is to knock down as many pins as you can. Scored points can then be spent to 'interact' with girls that hang around the alley.

The game itself consists of three bowling alleys that must be completed in sequential order. The alleys are not notably different in terms of graphics or difficulty. The alley girls, Candy, Rachel or Elizabeth, can keep you company if you wish, but apart from reading out one-liners depending on how many points you score, they do not affect the gameplay. The bowling alley is viewed from a diagonal down-perspective, with the points, pindicator and selected throw-style displayed on top. Click the throw-style you want to use - Straight, Hook, Curve or Backup, hold down the mouse button and move it up to throw a ball. Moving the mouse in a straight vertical line always results in a Strike.

Between the bowling games you can enter the Pro-shop where you can buy better shoes to increase your score, view high-resolution pictures of the girls, or watch striptease previews.

Having completed the three alleys, a pin-up room opens where you spend your points on viewing striptease acts of the girls. These are basically low-res Apple Quicktime movies that can also be viewed from a Windows file folder. Having spent all your points, you return to the bowling alleys for a new game.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the Pro shop you can get new shoes, view high-res pictures or watch pin-up previews. Everything costs bowling points, though.
Ten strikes in a row! Am I that good or is the game just easy?
Three pins down, six to go.

title: Alley Cats

description:
Bally is a Pong variant. Both players (there is no AI) control paddles which are placed at left and right side of the screen. They can be moved up and down in order to bounce a ball back and forth. Every time a player lets the ball through, the opponent gains a point.

Bally offers ten variants which mostly only effect the color set and obstacles placed between the paddles. One variant has two balls and the paddles are placed at the top and bottom of the screen in two other variants. Depending on the variant, the obstacles are stationary or moving and bounce the ball back when hit. The exception is Breakout ! Bally: in this variant, the obstacles can be destroyed.
title: Bally

description:
Storymaker is an educational game which allows children to create movies. It is licensed from the Barbie doll brand.

Inside the scene studio, players can create scenes which are later used to make the movie. The available items are: the setting (the background image), the items in the scene (for example a butterfly or a fish bowl), text (as introduction for the scene; optionally a narration can also be recorded over the microphone), music, characters (normal characters can follow a path which the player draws into the scene and others have a special animation like sitting down) and special effects (e.g. a sunburst or a sound effect). The created scenes can be spliced together in the editing studio and the complete movie is viewed in the screening room. The game also features a paint studio where the available background images can be recolored or players can create completely new images to be used in the scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Their walking path is simply drawn with the mouse
The painting room allows to repaint the background images
Placing an object into the scene

title: Storymaker

description:
Baseball's Greatest Hits is a CD-ROM database about the MLB (the American Baseball league). It features player and match statistics as well as some special moments in word, audio and video form.

The game part is a baseball match in quiz form. It only simulates batting: the player chooses what hit to aim for (single, double, triple or home run) and has to answer a multiple-choice question about Baseball. The difficulty depends on the hit (single is the easiest and home run the hardest). Answering the question correct or wrong defines success of failure. When the other team's turn is up, the second player answers more questions. This continues until the match is decided.

sample_screenshots.caption: In this example, we answered correctly and the player moves over the field
Viewing a photo and an audio clip of a baseball player
Choosing the difficulty of the quiz question
We have to answer the question correctly for a successful hit

title: Baseball's Greatest Hits

description:
Yova is a clone of Ataxx. This board game takes place on a 7x7 square board, with both players starting with two pawns in the opposite corners. Each turn, a player can move one of his pawn two spaces away, or clone a pawn onto an adjacent square. Putting a pawn next to an opponent's pawns converts them to the player's pawns. The game is finished when one of the players has no more pawns, or when the board is filled completely, at which point the player with more pawns wins. A player can pass a turn at any time.

The game offers both human-vs-human and human-vs-computer modes (the computer player has four difficulty levels). In the human-vs-computer mode, winning against the computer allows the player to compete on a different board, with some squares blocked off and inaccessible to either player.

sample_screenshots.caption: After completing a game against the computer, we start again on a new board, with some squares removed
A warning windows pops up at the start

title: Yova

description: Battle Hamster is a one-against-one fighting game for two players. Both participating hamsters are identical in look and abilities: they can move, duck, jump, block and attack. The goal is to win the round by emptying the enemy's energy bar with successful attacks. Alternatively the round ends after sixty seconds; then the hamster with the most energy left wins (when both have the same amount of energy, the left hamster wins). There is no win count and the next round starts directly after the fight finished.

sample_screenshots.caption: The left hamster lands a successful hit

title: Battle Hamster for Windows

description:
Battleship is a close adaption of the board game which can be either played against a LAN opponent or against the AI. The game is played on a 10x10 grid where both players place five ships of carious sizes (e.g. the aircraft carrier is five fields long). Then both players take turns and shoot one field on the opponent's board. The goal is to destroy all ships first.

This version adds three AI play levels, the option to send messages to the other player (obviously only useful for multiplayer matches) and a library of pre-arraned ship formations.

sample_screenshots.caption: We hit one of the enemy's ships
The game also features a library of pre-arranged formations

title: Battleship

description: Beauty and the Beast is an interactive storybook which retells the traditional fairytale of the same name. Every page features narrated text along with a (sometimes animated) picture. When hovering over a marked word with the mouse, a word definition pops up. Besides the standard mode, there is also a movie option with is exactly the same without the written text. The puzzle section features four scrambled pictures which have to recreated by switching the tiles with each other.

sample_screenshots.caption: The puzzle section has four scrambles pictures to assemble
Hovering over the blue words gives a definition
Another page from the first chapter

title: Beauty and the Beast

description:
The protagonist finds himself on an deserted island which used to be a tourist attraction. His goal is to search the island for a treasure.

Caribbean Treasure is a standard point & click adventure: the player moves through the screens and clicks on items to either receive a comment by the protagonist or picking it up. Solving puzzles by using these collected items is necessary for progress.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first screen of the game
Using the shovel on the fresh dirt
We are about to pick up the tiki lamp

title: Caribbean Treasure

description:
Casino Master is a collection of gambling games. At least some of the included games were first released in 1990 and continuously refined for the inclusion in Centron's Casino Master releases. This version, also called the Multimedia Edition adds videos from a professional gambler and various tutorials which aim to make the player a better gambler in real life. Also included is a guide which describes various US casinos.

The available games, all started through separate executables, are:

  • Baccarat
  • Black Jack
  • Craps
  • Keno
  • Pai Gow Poker
  • Red Dog
  • Roulette
  • Slots
  • Texas Hold'em (new in version 3.0)
  • Video Poker
title: Casino Master

alternate_titles.title: Country Vid Grid: The Country Video Moving Puzzle Game

description:
In County Vid Grid, the player has to unscramble a running country music video. The number of tiles is variable, including progressive options where the video directly re-scrambles with a harder difficulty after it was solved. The goal is to be as fast as possible.

There are four playing modes: drag and drop (the player can switch any two tiles), perfection (like drag and drop, but the video re-scrambles if both pieces end up in a wrong position), slider (a classic sliding puzzle: the player can only switch the blank tile, which is always the bottom right tile, with an adjacent one) and random corners (like slider, but the blank tile can be from anywhere). To increase the difficulty, the video orientation can additionally be changed to upside down or inverted.

sample_screenshots.caption: The list of all included music videos
Upping the difficulty in custom mode

title: Country Vid Grid

description:
Magic Princess: Paper Doll Maker, licensed from the Crayola brand of crayons, is an educational game which lets children dress up a princess paper doll. Through four ages - ancient Greece, old Japan, medieval England and the French empire - there are dresses and other accessories available to use. However, those are black and white and have to be colored by the player in order to impress. The paper dolls can also be personalized by choosing the color of the eyes, hair and skin.

Each of the time periods also feature news articles from the time period and a diary by the princess. The game encourages the player to continue writing the diary.
title: Magic Princess: Paper Doll Maker

description: Cribbage is a simulation of the card game of the same name. It allows the player to play against an AI opponent. It features three difficulty levels and the option to change the pattern/picture on the back of the cards.

sample_screenshots.caption: Setting up a new match (unregistered Shareware version)
Competing against the AI (unregistered Shareware version)
Choosing the picture on the back of the cards (unregistered Shareware version)

title: Cribbage

description:
Simulation is a collection of 3 simulation games for Windows 3.1.

  • Earthsiege 2
  • Red Baron
  • Silent Thunder: A-10 Tank Killer II
title: Simulation

description: We finally have the answer what happened to the dinosaurs after meteors hit Earth: they used their spaceship and searched for a new planet to live on! Dinonauts: Animated Adventures in Space tells that story in storybook form: the player chooses one of the seven planets, watches how the dinosaurs meet the inhabitants, triggers animations by clicking on hot-spots on the screen and finally gets to participate in various activities, e.g. reassembling a scrambled picture, a pinball construction set, designing a clock or making music.

sample_screenshots.caption: The dinosaurs use their spaceship to flee from space
The inside of the space ship

title: Dinonauts: Animated Adventures in Space

description: Hoyle Casino is an updated version of the 1996 title Hoyle Casino. You enter a Vegas casino where you can play more than 50 variations of Blackjack, Craps, Roulette, Slot Machines, and Poker (including internet play for Blackjack and Poker). The game offers 7 adjustable computer opponents with individual personalities and skill levels. You can change other options and rules of the games to fit your preferences. You start with a pocket full of cash and try to build up winnings. Or, if you lose all your money, you can try asking loan sharks for more.

sample_screenshots.caption: This interior view faces the Craps tables

title: Hoyle Casino

alternate_titles.title: Dr. Ditto: An Exciting Multimedia Memory Match-Up Game!

description:
Dr. Ditto is an educational game which features nine topics: animals, China, colors, flowers, holidays, letters and words, medieval times, vehicles and videos. Each topic is introduced with an introduction text narrated by a talking head (literally) followed by a number of sub-categories. For example, the animal topic has monkey, reptiles, birds, animal drawings, etc. Each of those lead to a matching game in two categories:

  • Lotto: dragging a number of pictures to the corresponding picture.

  • Memory: a standard Concentration variant. Depending on the category, the matching pictures are either identical or related. For the videos topic, only the memory game is available: one card is a short video and the matching card is a still image from the video.

sample_screenshots.caption: A lotto game from the colors topic

title: Dr. Ditto

description:
Dr. Seuss: Preschool is an educational game which aims to teach children about reading and math. The player controls the elephant Horton who searches for Elma Sue's missing mother. However, he needs to enlist the help of other animals, all characters from Dr. Seuss' stories, by solving their reading and math problems. There are eight activities with three difficulty levels available:

  • Mayzie's ABC's: Dragging eggs with letters to their correct place in the alphabet.

  • Floob Phonics: Matching two identical letters by clicking on them. In the two higher difficulty levels, the player needs to click on the picture which depicts a word starting with the same letter (or the other way around).

  • Pop's Rhymes: Clicking on the picture which depicts a word rhyming with the given word.

  • Monkey Matching: Matching two identical letters by clicking on them. The two higher difficulties use standard Concentration rules. In the highest difficulty, the player needs to match the letter with a picture which depicts a word starting with the same letter.

  • Yertle's Counting Turtles: Collecting either the correctly numbered turtles or the correct number of turtles.

  • Fox in Socks Sorting: Sorting socks in the correct boxes. They differ in size and color.

  • Fish Follies: Finding the correct fish (they differ in size and a symbol on their side) and coloring it with a certain color.

  • Sneezlebee 123's: Matching two identical numbers by clicking on them. The two higher difficulties use standard Concentration rules. In the highest difficulty, the player needs to match the number and its written equivalent.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fox in Socks Sorting, difficulty 3: sorting the socks per size and color
Fish Follies, difficulty 2: choosing the correct fish and color
Fox in Socks Sorting, difficulty 2: sorting the socks per size
Sneezlebee 123's, difficulty 3: Matching the numbers and their written equivalent with Concentration rules

title: Dr. Seuss: Preschool

alternate_titles.title: Escher Interactive: Exploring the Art of the Infinite

description:
Escher Interactive is a multimedia CD-ROM about the Dutch artist M. C. Escher. It features biographical information about the artist with videos and images, a Tessellation workshop where players can try to create their own images, animated Escher drawings, pictures of spheres with a magnifying function, creating morphing animations between two objects, magic images and two games:

  • Convex & Concave: An object is placed in a cutaway view of a room. The player needs to decide if another object fits the perspective and, if yes, where it has to be placed. If the choice was correct, a point is earned - but a wrong choice rewards a negative point. The goal is to accumulate as many points as possible before the timer runs out. There are three difficulty levels.

  • Impossible Puzzles: The player has to place the given shapes to create one of twelve so-called impossible shapes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Convex & Concave: after the time runs out, we see our result
Convex & Concave: we placed the item correctly

title: Escher Interactive

description:
After being kidnapped by alien, the protagonist wakes up in the starship and finds the kidnappers dead. Now he has to explore the ship to find a way back home.

Fate of the Starlords is a traditional first-person adventure game. The player clicks through rendered still images and uses the mouse cursor to interact with objects on screen. Picked up items show up in the inventory. From there they can be used with other objects in order to solve puzzles.

sample_screenshots.caption: We can drag items from the inventory onto the game screen
We directly find a dead alien after starting the game

title: Fate of the Starlords

alternate_titles.title: Fisher-Price: Dream DollHouse - Where Dreams Come To Life

description:
Dream DollHouse: Where Dreams Come To Life is an educational game for preschoolers. The player visits a dollhouse which is based on the Fisher-Price toy of the same name. Each room contains various items which can be clicked on to trigger animations. Additionally, the player can drop toddlers and animals in the room which also have different animations depending on the place. Each item can be transformed (either another color or a completely different item) by either choosing the magician, the fairy or the fool and clicking on it.

In each room, the player can also solve a simple task (e.g. bathing the dog in the bathroom) and find the hidden lodging of the mice.

sample_screenshots.caption: Grandma and the cowboy talk to us
The couch became a toy after clicking on it with the fool
Choosing the next room to visit

title: Dream DollHouse: Where Dreams Come To Life

description:
Word Games is a collection of four different word games:

  • Anagram: the games gives a scrambled letter combination and the player has to find the fitting real word.
  • Letr Link: the game gives a combination of 12 letters (repeats possible) and the player has to find words which only contains the given letters.
  • Hangman: standard Hangman rules. There are ten difficulty levels available.
  • Word Search: standard GWord Search rules in a 8x8 grid.
title: Word Games

description:
Fun Pack 3 is a compilation of the following games:

  • Alien Force
  • Fortress
  • Paulie Python
  • Slam!
  • SpaceBomb
  • Watch Out, Willi!
  • WinPool
title: Fun Pack 3

description:
GemStone is a falling block puzzle game: there are combinations of differently colored blocks falling down from the top of the screen. The player can shuffle the positions of the blocks and should place them on the board in order to create either horizontal, vertical of diagonal lines of identical colors. Then the blocks disappear and the other placed blocks fall down accordingly.

There are 100 levels which differ in the initial state of the play board, the combinations of falling blocks, the winning condition (how many lines have to disappear) and the threshold (how many identical blocks are required to form a disappearing line). When the player manages to create longer lines than required, they may meet the Not threshold (also changes from level to level). Then they are rewarded with a special effect (essentially power-ups) which helps to solve the level, e.g. eliminating a complete line of the playing board.

While the game can be manually saved at any time, it also features a password system. By entering the one available password, which is hidden within the game, the player unlocks the option to create custom games.

sample_screenshots.caption: We made a finished line of green blocks which are shortly due to disappear
Here we hit the Not threshold of four blocks...

title: GemStorm

description:
GeoSafari: Multimedia Game - Vol I: Variety Pack is a quiz game which features all 45 quizzes, which mostly have around 20 questions each, are evenly divided into three categories: Geography, History and Science. All questions are are multiple-choice (the standard question has typically nine choices) and some are accompanied by photos or video footage.

The GeoChallenge category randomly creates quizzes from the available questions. They can be either restricted to one of the three categories or can encompass all of them. The time limit for answering the question can be changed and the game can be played with up to four players. There is an additional glossary available with fact sheets for all mentioned items.
