sample_screenshots.caption: An example for a question which looks a bit different to the standard
An overview of the available topics
The glossary has facts about every mentioned item

title: GeoSafari: Multimedia Game - Vol I: Variety Pack

description:
The Great Math Adventure is an educational game which aims to teach math skills to kids between six and nine. The player accompanies Lil' Howie on his adventure through six activities:

  • The Big Time: This mini-game is about the calendar and the clock. The player has to answer a number of questions, e.g. ordering the months correctly.
  • Blasteroids: This is a top-down shooter completely played with the mouse. The space ship can be moved horizontally or vertically in order to shoot space mines and asteroids. The asteroids have a number written on them which is either added (blue) or subtracted (red). The mines can only be shot when the overall number is exactly the same as written on the mine - but colliding with anything sets the number back to zero. The goal is to shoot as many mines as possible before the ammo runs out.
  • Catch A Match: The player has to match formula and result in this concentration variant.
  • Fractionizer: The player has to build a house by creating the correct wood lengths. This is done by using the correct fractions.
  • Ice Cream Match: The player has to complete a pattern with the correct number
  • Soaker: The player is given a formula (either addition, subtraction, multiplication or division) and has to click on the correct answer.

The games can either be played through the Great Adventure mode (the game chooses what activity to play and tallies up all points) or selected individually.

sample_screenshots.caption: A screenshot from the intro animation

title: The Great Math Adventure

alternate_titles.title: The Great War: 1914-1918 - A Strategic Simulation of the First World War

description:
The Great War: 1914-1918 is a turn-based strategy game set during World War I. It is played on an overhead map of Europe where the player either controls the Allies or the Central Powers. The main interaction is clicking on troops and giving them orders like moving, defending, attacking, etc. Which actions are available is decided based on the ZOC (Zone of Control) which basically means which nation has control over a territory. Each action costs GNP which stands for a nation's readiness to continue the war - if it runs out, the nation will have no recourse for enemy attacks and cities will be conquered without resistance. When GNP is zero and no cities are left, the nation surrenders. The only ways to gain GNP is either the automatic gain twice a year or transferring them from allied nations.

The game is based on historic execution of the real war. This means, for example, that some happenings (for example the US entry of war) are fixed and the nations have advantages and disadvantages, e.g. not every nation receives GNP twice a year, the Ottoman Empire has a max limit of six GNP or Great Britain/USA will never surrender because their cities are not part of the game map. The winning conditions are different for the Allies (Russia has to be kept in the war and a armistice reached by November 1918) and the Central Powers (Russia has to surrender until October 1917 and a armistice avoided).

The registered shareware version unlocks the option to play as the Allies as well as an alternative scenario in which Germany concentrates its troops on Russia instead of France.

sample_screenshots.caption: Some historical occurrences are fixed (unregistered shareware version)
The information screen of an allied nation (unregistered shareware version)
The game takes place on this map of Europe (unregistered shareware version)
The result of the first turn (unregistered shareware version)

title: The Great War: 1914-1918

description: This game has two players (player versus computer, or player versus player) strategically place links between the grid squares in order to make a box. Each box made reveals a part of the picture, scores points and allows the player that made the box an additional turn. The game ends when the entire picture is revealed. The winning player is the one with the highest score.
title: Boxem

description:
Girls & Poker 2.0 is a shareware strip poker game.

You start with 100 credit points and the minimum deal or draw cost you 1 point. The maximum bet is set as 10 points. Every time you win, your opponent takes off one cloth, but it is limited to three times/clothes, since it is a shareware version. The full registered version features three opponents. You could "order" more opponents from the developper, or import your own pictures.
title: Girls & Poker 2.0

description:
Send laser beams from emitters to receivers. The game board is a grid, with some parts already placed; other parts can be placed however you want. Parts include mirrors, half mirrors to split beams, prisms to split light into different colors, and color filters to change the color of the beam.

The game includes premade puzzles, and also allows you to build your own puzzles, as well as experiment with the various parts.

sample_screenshots.caption: A simple puzzle, opened in editing mode
Two parts have been added to the board
Starting out without a puzzle loaded
Running the potential solution to see if it works

title: Laser!

description:
Uncover the hidden alien ships.

Q is a puzzle game based on Black Box and similar games, but on a hexagonal grid. Fire proton beams into the field, see where they bounce out, and use that to determine where the ships are hiding. But beware; one wrong guess, and the game ends. You can mark potential locations of ships, and draw lines to help you, but you eventually have to make a choice.

The number of ships can be selected: 4-18 (4-6 in the shareware version). A two-player mode is available, where one player will place the hidden ships, then the other player will find them.
title: Q

alternate_titles.title: Asterix & Obelix: Auf der Suche nach dem schwarzem Gold

description:
Asterix & Obelix: Searching for the Black Gold is an adventure game. It is essentially a digital version of the comic book ''Asterix and the Black Gold'' with voice acting and an encyclopedia about Asterix. Included are six minigames:

• Wild Boar Hunt
• Pirate Quiz
• Battleship
• Numerobis’ House
• The Archway to Tyre
• Barrels o’Fun
title: Asterix & Obelix: Searching for the Black Gold

description: Engine is a simulation of a broken engine. Using the description of the operation of the engine, along with an animated version of the engine, determine what needs to be done to the engine to fix it. Each game will have different symptoms and fixes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Figured it out (after a few tries)

title: Engine

description:
The Great Word Adventure 1 is an educational game which aims to teach grammar, letters, phonics and word skills to kids between six and nine. The player accompanies Lil' Howie on his adventure through six activities:

  • Stink Gun - The player has to shoot the words which match the given definition, e.g. all words which are colors. The player can move left and right and shoot directly upwards. However, there are obstacles in the way which bounce the shots around the screen (similar to pinball bumpers). Each correct word rewards points.
  • Scary Stories - A Word Search game, in which words can be forwards and backwards. This is followed by a rotate squares game, where combo words must be made.
  • Peanut Scale - A Hangman variant , in which the play must guess Howie's secret word, one letter at a time.
  • Cheese Game - A Whac-A-Mole variant. The player has to hit the rats which carry words matching the given definition, e.g. all words which rhyme with "land".
  • Ballroom - Various cartoon characters sing and dance. The player has to choose the correct rhyming words in order to keep the song going.
  • Attic - Several items are represented by their name and a picture. Now the player has to choose the correct one which matches the given definition, e.g. an animal which swims.

The games can either be played through the Great Adventure mode (the game chooses what activity to play and tallies up all points) or selected individually.

sample_screenshots.caption: On this map, we can choose the next activity
A screenshot from the intro animation

title: The Great Word Adventure 1

description: Gulliver's Voyage to Lilliput is an interactive storybook based on the novel Gulliver's Travels. Every page features narrated text along with a (sometimes animated) picture. When hovering over a marked word with the mouse, a word definition pops up. The puzzle section features four scrambled pictures which have to recreated by switching the tiles with each other.

sample_screenshots.caption: Clicking on the highlighted words gives an explanation
The first page of the storybook

title: Gulliver's Voyage to Lilliput

description:
Gus and the Cyberbuds: Sing, Play & Paint-A-Long is an educational music game for children between three and eight. It features six songs (Animal Shenanigans, Down by the Bay, Imagination, The Ants Go Marching, Old MacDonald's Farm and I Am A Fine Musician) with three game modes:

  • Sing: The song is played and is accompanied by an animation. The lyrics are also shown, karaoke-style, so the player can sing along.
  • Play: The player can add a variety of icons (e.g. animals, trees, etc.) to the background. When playing the song, those icons stay on the screen.
  • Paint: The player can use simple painting tools to paint over the background while the song is optionally playing in the background.
title: Gus and the Cyberbuds: Sing, Play & Paint-A-Long

description:
Gus and the Cyberbuds: Stellar Game Center! is a collection of six mini-games divided into four sections:

  • Clam-o-Rama: a Concentration variant with sea animals.
  • Create a Creature: The player can choose various facial features and clothing to create a face.
  • The Write Stuff: the player has to complete a partially written letter by dragging icons on the blank parts. There are no right or wrong choices.

The last section, Melody Madness, evolved around numbered bottles which are filled with different amounts of water. The three mini-games are: - Clicking on the correct bottles (the correct numbers are written out) to re-create a song. Alternatively the player can use the bottles freely to create a new melody. - A Simon Says variant. - Filling the bottles with the correct amount of water in order to match the given music notes.

All mini-games except Melody Madness were already included in previous entries of the series.
title: Gus and the Cyberbuds: Stellar Game Center!

description:
Gus and the Cyberbuds: Software Schoolhouse - Write On is an educational game which aims to teach creative writing to children. This is a standalone version of a mini-game previously used in Gus Goes to Cyberopolis and the majority of the disc is filled with promotions for other Modern Media Ventures products.

The game presents the game with an unfinished letter. The player can fill in the blank spaces by dragging icons onto the letter. There are no right or wrong choices. Optionally the finished letter can be read out by a narrator or saved for later viewing.

sample_screenshots.caption: We can save up to four letters
Using icons to complete the letter
We are currently listening to the narrated letter.

title: Gus and the Cyberbuds: Software Schoolhouse - Write On

description:
NFL Math is an educational game which aims to teach children about math. Each play is resolved by solving a math question which is always set as text problem. The goal is of course to answer as many questions as possible so the own team wins the match. The questions are divided into four categories (Number Sense, Geometry, Algebra and Statistics & Probability) and have four difficulty levels. The matches itself are either single or playoffs (a series of six matches).

The team also has a power level for six statistics (three defense and three offense) which can be improved by playing mini games:

  • Running/Run Defense: The player controls an athlete who automatically drives forward on the field with a motorcycle. Obstacles are avoided by moving left and right. The goal is to move as long as possible without crashing.
  • Blocking/Tackling: The player controls an athlete (left and right) who automatically moves forward on the field. The goal is to get close to enemy athletes to attacking them by pressing the space bar.
  • Pass Defense: The player controls two athletes (left and right) which are positioned besides each other in the middle of the screen. The goal is to intercept passes by enemy athletes who are positioned at the top and bottom of the screen.
  • Passing: This is the only mini-game which has a first-person perspective (the others are diagonal-down). The player moves the athlete's hand left or right and has to pass the ball to another player. Unfortunately there are a multitude of moving obstacles on the field which should not be hit.

sample_screenshots.caption: The head's coach corner has explanations for all math topics

title: NFL Math

description: Hero's Adventure: Save the Princess is a point & click adventure. The princess was abducted by an evil wizard and the hero has to save her. To do so, he travels through six lands, each represented by multiple screens. In order to progress, the hero has save puzzles. Examples are navigating the screens without being killed or using collected items on other items on screen. After each land, a password is rewarded.
title: Hero's Adventure: Save the Princess

description:
Rudyard Kipling's How the Leopard Got His Spots is an interactive storybook based on the children's story of the same name. Each page is narrated and accompanied by an animation. Afterwards follows a screen where the player can click around to trigger animations. Four pages additionally have the option to participate in an activity:

  • A version of the traditional board game Mancala. Each players have an amount of beans divided into six compartments. Each round, a player empties a compartment and the beans are divided counterclockwise. When a bean falls into an empty compartment, they and the content of the corresponding other player's compartment are captured. The game ends when one side is completely empty and the player with the most beans wins. This game can also be played with another human player.
  • A concentration variant with sound. When clicking on a stone, an African chant is played. The goal is to match the identical chants.
  • A jigsaw puzzle with animal pictures
  • Changing the coloration of animations in a drawn picture.

sample_screenshots.caption: Each page has an animated portion...
There is also some bonus content, e.g. an interview with the artist

title: Rudyard Kipling's How the Leopard Got His Spots

description:
Jeopardy is an adaption of the TV show of the same name. It closely follows the original ruleset: the game board has 30 fields which are divided into six categories and five difficulty levels (each marked with a certain money amount). One of the three candidates chooses a field, is given a hint and has to answer in form of a question. Most of the time, all candidates can buzz in to answer the question. However, when a daily double field was chosen, the candidate can bet some of their money and answer the question without interruptions. A correct answer rewards the money, but a wrong answer means the amount is subtracted from the candidate's score and another candidate can buzz in. After all fields are answered the second round is exactly the same with doubled money rewards and risks. The third round has only a single question and the candidates have to bet a certain amount of money before the hint is revealed.

In this adaption, the question part (e.g. "Who is...") is already filled out and the player only has to type in the relevant part. It features 60000 question and live-action video from the host and the candidates. It can be played with up to three human players or against the AI.

sample_screenshots.caption: We have to type in the answer
The Daily Double field was chosen
This is the actually the host of the TV show

title: Jeopardy!

description: Jeopardy!: Sports Pack is an expansion for Jeopardy!. It adds 1.220 new answers in 120 new categories which are all about sports. After installing the expansion, the player has to choose between this and the old data set, i.e. they can't be mixed.
title: Jeopardy!: Sports Pack

description: Jeopardy: TV & Movie Pack is an expansion for Jeopardy!. It adds 1.220 new answers in 120 new categories which are all about movies, TV and related topics. After installing the expansion, the player has to choose between this and the old data set, i.e. they can't be mixed.

sample_screenshots.caption: An example of the new categories

title: Jeopardy!: TV & Movie Pack

description: 4 Stroke Engine is a game about troubleshooting various issues on an engine. Your goal in the game is to complete the repair with the least amount of wasted money on parts.
title: 4 Stroke Engine

description:
The Jungle Book: The Legend of Mowgli is a multiple-choice adventure with live-action footage. Mowgli is standing in the jungle and the player can choose the direction where he should go. The available choices are left, right and straight forward. After watching footage of Mowgli walking through the jungle, there are three possible outcomes: Mowgli meets a human (after watching some additional live-action footage, the player continues with choosing the next direction), Mowgli meets an animal (now the player can optionally read some facts about it) or Mowgli meets a monster (game over). The goal is to reach the temple without meeting the monster.

Additionally the game includes the original novel by Rudyard Kipling, a short biography of Kipling and some educational facts about India.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts and we have three choices
The game also includes a short bio about Kipling

title: The Jungle Book: The Legend of Mowgli

alternate_titles.title: Guaranteed Success with Typing for Students

description:
One day, the wise man of his koala tribe has a present for Kewala: a map which shows the way to a far away land. The best part: it is Kewala's inheritence! Of course he directly rides his Emu towards his new goal.

Kewala's Typing Adventure is an educational game which teaches touch typing. Each lesson, representing a step in Kewala's journey, introduces new letters and general advice like the correct posture. The majority of the time is spent with typing the given sentences. At first those are just letter combination to practice the already introduced parts, but later those evolve into complete words and sentences. After each lesson, the player is given a statistical analysis of the performance and the option to participate in a bonus challenge. Here the player has to type as fast as possible within a time limit. The game keeps track of the player's overall points. Besides doing well in the lessons and challenges, the game also rewards bonus points for feats like doing multiple lessons in a single day.

Besides the training adventure, there is also the Royal Challenge for players proficient with touch typing available. Here the player types short stories.

sample_screenshots.caption: Setting up the options including the WPS (words per minute) goal
The result of the first lesson

title: Kewala's Typing Adventure

description:
In Kid Vid Grid, the player has to unscramble a running cartoon. The number of tiles is variable, including progressive options where the video directly re-scrambles with a harder difficulty after it was solved. The goal is to be as fast as possible.

There are four playing modes: drag and drop (the player can switch any two tiles), perfection (like drag and drop, but the video re-scrambles if both pieces end up in a wrong position), slider (a classic sliding puzzle: the player can only switch the blank tile, which is always the bottom right tile, with an adjacent one) and random corners (like slider, but the blank tile can be from anywhere). To increase the difficulty, the video orientation can additionally be changed to upside down or inverted.

The nine cartoon clips are licensed from Hanna-Barbera cartoons: Snagglepuss, Huckleberry Hound, Darstadly and Muttley, Dino and Cavemouse, Pixie and Dixie and 2 Stupid Dogs.

sample_screenshots.caption: We used custom mode to change the playing mode to random corners and inverted pieces
We have to unscramble the running video

title: Kid Vid Grid

description: In Kid's Pumpkin Puzzles, the player has to reassemble a torn apart pumpkin. In order to do so, the pieces have to grabbed with the mouse and dragged to the correct position on the screen. The goal is to finish this task as fast as possible (the game only counts the minutes, though). There are overall eight pieces and one of them is fixed in the middle of the screen.
title: Kid's Pumpkin Puzzles

description:
Kid Riff is an educational game about music. The five lessons, represented by houses on the overhead map, teach the player about various aspects of music. However, they don't work with specific tasks or theoretical explanations. Instead the rooms are set up with various buttons and tools. Those are designed for learning about the topics through experimentation. If a player needs guidance, clicking on the light bulb gives a suggestion what to try next.

The five houses are the Instrument Inn (learning about various musical instruments), Scale Shack (rhythm and scale), Rhythm Room (rhythm), Mirror Mansion (adding variations to musical notes) and Concert Castle (combining everything to create full songs).
title: Kid Riffs

description:
Scandal in 1697: the Queen's necklace was stolen from the French court! Now the player has to assist Louis Cat Orze, the pet of Louis XIV, to investigate the crime and catch the culprits. Each day (the investigation takes place over six days which can be freely changed from a menu), the player can visit various locations in Versailles and the court. Inside the single-screen locations, the player can click on persons and items to trigger dialogue (without participation of the player character) or acquire hints like notes. The winning condition is visiting the king during the last day and answer multiple-choice questions to name the perpetrator and proof.

Sometimes the player may need to fulfill prerequisites to enter a location, e.g. a key has to be acquired on a previous day to unlock a locked room. Every location switch also costs money - and visiting the king is the most expensive of all. After the starting budget of 1000 Livre is spent, it is time to earn additional money by correctly answering trivia questions about the time period. Especially lucrative is the palace challenge which can be found by clicking on the hidden spot in each location.

As this is an educational game, there is a lot of historical reference material available. Double clicking on a person opens up a portrait where both a written and a narrated biography from the character's point of view can be accessed. Understanding the who is who of the court is vital to solving the game. All biographies can also be accessed from the hall of portraits. The library has a collection of educational texts about the time period and the map room shows the world geography of 1697.

sample_screenshots.caption: We meet out companion, Louis Cat Orze
We have to pay money to enter locations
Double-clicking on a person leads us to the biography screen

title: Louis Cat Orze: The Mystery of the Queen's Necklace

description:
The Frog Prince is an educational game for children ages 3 - 10.

Journey with the Frog Prince as he searches for the princess with a kind heart to change him back to Prince Adrian. The game encourages children to think about the qualities of friendship, and the importance keeping promises, and being kind to others. The child searches for the Frog Prince in 12 possible different locations. Includes the game "What is Friendship?", which help children focus on and learn productive values and positive ways to deal with friendship and loneliness.
title: The Frog Prince

description: The player’s only aim in the game is using the mouse cursor in the form of a fly swat to constantly swat bugs as fast as possible for points. Swatting a bat, which differs from bugs requires a right-click. Points are deducted for missing bugs. The game can be played in three different speeds.

sample_screenshots.caption: Even more bugs and a bat

title: Angela's Bug Swat

description:
Microsoft Complete Baseball: '94 Edition is an encyclopedia about US baseball. It offers records, team and player databases; a season almanac and historical information about the sport. The content is adapted from the book Total Baseball.

Most importantly, there is also a trivia game. Here the player has to solve one multiple-choice question after another (usually four answers, sometimes two). When manually ending the game, the program calculates the correct answer percentage for the high-score list. There is no ending condition and it is possible to temporarily leave the game to look up the answer in the database. In the pregame warm-up mode, the player has three guesses (although only the first counts for the statistics) and the game gives an explanation about the correct answer. In the all-star challenge mode, the game directly jumps to the next question after the first answer.

sample_screenshots.caption: A sample of the subscription newsletter available over modem
After leaving the match, the game calculates our success rate for the high-score list

title: Microsoft Complete Baseball: '94 Edition

description:
Microsoft Complete Interactive Guide to Baseball: 1995 Edition is an updated version of Microsoft Complete Baseball: '94 Edition. In addition to the new data of the 1994 season it adds a section about baseball stadiums and a searchable index for all video and audio material.

Besides a few cosmetic changes to the interface and more questions, the trivia game remains identical. Here the player has to solve one multiple-choice question after another (usually four answers, sometimes two). When manually ending the game, the program calculates the correct answer percentage for the high-score list. There is no ending condition and it is possible to temporarily leave the game to look up the answer in the database. In the pre-quiz warm-up mode, the player has three guesses (although only the first counts for the statistics) and the game gives an explanation about the correct answer. In the all-star challenge mode, the game directly jumps to the next question after the first answer.

sample_screenshots.caption: The data was updated with the 1994 season
We have to answer multiple-choice questions
The new index of audio and video content
We start a new trivia game

title: Microsoft Complete Interactive Guide to Baseball: 1995 Edition

description:
Microsoft Complete NBA Basketball: '94-'95 Season is an encyclopedia about US basketball. It offers records, team and player databases; a season almanac and historical information about the sport.

Most importantly, there is also a trivia game. Here the player has to solve one multiple-choice question after another (usually four answers, sometimes two). When manually ending the game, the program calculates the correct answer percentage for the high-score list. There is no ending condition and it is possible to temporarily leave the game to look up the answer in the database. In the pregame warm-up mode, the player has three guesses (although only the first counts for the statistics) and the game gives an explanation about the correct answer. In the all-star challenge mode, the game directly jumps to the next question after the first answer.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the pre-quiz warm-up we receive information about the correct answer
The game features articles about basketball history
We have to answer multiple-choice questions

title: Microsoft Complete NBA Basketball: '94-'95 Season

description: Microsoft Multimedia Mozart is a musical encyclopedia about the classical musician Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. It features biographical texts about Mozart, a musical analysis ofString Quartet No. 19 and - most importantly - a trivia game. Up to four players battle on a grid of 8x8 fields. The goal is to move the piece to a certain field. However, each step requires answering a multiple-choice question correctly. The questions are either about music (i.e. identifying a instrument by ear) or Mozart's life.

sample_screenshots.caption: We have to answer a multiple-choice question to move forward
We answered wrong and read up on the answer

title: Microsoft Multimedia Mozart

description: Microsoft Multimedia Schubert is a musical encyclopedia about the musician <moby developer="Franz Schubert. It features biographical texts about Schubert, a musical analysis of Die Forelle and - most importantly - a basic concentration variant. The player has to match stones which play the same musical tune when touched.

sample_screenshots.caption: We read a text about Schubert's life
Our reward for finishing a game

title: Microsoft Multimedia Schubert: The Trout Quintet

description:
YATC stands for Yet Another Tetris Clone but it is in fact a game in the style of Dr. Mario.

There are bugs randomly distributed on the screen that you need to destroy by combining three of a color with the two blocks pills that drop from the top of the screen that you control. It features a pill preview where you can see the next pill that will drop. You beat a level if you clear all the bugs out, you lose if you fill up the screen and can't place the next pill.
title: YATC

description:
During a world travel, Rex and Teri decide to make a bet with Derik and Della that if they win a game of Dino Tiles, they can continue to travel with them, but if they lose, they stay behind.

Each stage representing a part of the world is divided into multiple levels. In a level, a player has to make as many matches (of the same shape and color) from two tiles as possible and get more points than the opponent. Getting a bonus tile or successful match allows the player another turn. The player loses if the opponent has more points by the end of the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'll take you to the pyramids

title: Dino Tiles

description:
Taking inspirations from Star Trek, this game has the player take the role of a ship captain on a voyage to protection the local Federation and eliminate the Klingon Horde.

Missions mainly consist of a set number of Klingon warships to destroy at particular quadrants within a limited Stardate time. The bridge of the titular ship displays a console made up of five instruments and a command menu, which is used to progress through the mission. Five additional tools can be accessed from the Computer menu for more information. Careful decisions need to be made to get around the galaxy and destroy all Klingons.

sample_screenshots.caption: All messages are shown at the top of the screen

title: NCC-1701

description: The Simpsons (attempt to) play Othello is a two-player Othello/Reversi game. It distinguishes itself with unofficial The Simpsons branding. Pictures of characters from that show exist on the side of the board, and if clicked on will say a catchphrase from the show.
title: The Simpsons (attempt to) play Othello

description:
Sparky's Tangled Tales in Spellingsburg is a spelling-focused edutainment game aimed at children between the ages of 3 and 6. The game stars a talking TV set named Sparky in his home of Spellingsburg. There are three modes of play, representing difficulty levels: Hide and Seek, Spelling, and Super Spelling. The first of those is a simple game mode aimed at the youngest players with no spelling involved, while the latter two are identical save for harder words on Super Spelling.

The object of the game is to go around Spellingsburg picking up souvenirs from each of its locales. You must first locate Sparky in the location, and then if you picked Spelling or Super Spelling, you will play a quick minigame in which you are given a visual representation and a hint for the word you need to spell in the form of a video clip. If you can spell the word all the way out without making any mistakes, you will get both of the souvenirs you need, but if you make a mistake, you will only get one. If you make two mistakes, you will get either one or none, depending on what Sparky decides. Once you gather all the souvenirs, they will be placed randomly across a "tangled tale", which is a mad libs story.

The game is fully played with a point and click interface and features a hand-drawn art style. The game also includes two extra video clips to introduce children to the alphabet and phonics.
title: Sparky's Tangled Tales in Spellingsburg

description:
Frigate Commander is a naval-themed combat arcade game.

The player takes control of an ultra-modern, world-class battle wagon to search out and destroy hostile submarines. The player's ship moves laterally at the top of the screen, while enemy submarines lurk in the depths below. The ship can drop depth charges while avoiding enemy torpedoes. There are multiple levels of play.
title: Frigate Commander

description:
Räkna med Alfons is a Swedish math game starring Alfons Åberg (Alfie Atkins), well known from children books and animated cartoons. In this game Alfons teaches you to do simple math and count using visual and sound aids.

You start out by picking from one of eight mini-games ranging from counting to memory games, you then click on the active objects on the screen to select your answer.
title: Räkna med Alfons

description:
Paigow Poker is a computer version of the casino game for Windows 3.x.

The game is played with a standard 52-card deck plus a single joker. The goal is to create a five- and two-card poker hand that beats the two hands of the dealer. If the dealer ties or beats both player's hands then the player loses.
title: Paigow Poker

description: The Essential Frankenstein explores the story of Mary Shelley's 1818 novel Frankenstein and much up to date material it was based on. Available to the player are video clips from a number of movie adaptations, a dramatic retelling of the novel, and many other features, plus Apogee Software's Monster Bash included.
title: The Essential Frankenstein

description:
13 Out is a solitaire card game played with a standard 52-card deck. It is a variant of the solitaire game "Canfield". The objective is to move all cards to the four foundation piles, each built of 13 cards of increasing value and of the same suit.

The game begins with one card dealt into the first of the foundation piles, determining the starting rank for all foundations. For example, if a 9 is dealt, each foundation must start with a 9 and continue sequentially, cycling through the deck. An available card can be placed on a foundation pile at any time, but once placed there, it can no longer be removed.

Below the foundation piles is a tableau of four piles, each pile initially containing a single face-up card. Each pile of the tableau can be extended with cards of descending value (King is considered one lower than Ace) and alternating colors. An empty tableau pile can be filled with any available card. Cards can be moved between the tableau piles, singly or in groups. However, only the top card of each tableau pile can be moved to a foundation pile.

Additionally, a reserve pile of 13 cards is set up at the beginning. At any time, only the top card of this reserve is visible and available for play.

The remainder of the deck forms a stockpile. The player can turn over cards from this stockpile, in a way which depends on the chosen gameplay mode: it can be one card at a time, or three cards at a time, where only the topmost revealed card is available for play.

sample_screenshots.caption: The different card backs to choose from

title: 13 Out

description:
Casino Pack I is a collection of four casino games for Windows 3.x.

  • Blackjack: Play from 1, 2, 4, or 6 decks; has casino-style double down, splitting, and insurance; offers save game feature
  • Keno: Choose from 1–15 numbers; has variable speed animation of ball display; offers save game feature
  • Poker: Standard "Jacks or Better" or "Jacks Wild" options; double down option; five different card backs; save game feature
  • Roulette: European and US board layout options; 1–2 player options; chip value of $1 to $100; 12 different bet types
title: Casino Pack I

description:
35 Great Games for Windows is a collection of 35 shareware games for Windows:

Arcade games:

  • Asteroids
  • Block Breaker
  • Lunar Lander
  • Ski
  • Tris 1993
  • Win Trek

Casino Games:

  • Blackjack
  • Canfield
  • Craps
  • Draw Poker
  • Roulette
  • Slot Machines

Family Games:

  • Bago
  • Chinese Checkers
  • Concen
  • Cribbage
  • Hearts
  • Mr. Mind
  • WinWheel

Games of Strategy:

  • Backgammon
  • Checkers
  • Mahjongg
  • Miles Bones
  • Solus
  • Spider
  • Things
  • WinChess
  • Yahtzee

War Games:

  • Aforce
  • Attaxx
  • BattleGrid
  • Hyperoid
  • Mines
  • Steller Explorer (sic)
  • Warheads for Windows
title: 35 Great Games for Windows

description:
35 More Great Games for Windows is a collection of shareware games for Windows 3.x:

Arcade Games:

  • Block Breaker
  • Bow & Arrow
  • Curling - Ice Game
  • Football
  • Helicopter Combat
  • Hurricane Navigation
  • Jewel Thief
  • King Kong
  • Sharks vs. Fish
  • Slam - Air Hockey

Casino Games:

  • Jackpot Slots
  • Poke It Poker
  • Roulette

Card Games:

  • Accordion
  • Contract Bridge
  • Card Shark Hearts
  • Carlton

Family Games:

  • Jigsaw Puzzle
  • Ouija Board
  • Parchezzi (sic)
  • Pocket Billiards
  • Scissors, Paper, Stone
  • Spin n' Win
  • Tic-Tac-Toe

Games of Strategy:

  • Brain Cubes
  • Brain Jam
  • Brain Teaser
  • Coin Toss
  • Crossword Puzzle
  • Cryptology
  • Four Wins - Board Game
  • Maze Maker

War Games:

  • Dominate
  • World Empire Deluxe II
  • World Seige (sic)
title: 35 More Great Games for Windows

description:
Mile Bones is an unofficial adaption of the card game Mille Bornes. Its background scenario is a driving trip. The player drives against the AI in order to reach 700 miles first. The game is turn-based and has four types of cards: mileage cards (playing them increases the driven miles), hazard cards (hinder the other player), remedy cards (used to counter hazard cards) and safeties (prevent a type of hazard permanently).

This version includes optional help functions (beeps or text boxes when attempting wrong moves) and the option to expand the goal to 1000 miles after the 700 goal mile was reached.

sample_screenshots.caption: An optional error messages after attempting a wrong move

title: Mile Bones

description:
In Mission: Caduceus, the player is charged with an urgent delivery to the medical station Caduceus. Unfortunately, the space ship crashes on an uncharted planet. Now the player has to explore said planet in order to repair the ship.

This is a typical first-person adventure game: the player searches for interactive spots on screen and clicks on them with the mouse. A left click uses the 'look at' command and with a right click the game chooses an appropriate action, e.g. collecting an item. These items are then used on screen in order to solve puzzles.

sample_screenshots.caption: This screen has some obvious hot spots
We change screens with the arrows
We made a mistake and died

title: Mission: Caduceus

description:
Monster in the Park is a puzzle game in which the player has to stop a monster by hitting it with a baseball. The baseball starts rolling into the park from the left side which has to be funneled to the correct spot on the right side. This is accomplished by building six fairground attractions which all have a defined entry and exit point, e.g. for the slide the entry point is left and the exit point downwards. Since the building slots use combs.

The position of the monster is chosen randomly after starting a new game and obstacles (which can be turned on or off) interfere with the available road. In addition to the normal mode, there is also a kid's mode where the ball can enter the attractions at any direction.

sample_screenshots.caption: We built some attractions and pressed "start"
The position of the monster is chosen randomly after starting a new game

title: Monster in the Park!

description: Moving Puzzle: Fun Sports is a puzzle game. The player chooses one of nine short video clips which were broken up into tiles. In order to solve the puzzles, the tiles have to be turned left or right until they are in the right orientation and dragged to the correct place on screen. In this entry of the series, the videos are from sports activities like skiing or bungee jumping.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing the next puzzle with options
Introduction after adding a new player profile

title: Moving Puzzle: Fun Sports

description: Moving Puzzle: Wild Life is a puzzle game. The player chooses one of nine short video clips which were broken up into tiles. In order to solve the puzzles, the tiles have to be turned left or right until they are in the right orientation and dragged to the correct place on screen. In this entry of the series, the videos are from animals.

sample_screenshots.caption: Introduction after adding a new player profile

title: Moving Puzzle: Wild Life

description: Mungo: The Only Pirate Left is an interactive picture book about the pirate Mungo. Each of the 15 screens features a picture and a small narrated text describing his adventures. The player can click on items and persons on the screen in order to activate animations. More animations are triggered when clicking on words in the text. In order to progress to the next picture, the player needs to click around until the hidden jack-in-the-box is found.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another animation was started by clicking on the word "pirate"
Clicking on the penguin started an animation

title: Mungo: The Only Pirate Left

description: The Mystery Egg is a puzzle game in which the players have to open five Easter eggs. Each of them requires a different logic puzzle to solve, e.g. a lights out puzzle or figuring out a correct code. Each puzzle also has a single hint which can be optionally shown.

sample_screenshots.caption: Puzzle 3: Switching tiles to create an image
After solving a puzzle, the next egg is revealed

title: The Mystery Egg

description:
Riverboat Poker is a Windows-based card game featuring 45 different poker games with high, high/low, and lowball options.

Includes a variable number of player and speed settings, plus the ability to save and restore games. Betting limits for bankrolls, antes, early and late betting rounds are all customizable. Five different music selections are available, and a full range of wild cards can be employed.

The player can compete against 12 different computer opponents based upon Riverboat-era legends, such as Jesse James, Jean Lafitte, or Davy Crockett. Each has their own bankroll and playing style.
title: Riverboat Poker

alternate_titles.description: Title stored in the included default configuration files
alternate_titles.title: WinJack for MicroSoft Windows

description:
BlackJack is a digital card game that simulates the classic casino game of Blackjack. The game's primary objective is to achieve a hand value closer to 21 than the dealer's hand, without exceeding 21. Players begin with a set amount of virtual money, which they can bet in each round.

The game interface includes the Player Bet Bank, where bets are placed, and the Player Chip Bank, which holds the player's total funds. Players use the mouse to transfer chips between these banks to place bets. Once a bet is placed, gameplay options such as taking additional cards (hitting), standing, surrendering, splitting, or doubling down become available, depending on the chosen game rules and the player's available funds.

The game also includes a Discard Pile feature, which provides statistics on cards previously played. This assists players in developing card counting strategies. The game also includes a Rules menu for customizing gameplay parameters, such as the size of the shoe and dealer's play, and a Hint menu offering guidance on optimal play. Additionally, players can save their game settings and parameters for future sessions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cutting the cards at the start of the game

title: BlackJack

description: Tetris for Windows is an adaptation of the game Tetris. The rules remain the same as in the original game: players need to rotate and maneuver dropping tetromino blocks, in order to form complete lines. The tetromino blocks fall faster on each level.

sample_screenshots.caption: The default high score table, filled with very 1989 jokes

title: Tetris for Windows

description:
Cards & Dice is a collection of 24 card and dice games for Windows 3.x.

Includes Show&Go CD Navigator to directly access all programs.
title: Cards & Dice

description:
Yacht-Z is an adaptation of the dice game Yahtzee. In each turn the player rolls five dice in an attempt to score points. After each roll the player can choose to re-roll all or some dice, up to two times per turn. Each turn ends when the player chooses a category in which to score his roll.

The scorecard is divided into several sections, with each section corresponding to a different category and allowing to choose that category three times throughout the game. Categories include: points for matching values (like two fours), sequences (like a small straight of 1-2-3-4), and special combinations like a Full House or Yacht-Z, the latter scoring 50 points for five of a kind. If a player rolls multiple Yacht-Zs, additional points can be earned in the Yacht-Z Bonus category.

The strategy lies in maximizing the points by strategically choosing which category to score in after each roll, with the game continuing until all scoring buttons have been used.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing the dice to keep or re-roll
The dice have just been rolled

title: Yacht-Z

description:
Puzzle 1 is a puzzle game taking place on a grid. The player's goal is to change every tile from the initial "up" state into a "down" state. Whenever an "up" tile is clicked, its state is changed from "up" to "down", but its neighboring tiles (in a pattern indicated by the shape drawn on the tile) also switch their state (from "up" to "down" or vice versa).

The grids can be set to different sizes, and it's possible to ask for a hint about what tile to press.

sample_screenshots.caption: After the puzzle is finished, all the clicked tiles are gradually shown...
Start of a puzzle on a 6x6 grid

title: Puzzle 1

description: Wondersoft's Game Pack is a collection of "memory match" puzzle games.
title: Wondersoft's Game Pack

description:
Casino is a collection of 5 casino games for Windows.

  • Blackjack
  • Baccarat
  • Draw Poker
  • Roulette
  • Slot Machines

The player can choose from 8 different card designs. In game instructions and information on odds to optimize chances of winning are available.
title: Casino

description: It is the night before Christmas and there is a problem: Santa has lost 10 gifts in his workshop. As one of Santa's elves, the player's job is to collect them. To do so, the elf has to be moved through the workshop which is built like a maze with ladders and impenetrable walls. After finding a present, it has to be brought to the collection bin while avoiding the patrolling enemy toys - touching them sends the gift right back to its original place. Without carrying a present, the enemies are harmless and can be touched without penalty. The elf can only carry one gift at a time.
title: The Night Before Christmas

description: War Time 2 is an add-on disc with 140 unofficial extra levels for WarCraft II: Tides of Darkness. The CD also includes several savegames, editor and utilities.
title: War Time 2

description: Off the Tracks! is a puzzle game in which the player has to connect the start and end of a railroad track by placing predefined tiles (straight and curves) on the screen. The game is won, when the player gives the move order and the train can move all the way to the end. The start and end positions are chosen randomly at each start. Options to make the game harder are obstacles (the player has to build around hills and/or bridges) and the hard mode which adds a time limit after the train starts to move automatically.

sample_screenshots.caption: We added some obstacles to make the game harder

title: Off the Tracks!

description: The second set of puzzles in the Lost & Found trilogy presented by Zach has twelve new scenes such as Bath Toys and Sea Bed with the same basic concept of finding eight random objects, aided by clues to find them, plus a flashlight and magnifying glass at the player’s disposal.
title: Lost & Found: Volume 2

description: This is essentially an upside-down Tetris variant, where the colored bubbles go upwards instead of downwards. The main goal is to match three or more colored bubbles on the bubble blocks, while trying not to cram the bottom of the screen and being aware other elements such as bonus smileys, stone blocks, and pins to burst bubbles and stone blocks.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is displayed as the game loads

title: Bubbles

description: Pharoah's Curse is a flip-screen platformer inspired by The Pharaoh's Curse. The player takes control over an explorer who has to collect 16 treasures in the pharaoh's pyramid. Every of the 16 screens has obstacles like traps and zombies which are deadly to the touch. While the traps have to be avoided, the zombies can be shot with the explorer's unlimited projectiles. Besides treasures, there are also keys to collect which open closed doors and ropes to climb. The three lives act like a life bar, i.e. the player's position is not reset and there is only a brief frame of invincibility. There is no fall damage.

sample_screenshots.caption: In this screenshot, there are zombies and traps to see
Besides treasures, there also keys to collect
Title screen (and also the first playable screen)
We stand right beside a treasure

title: Pharoah's Curse

description:
Pipe Dream is an unofficial conversion of Pipe Dream. The mechanics are identical to the original game: The game places a pipe on a random location of a 7x10 grid. Then the player places other random pipes (the next five can be seen in a preview) on the grid and connect them to each other and the initial pipe. The goal is to create a pipe network which keeps liquid into circulation as long as possible. Said liquid starts flowing from the initial pipe after a few seconds of play. It is possible to replace pipes with a new one as long as the liquid didn't reach it yet. Afterwards points are rewarded and retracted based on the player's performance.

The biggest difference to the original is the absence of different levels. There is only the choice between normal and fast speed.
title: Pipe Dream

description:
In Plot of the Cyberheads, El Paso (Texas) is overrun by hostile robots. They are controlled by the alien race Cyberheads which try to conquer the world. Earth's only defense is a all-female special forces team (except for their commander Sgt. Miller) which infiltrate the alien tunnels to destroy them once and for all. The player takes the role of an adviser which tells one of the members what to do.

The majority of the game is spent watching videos through three interface videos (interior cam, exterior cam and command link). There are two kinds of interactions: choosing to go left or right (one of the choices leads to death) and typing in access codes. Those are gained by listening to the dialogue and/or reading text journals which can be accessed from the main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here we have to make a choice: left or right
Here we have to type in the correct access code
This woman infiltrates the alien tunnels

title: Plot of the Cyberheads

description:
Prairie Dog Hunt for Windows is a shareware single-screen shooter. A bunch of prairie dogs pop out of predefined spots on the screen and the player's job is to move the crosshairs over them and shoot before they leave the screen. The only danger are rabid dogs which always pop out from the same spot and bite the player when they are not shot immediately. The game ends when either all dogs are dead, when all ammo is gone or when the player is infected with rabies after five bites.

There are three weapons available which can be changed on the fly and give a different amount of points for each kill: pellet gun (needs two shots, ten points), magnum (needs one hit, five points) or shotgun (hits all dogs on screen, one point). The number of dogs and the available ammo can both be customized in three steps.
title: Prairie Dog Hunt for Windows

description: Prairie Dog Hunt 2: Judgement Day is a shareware shooter. A bunch of prairie dogs pop out all over the screen and the player's job is to move the crosshairs over them and shoot before they leave the screen. The biggest changes compares to the predecessor are the extended playing area (i.e. the screen can be scrolled left and right) and the absence of rabid dogs. This means the only danger is not scoring enough points for the high-score list. The player can freely switch between four weapons (pellet gun, magnum, rifle and SPAS-12) which all have their own ammo pool. The number of dogs can be set freely between 10 and 100 and there are four difficulty levels to choose from

sample_screenshots.caption: Setting up a new game (unregistered shareware version)

title: Prairie Dog Hunt 2: Judgement Day

description: Puzzle Power: Crosswords and More includes two editors to create crossword and cryptogram (exchanging a letter with another letter) puzzles. Both include a number of predefined puzzles and allow the user to change the background color.
title: Puzzle Power: Crosswords and More

description: Puzzle Power: Wordsearch and More includes three editors to create wordsearch, quote falls (rearranging letters to create a quote) and kriss kross (filling a number of given words into a grid) puzzles. All three include a number of predefined puzzles and allow the user to change the background color.
title: Puzzle Power: Wordsearch and More

description: This Tetris-styled game takes some elements from "The Wizard of Oz" with tornadoes, wizard heads, emeralds and other kinds of blocks, which must be matched in columns of four or more. Each level requires the player to match the appropriate blocks to the right colored houses.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is displayed as the game load

title: Falling Oz

description: This puzzle-oriented game consists of matching columns of three or more marbles of the same color in corresponding cups. Making the job harder are boulders and bubbles which reduce space, while drills and starships can be used to destroy various objects.

sample_screenshots.caption: How the marbles are laid out
Cram all the marbles you can

title: Marbles

description: This game derives many elements from the first Marbles game, but introduces new features including diagonal positioned falling blocks, an indicator to see the blocks that come next, and a plethora of new challenging levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: A selection of brightly colored marbles
Just about the second Marbles game
This is displayed as the game loads

title: Marbles II

description:
Four Play is a compilation of four card games for Windows.

  • Discard: Solitaire with four tableaus and one stack of cards
  • Hearts: Players attempt to discard their hand, receiving points for every heart received
  • High Roller: A version of Yahtzee
  • Video Poker: Player decides bankroll and which cards to keep each hand
title: Four Play

description:
Reader Rabbit and Friends: Let's Start Learning! is an educational game for children between 3 and 8 years old. Reader Rabbit finds a carousel which promises to open a door to the Learning Kingdom for him and his friends. However, first he needs to find all of the keys by playing four mini-games:

  • Counting Club: Recognizing numbers
  • ABC Diner: Recognizing letters
  • Shape Shack: Recognizing and dividing shapes
  • Pattern Parade: Completing attribute patterns, e.g. by color

All mini games have four difficulty levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Reader Rabbit activates the carousel with a key

title: Reader Rabbit and Friends: Let's Start Learning!

description: In Kyle and Tyler's Reindeer Mazes, the player needs to guide one of Santa's reindeers through a maze. When moving the mouse cursor over one of the displayed directional arrows (no clicking), the reindeer moves into the direction of the arrow. The game includes nine mazes: one of them is chosen randomly after each game start, but the active maze can be changed at any time. The mazes feature no dangers or time limit and the reindeer sprite is not animated.

sample_screenshots.caption: We move through the mazes with the directional pad
Every maze starts with a short text
One of the other included mazes

title: Kyle and Tyler's Reindeer Mazes

description:
Robinhood & Marian is an alternative take on the saga of Robin Hood: Robin has reached his goal and is set to marry Marian! Unfortunately he lost the wedding ring and his green uniform during the bachelor party. Without his uniform, no one recognizes him anymore. In the role of Robin, the player's goal is to get all stuff back.

This is a classic adventure game: The player moves through a number of fixed screens and searches for items or persons which are identified when the mouse cursor moves over them. Robin interacts with his environment after a left click, e.g. collecting an item. Puzzles are solved by using collected items with other items on screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: We begin our quest for clothes
Robin meets the Sheriff of Nottingham

title: Robinhood & Marian

alternate_titles.title: Second Conflict: The Galactic Conflict Continues...

description:
Second Conflict is a turn-based strategy game. The setting is a war for the neutral Altarian sector which shortly before declared their independence from the Imperium (which was formed after the so-called first conflict). Now various Empire factions battle for control over Altarian.

The only graphical element is the map of the star system where the planets can be selected with the mouse. Everything else is done in menu screens which can be accessed over the command bar. The basic gameplay loop: At the start of each turn, each star system receives points which are calculated from the number of factories and morale. Those points are used to build units (ships and defenses). Those units can be sent to other systems in order to conquer them. Combat results are calculated without further player input.

The winner of the match is the faction with the most points after the match has ended. Said end comes when all human players are defeated, only one active player is left, the turn limit was reached or when a player achieves an optional victory term (can be set in the match setup). Reaching this victory term wins a lot of points, but does not guarantee overall victory. A game has between two and ten factions and all of them can be human.

sample_screenshots.caption: After each turn, the faction score is updated

title: Second Conflict

description:
This Snake variant has the player control the titular caterpillar Crawler through a neighborhood to wreck every yard and achieve a high score. The game can be played on three difficulty settings with zero, one, or two rocks to configure the challenge level.

In each yard the player must eat a set number of red Gernatiums, while avoiding deadly poison and obstacles, and collecting any bonus items along the way. Upon eating all required Gernatiums, an escape hole opens to the next yard.
title: Crawler!

description:
Joe, a member of the S.T.P.O (Specially Trained Police Officers) is after Dr. Wheatquer to arrest him for attempted world domination. However the mad doctor has transformed Joe into a chicken and sent him miles away from the laboratory.

Why Did the Chicken Cross the Road has a format very like Frogger, but the player is a chicken crossing roads, rivers, paths, and other terrains while avoid getting run over by the hazardous vehicles and other objects. The themes of the 50 levels vary from urban to Arctic to futuristic.

sample_screenshots.caption: At the other side of the road

title: Why Did the Chicken Cross the Road

description: Living Letters teaches the letters of the alphabet to young players, showing the uppercase letter, a paired picture of a thing or a person that begins with that letter, and the individual letters that spell the word. To help with the learning, there is a puzzle mode, in which the user either clicks on the letter that starts the word, or clicks on a letter in a word that is mis-positioned.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picked a small word this time

title: Living Letters

description: The Secret of Easter Island is a point & click adventure. The player visits Easter Island and has to stop a volcano from erupting. To do so, a mythical statue has to be found and return to its proper place. The gameplay follows the genre standards: moving the mouse over the screen to identify hot spots, clicking the left mouse button to interact with an item and using the right mouse button to move around and change screens. Collected items are used with other items on screen to solve puzzles and progress the plot.

sample_screenshots.caption: We found a piece of driftwood and added it to the inventory

title: The Secret of Easter Island

description: The game demonstrates the concept of simple math by counting, adding, and subtracting animals in various scenes with the numbers one till ten. The game uses PC-Speaker voices.

sample_screenshots.caption: Once I saw a fish alive
Two bees or not two bees

title: Action 123

description: ArithmeTick-Tack-Toe is based on the Tic-Tac-Toe board game, but each turn requires the player to successfully answer a simple math problem to make a move.
title: ArithmeTick-Tack-Toe

description: This slider puzzle game has the player rearrange pieces (by classic sliding or basic click and dragging) in a 2x2 to 10x10 grid to get a finished picture.
title: Zoë and Zachary's Puzzle

description: The player chooses from a selection of pictures to color with sixteen different colors by the numbers/letters/shapes/symbols and inside the lines.

sample_screenshots.caption: Let's not paint by the numbers

title: Zoë and Zachary's Color

description: There's a bomb that needs defusing. To defuse the bomb, the player has to find the secret code of four colors within the time limit with a limited number of tries. The game will clue the player on how many colors picked are the right ones and if they're in the correct order.
title: Bomb Squad

description: The object of the game is to play an animal sound with the speaker icon, then click the one out of six animals that matches the sound. Sound and voice can be played as normal digitized audio or PC Speaker.
title: Match'Em

description: Genie Math is designed to teach adjustable levels of math to players. Addends can range from 1 to 999, and the game can be played with a time limit as low as 30 seconds, or no time limit at all. Any math problems the player got wrong can be reviewed and retried.
title: Genie Math

description: This board game has one or two players attempting to catch one, two, or three foxes, using knight moves for each horse. The game's challenge can be bolstered, by allowing the opposing players to eliminate each other, make the foxes rabid, and place snakes across the board (hidden or revealed).
title: Knight Moves' Fox Hunt

description: A Simon Says variant memory game with six objects. The player simply clicks objects one after the another in the correct sequence, while trying to remember that sequence. The difficultly can be as low as Level 1 and as high as Level 200.
title: Win Simon

description:
Sonic the Hedgehog: KNP Collection is a compilation of three Sonic fangames made with the engine Klik & Play:

  • Sonic Boom!
  • Tails and the Quest of 100 Rings (pre-release demo version)
  • Sonic the Hedgehog (called Sonic PC)

sample_screenshots.caption: Tails ...and the story of the 100 rings: Title screen

title: Sonic the Hedgehog: KNP Collection

description: Sonic Boom is a Sonic fangame. Sonic and Tails move automatically forward and have to dodge bees by moving up and down. Getting hit three times results in a game over.
title: Sonic Boom!

description: Tails ...and the quest for 100 rings is a Sonic fangame. The player controls Tails in a submarine and moves through single-screen levels shown from a side perspective. Tails has to collect all rings without touching the enemies which move around on pre-defined paths. Enemy contact subtracts from Tails' health bar (represented by a number) and the game is over when it hits zero. A level is won when all rings were collected.
title: Tails ...and the quest for 100 rings

description: Sonic the Hedgehog is a Sonic fangame. The player controls Sonic who moves through single-screens. When hit by an enemy (which move on pre-defined paths and sometimes shoot projectiles), Sonic loses all collected rings. When he has no rings, the screen is reset without further penalty. The goal is to reach the end of all screens and fight an end boss.
title: Sonic the Hedgehog

description: Space Doubt is a point & click adventure. George is a scientist working in a space station. Because none of his shipmates showed up for his birthday, he starts to examine the station to found out what is wrong. The gameplay follows the genre standards: moving the mouse over the screen to identify hot spots, clicking the left mouse button to investigate an item, double click to interact with an item and using the right mouse button to move around and change screens. Collected items are used with other items on screen to solve puzzles and progress the plot.

sample_screenshots.caption: We picked up an access card...
...and use it to open a closed door

title: Space Doubt

description: The only goal of this game is to pop all the balloons in each level without getting hit by a bouncing ball. There are two modes. The first mode increases the number of bouncing balls in the next level. The second mode increases the number of balloons in the next level and retains only one ball, but also includes a 10-second time limit. The player loses the game if all three lives are lost or the timer runs out.
title: Balloon Pop

description: Duck Hunt II is a shareware shooter. The player controls a shotgun and shoots at ducks which fly around the screen. The goal is to earn a high score by shooting as many ducks as possible. The screen scrolls horizontally. The difficulty, the duck speed and the time limit (including none) can be changed in the options.

sample_screenshots.caption: We meet our friend, the dog

title: Duck Hunt II

description: Pheasant Hunt is a shareware shooter. The player controls a shotgun and shoots at pheasants which fly around the screen. The goal is to earn a high score by shooting as many birds as possible. The screen scrolls horizontally. The difficulty, the pheasant speed and the time limit (including none) can be changed in the options.
title: Pheasant Hunt

description: Pigeon Hunt is a shareware shooter. The player controls a shotgun and shoots at pigeons which fly around the screen. The goal is to earn a high score by shooting as many birds as possible. The screen scrolls horizontally. The difficulty, the pigeon speed and the time limit (including none) can be changed in the options.
title: Pigeon Hunt

description: Trap Shooting Pro is a shareware shooter. After calling in a clay pigeon, it is thrown into the air and the player's job is to shoot it either with the shotgun or the handgun. The goal is to earn a high score by shooting as many birds as possible. The screen scrolls horizontally. The difficulty and the clay pigeon color can be changed in the options.
title: Trap Shooting Pro

description: WinFish 3.0: Fly Fishing is a shareware fishing game. After choosing one of the locations, the bait (dry or wet) and the line type (floating or sinking), the player casts the line and waits for a fish to bite. Then the player needs to quickly click on the "set hook" button and reel the fish in. In this phase, there are two buttons to press: "reel in" and "reel out". It is important to balance the two buttons because reeling in too fast means the line breaks and too slow means the fish gets away. The last decision is to throw the fish back into the water or keep it.
title: WinFish 3.0: Fly Fishing

description: Spider-Man: Cartoon Maker is a program which allows children to create their own Spider-Man cartoons. After starting a new scene, the player can add pre-made backgrounds, items, persons, animations, sound effects and music to create a cartoon. It is also possible to record own dialogue through a microphone or free draw shapes into the scene. The included characters are based on the 1994 animated TV show. The cartoons can be exported and viewed without the program.

sample_screenshots.caption: All cartoon items are chosen from windows like this, in this example characters from the show
Here a pre-made scene with a lot of stuff in it
Watching one of the pre-made movies

title: Spider-Man: Cartoon Maker

description: Timmy the Dream Hunter is an interactive storybook which follows the kid Timmy and how he manages overcome his fear of the night. Each of the 15 panels is introduced with a narration and afterwards the player can click on items or persons to trigger animations. Each panel also holds a simple hidden mini game, e.g. matching the arm positions of a goblin or drawing a star constellation by clicking on spots in the given order.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first page of the storybook
Mini game: Drawing a star constellation
Mini game: Dragging the shapes to the correct place
Mini game: Matching the arm positions of the goblin
Mini game: Clicking on the shells with the right timing to keep the pearl bouncing

title: Timmy the Dream Hunter

description: Aux Origines de l'Homme is a French interactive CD-ROM introducing human evolution. It features videos (Video for Windows 1.1 is included) and also a knowledge quiz that comes in the form of multiple-choice questions. Three options are given for each question.
title: Aux Origines de l'Homme

description:
Living Numbers teaches the numbers one till ten to young players. There are three activities that demonstrate the concept:

  • A counting game, which consists of four scenes to count objects, gradually increasing one by one.
  • Dot To Dot - The player joins the dots in the corret order to draw a picture.
  • Mr. Number Head - Players can get creative and customize one of the number characters with eight different kinds of features.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got that pic of Number One

title: Living Numbers

description:
The Umbra Conspiracy is a remake of Presumed Guilty!. The overall story (now set in 2006 instead of 1996) and the gameplay stays largely the same with an updated UI. The big new feature are live-action videos.

We write the year 2006. After the democratic revolution, Russia has transformed into a national autocracy and a war between them and NATO over Ukraine and the Baltic states is imminent. The player takes control over Sparrow, a new computer agent of the Umbra spy organization. First assigned to investigate a suspicious car accident, he soon becomes the prime suspect himself...

The gameplay is completely focused on the COPNET computer platform. Here the player receives video messages (which are transcribed for later access) and reads documents. There are three ways for interaction: using the phone, the research function or the datasphere. When using the research function, the player types in a topic or name which is then researched by the system and eventually brings up related documents. The datasphere is an AI which holds archived records (such as video messages) and is used to retrieve DNA from objects and compare them with other DNA. Additionally, the player may use it to analyze or compare documents to find discrepancies. Both research and datasphere actions are restricted to a few operations at the same time.
title: The Umbra Conspiracy

description: Valentine Puzzles is a collection of three valentine-themed puzzles. Each of them features a picture with missing parts and the player's job is to drag 16 puzzle pieces to the correct place to complete the picture. There are three difficulty levels: easy (the pieces already have the correct orientation), medium (the puzzle pieces have to be rotated) and hard (all unplaced pieces rotate every 20 seconds).
title: Valentine Puzzles

description:
In Vampire, the player controls a vampire who prowls the streets to get his nightly dose of blood. The city is side-scrolling (it wraps around the sides) and has a lot of houses. If eyes are seen at a window, the vampire can knock at the door. Then the victim runs out and flees: the goal is to run after him and suck him dry. Alternatively the victim can also be turned into a zombie which can be controlled independently from the vampire for 30 seconds. After biting the required number of victims, the protagonist can return to the graveyard — failing to to do so until sunrise (6:00 am) means final death.

Besides the time limit, there are three other dangers to look out for: werecats slow the player down, vampire hunters throw stakes which drain blood and raven eggs freeze the vampire for 20 seconds. All of them have a countermeasure: running away from werecats, biting ravens and using zombies to kill vampire hunters.

sample_screenshots.caption: Those eyes mark a victim's house

title: Vampire

description:
Victory or Defeat is a turn-based strategy game. It prides itself for its scenario editor which allows to create new scenarios with new maps and city placement (both can be done randomly or manually). It also comes with four pre-made scenarios, including a map of Europe and a purely naval map.

The game itself pits two factions (red and blue) against each other. Each turn, players produce units which are then moved over the map to defend or attack cities. Before starting a game, the player(s) chooses the level of complexity: in the lower two, they only have access to pre-made units while the high complexity allows the production of customized units. The victory conditions are either cap kill (capture the enemy's capital), total destruction (destroy all enemy units and cities) or economic victory (hold a certain amount of cities for a certain amount of time, both variables are set at the beginning).

sample_screenshots.caption: Setting up one of the pre-made scenarios

title: Victory or Defeat

description:
VNC: Virtual Nightclub - A Game About Time is set in a virtual nightclub. While exploring its five zones to find a way out, the player will meet live-action characters and eventually investigate a murder.

The screens are often animated and have surreal viewpoints, but movement works similar to contemporary rendered adventures: clicking on the correct part of the screen starts a transition animation to another screen. Besides navigation, the gameplay consists of finding and using items as well as playing mini-games. Those are often music themed and require clicking on the correct parts of the screen with the correct timing.

sample_screenshots.caption: We watch a live-action video cutscene

title: VNC: Virtual Nightclub - A Game About Time

description:
Welcome to Bodyland is an education application which teaches kids about the human body. It is set in a theme park where every attraction is about a specific body part. Most of them pose a specific question like "how is food digested?" and explain it with animations, text, songs and sometimes small interactive elements.

The game part is a trivia quiz. The player is given a statement and has to decide if it is true or false. Depending on the answer, points are rewarded. After using the hint function, the application shows the relevant ride and allows the player to directly go there. Afterwards, it moves back to the quiz.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...and directly jump to the relevant part
There are also texts to read

title: Welcome to Bodyland

description:
Championship Pool is a 1 - 2 player top-down pool game for Windows 3.x.

The player controls the pool cue on the screen to aim the white ball. There is a save and recall feature, aim and ball tracking feature, and a ball-tracing feature.

Includes 5 game variants: straight, 8-ball, 9-ball, snooker, and billiards.
title: Championship Pool

description: Whac-A-Mole is exactly what you'd expect: there are five holes in the ground and moles pop in out. Every time a mole is outside, the player's job is to move a hammer over their head and hit them with a mouse click. After a certain amount of time has passed (which is not displayed on screen), the games displays the results and automatically starts the next round. There are multiple background images which are randomly chosen when starting a round.
title: Whac-A-Mole

description:
Wheel of Fortune: Deluxe Edition featuring... Vanna White is a video game based on the TV game show Wheel of Fortune. It works just like the original: three contestants try to guess a phrase or a similar text by spinning the wheel and then naming a consonant (vowels have to be bought with earned money without a spin). If it is included in the phrase, they are revealed and the candidate can spin again. Each correct consonant rewards money based on the dollar amount the wheel landed on. However, the wheel can also land on a special field, e.g. a free spin or bankruptcy. After a wrong guess, the next candidate is on unless a free spin has been collected. Each active candidate can try to solve the phrase.

The fourth round is the speed-up. Here the dollar amount is determined beforehand and each candidate has to guess one letter (vowels are free) and then has one try to solve the phrase. One candidate then proceeds to the bonus round. Here the game automatically reveals the letters R, S, T, L N and E and the candidate has to choose three additional consonants and one additional vowel. After all is revealed, there is one try to guess the phrase.

sample_screenshots.caption: After each round, one of the contestants receives a prize

title: Wheel of Fortune: Deluxe Edition featuring... Vanna White

description:
Wiggins in Storyland is an application which aims to help children with creative writing. The player can create their own picture book: writing a text on the left side and adding pictures on the right side. There are choices between various backgrounds, characters and effects. It is also possible to record dialogue with a microphone. In addition, the player can visit the living room of Wiggins the bookworm. Besides clicking around, triggering animations and listening to a few stories by historical authors, there are two games to play:

  • Tic Tac Toe
  • Five mazes with different scenarios. The goal is always the same: navigating through the maze and catching another moving character before the time limit runs out.
