sample_screenshots.caption: There are five mazes to select from

title: Wiggins in Storyland

description:
The protagonist's uncle has dies and he is presented with an unusual will: in order to inherit the fortune, he needs to find 16 gems which are hidden in and around the uncle's house.

The Will is a classic adventure game: The player moves through a number of fixed screens and searches for items are identified when the mouse cursor moves over them. The player interacts with his environment after a left click, e.g. collecting an item. Puzzles are solved by using collected items with other items on screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: We try to use the key on the door

title: The Will

description:
Wintrek is a shareware Star Trek variant. It does not explicitly reference the TV show and it characters (except by using Romulans as enemies), but uses a space ship icon based on the Enterprise and typical technical terms.

The goal is to destroy all Romulan warships within the turn limit. This is done by jumping between galaxies (represented by a 7x7 grid), searching for warships and using the two weapon systems (torpedoes and phasers) to fight them. Other commands are using short range or long range sensors to find Romulans and managing the energy distribution between weapons and shields. Movement commands for ships and probes have to be entered with specific commands (e.g. ship movement needs heading, distance and warp factor) which have to be calculated with a in-game calculation tools. There are also tools to calculate time and energy consumption.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using one of the pop-up windows to enter commands (unregistered shareware version)
Using the in-game calculator (unregistered shareware version)
Choosing a difficulty level (unregistered shareware version)

title: Wintrek

description:
Yacht is a shareware game which simulates the dice game of the same name. Compared to the original rule set, it adapts some aspects of Yahtzee.

Each player rolls five dices up to three times. After the first and second throw, they can choose what dices to re-roll. Afterwards, they have to commit to the result and choose one of the score categories. Each of the categories represents a combination of dice results and rewards a different amount of points. For example, if the result has three fours, the player can either choose the "Fours" or the "Three of a kind" category which both reward 3*4=12 points. Each category can only be chosen once per match and filling all six number-categories ("ones" to "sixes"), bonus points are rewarded. The goal is to score as many points as possible after 13 turns.

sample_screenshots.caption: We can also change some colors

title: Yacht

description:
Zaark and the Night Team: The Quest for Patterns is an educational game which teaches children about shapes and patterns. Zaark and his team of kids embark on four quests (three difficulty levels available for each) to save the day:

  • Save Melody Castle: The player has to recognize notes in order to rebuild the castle bridge.
  • Nab the Scrambler: Somebody messes up pieces of art in a museum and the team has to makes things right. This is done by recognizing and removing items which don't fit.
  • Rescue on Hoolie-Goolie Island: A monkey has to be dragged to the correct geometric shape.
  • Aid the Aliens: Matching pictures with the correct word.
title: Zaark and the Night Team: The Quest for Patterns

description: This memory matching game allows one to four players to match two pictures that are the same. There are 48 pictures to reveal and match, which make up all the letters of the alphabet. The winner is the player who scores the most points for getting multiple correct matches in a row.
title: Matchin' Mania

description: Taking on the card game Go Fish, the player tries to get more collections of the same card type than Roxie. The game can be played on three difficulty levels, using uppercase letters, lowercase letters, or number characters.
title: Roxie's ABC Fish

description: This variant of the card game Go Fish, has the player competing against Roxie to obtain the most card collections. The is playable on three difficulty levels, using additions, subtraction, multiplication, or division sums.

sample_screenshots.caption: How would you like to play?

title: Roxie's Math Fish

description: Based on the card game Go Fish, they player challenges Roxie to achieve the highest card collections. The player can choose one of three difficulty levels, and use word types that range from preschooler to late second grader.

sample_screenshots.caption: How do you want to play?

title: Roxie's Reading Fish

description: This falling block game has the player assembled four triangles of the same color to earn points. One of more triangle pieces descend from the top, which can be rotated, moved and instantly dropped.

sample_screenshots.caption: Make a quick trick block stack
How many triforces can you make?

title: TAZ

description:
This game is a small collection of four small board/tile games:

  • Leapfrog - Move a peg over another and into a hole to eliminate a peg until only one peg remains.
  • Round About - Turn all except one Mahjong tiles over in a clockwise direction.
  • Bamboo - A sort of cat-and-mouse game, which requires the player to move the blue peg 18 times without the yellow peg catching up.
  • Six Tiles - Rearrange the tiles so that they appear in numerical order.
title: Mysteries of the Orient

description: A direct take on Pac-Man, has the player sending Wordman around a maze, eating dots and avoiding Bad Guys, but also obtaining a key through spelling the word. Each correct letter obtained temporarily disables the Bad Guys. The goal is to collect all the dots before claiming the level prize.

sample_screenshots.caption: Giving the Bad Guys a fright

title: Wordman

description: The player simulates a basketball court in four different locations: Paris on Earth, the Moon's surface, on Jupiter, and space around Earth. The physics of the basketball differ depending on the locations level of gravity. The basketball hoop can be positioned left or right, and a ceiling can be added.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ball endlessly floating in space

title: LunarBBall

description:
Alien Dinosaurs travel to Earth to learn more about it and are amazed that human communication is made up of multiple languages. This program teaches reading words, sentences, and spelling in a variety of 18 languages. There are four activities to study the chosen language:

  • Picture dictionary - See the word accompanied by a picture.
  • Multiple choice - Choose one out four words that matches a picture.
  • Spelling - Type the individual letters on the keyboard that matches the word.
  • Letter invasion - Accept or reject a falling letter to spell out a word letter by letter.
title: Earth Words for Alien Dinosaurs

description: This game teaches beginner level math to young users. The material includes shapes, counting with numbers or words, more or less, addition, and subtraction.
title: Fun with Math Level 1

description: A Hangman variant which the player has to guess a sentence quote to save either Luckless Larry or Hapless Harriet from the gallows before the sun goes down. Each puzzle that is won scores five points, while puzzles that are lost but with some correct letters earns a portion of the points. It is also possible to import custom dictionaries with new sentences into the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Saved by the break of dawn
The dawn of a new hanging

title: HangWin

description:
There are two card games in one (three in version 1.3a onward):

  • Forty Thieves - 35 cards are face up and divided into seven columns of 5. There is also a stack of 20 cards with only the top card face up, which can eliminate any card from the columns which is one number higher or lower (Ace after King and vice versa does not count). The game is won when all seven columns are eliminated.
  • Kings Corners - The entire deck of cards must be placed on a grid of 16 spaces without the player getting stuck. Kings always go in corners, queen always go on sides, and jacks always go on the top or bottom. When the grid is filled, cards can be eliminated if they add up to 10.
  • Fortitude - Works a bit like Klondike Solitaire in the Vegas mode with FreeCell mechanics and no kings or queens. The layout consists of six card columns with two empty spaces and a stack of Fortitude cards. Its important never to draw a Fortitude card unless it is needed. If the entire fortitude stack is drawn and there are no moves to perform, the player is stuck.

sample_screenshots.caption: A new round equals new color (v1.3b)
Two Jokers? What are the odds?

title: Thieves and Kings

description: The object of this dice game is to get the highest number of points. Building up points is dependent on the sides that the die roll on. A dice with 1 is worth 100 points, and a dice with 5 is worth 50 points. Players start with six die. After each turn, one dice is deducted and the score is added up. If no points have been earned, the player has zilched.
title: Zilch

description: Based on the Chinese card game "Wild escape", there are two teams each with three stacks of nine cards. The idea is to get rid of all cards in quick succession. A team can be played as one to three players. Players in a team can lead, pass cards to another stack of the same team, or play larger cards. The ranks of the cards from highest to lowest are Extra Joker, Joker, Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten till Two.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got a six-pack waiting for you

title: Catch Three

description: Math Bingo is a two-player strategy board game, which teaches math. The player needs to score five bingo balls in a row on the board vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. Squares the player can choose must match the showing number or solution to the math problem. The center square is a wildcard, working for any math problem. The player passes a turn if none of the squares matches the number/answer.
title: Math Bingo

description: Based on the classic card game "Go Fish", the game can have between two to four players, the winner being the first to collect the most sets of cards (cards of all four suits). It's possible to bluff to a player asking for a particular card. The game can be set to auto play.

sample_screenshots.caption: Draw a card from the middle
Winner is the Ace of Spades

title: Go Fish

description: Based on the classic 19th century American card game, two to four players start the game with discarding their pairs. During their turn, a player can pick a single card from their previous opponent to match additional pairs or pass. The winner is the first player to hold only a single queen.

sample_screenshots.caption: I hold the title of Old Maid

title: Old Maid

description: Based on the traditional card game of chance, two players start by revealing their top cards, with the higher number winning a round and collecting both cards to the player's stack, until both cards are of equal number (qualifies as a war round), which prompts the players to draw four cards with the higher value earning a player all ten cards. The winner is the player who acquires the entire pack of cards. There is an option for Fast Wins to speed up the game. In some scenarios, the cards will be exchanged between both players indefinitely.

sample_screenshots.caption: On you stacks, get set, play!

title: War

description: This memory match card game requires players to match two picture cards from a grid to score points. The highest score goes for the lowest number of card flips. The easy mode has 16 picture and the hard mode has 36.
title: Match It

description: Based on the rules of the popular floor game, the player uses the mouse to aim and launch a disc towards a marked section attempting to score the highest number of points. The game can be played on Novice, Intermediate, or Expert difficulty and the player can challenge one of three different opponents, each with their own play style.
title: Shuffleboard 3D

description:
On Dinosaur Mountain, a mother dinosaur has laid a clutch of eggs. The player as a caveman comes to help hatch the eggs.

This game in the WAS Arcade series has the player aiming the mouse cursor and hatching as many dinosaur eggs as possible within a time limit.
title: Super Dinoegg

description:
The game is divided into two different parts:

  • Tangram - The player utilizes the all seven pieces of tangram by rotating them 15 or 45 degrees and flipping them to create a pattern that solves the puzzle. There are 65 different puzzles to solve.
  • Plates of Wisdom - Exactly the same as Trangram, but adds 70 more patterns.
title: Patterns

description: This simplified version of Hangman, allows younger players to make letter guesses to a word without being penalized for wrong answers, and at the same time learn matching words with pictures, and spelling. The game includes over 200 pictures, words, sounds, and animations.

sample_screenshots.caption: After a few guesses you win

title: Hangman Jr.

description: The game is aimed at younger users. It contains puzzles in the form of 11 objects, which must be dragged and fitted into the correct empty shapes in the picture. Each new picture randomizes the location of the objects and shapes.
title: Kiddy Puzzles

description: This tiles game requires the player to lay out a full set of pictures, then make the tiles disappear by matching two adjacent tiles right-to-left, either with the same picture or with the same colored border. The game is won when all but one of the tiles are gone. The difficulty can be set for 2 to 4 suits, and 4 to 13 ranks.
title: Leapfrog Solitaire

description: This game teaches elementary school math material, covering additions, subtractions, multiplications, and divisions. There are eight levels of difficulty. During the game, the player has twenty math problems to solve. The player can attempt each problem only two times, or skip it. Points are awarded for correct answers, depending on the difficulty level. The player has the option to play in Practice Mode to attempt math problems without any pressure from mistake restrictions.
title: Chalkboard Math

description: This small board game is about the player moving one of the pegs from the green circles to one of the opponent's red circles, before the opponent does the so first. Strategies involve moving the pieces on specific paths, and using barriers to force a player to redirect the pieces. Players have a limited number of barriers, and cannot use them to wall up the board completely.
title: Confound Game

description: This puzzle game consists of seven hexagons, each with six numbers. The hexagons can be rotated, placed on space of the main board, or removed from it. The hexagons have to be arranged in a manner that the numbers at one side of a hexagon meets with the same number on an adjacent hexagon. The game is won when all the hexagons have same numbers on multiple sides meeting each other.
title: The Aztec Curse

description: In Bog, the player has to press the letter buttons of the 4x4 grid to build as many dictionary words as possible. However the next letter has to be orthoganally adjacent to the previous letter. Also the same letter cannot be inputted twice.
title: Bog

description:
This compilation includes a free subscription to Club-Internet and 4 CD-ROM :

  • Le Dictionnaire Hachette Multimédia 99
  • 100 recettes ELLE
  • Atout Clic Français du CP au CM2
  • Noddy: The Magic of Toytown on a CD-ROM
title: Le Meilleur du Multimédia

description:
Cloak, Dagger and DNA is a turn-based strategy game for four players. Players can be human, inactive (does not move and does not create new armies), or AI. Human players also get an AI, which can be asked for advice. The game supports remote play via network drive.

The map has a number of areas that contain multiple tiles. Control passes between player per area, not tile. Most areas contain factories, which produce a certain amount of income per-turn if owned by a player. That income can be used to purchase armies, one per factory, as well as maintain those armies, one per factory. Combat is simple; every two armies can destroy one enemy army each turn if they exist in the same area. The game features simultaneous moves, where after all order have been entered, the game resolves everything. Victory occurs if one player controls 75% of the factories, eliminates all opposition, or has the most factories on turn 50.

The DNA in the name refers to the genetic algorithms that can be used to develop AI players. While the game comes with some AI programs, it also allows the creation and customization of new AI players in automated tournaments.

This game was distributed as shareware. The registered version included a map/scenario editor, and allowed editing some game rules.

sample_screenshots.caption: Running my side with the assistance of AI

title: Cloak, Dagger and DNA

description: This computerized version of the titular word game requires the player to guess the correct letters that fill the spaces out of the 26 available letters. The game allows the player 10 incorrect guesses before the hangman is formed.

sample_screenshots.caption: I guess random guesses don't crack it

title: Hangman

description: This basic program teaches math for solving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division with maximum numbers ranging from 10 to 500. There is also a score window to keep track of the player's progress.
title: Wind-O-Math

description: Clown Math drills math problems for the player. Problems covered include addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Using the mouse or keyboard, the player inputs the answer and checks it. The player has five chances to get a correct answer, otherwise the clown floats away.
title: Clown Math

description: The game is like a computerized version of flash cards for learning math. The material consists of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and a mix of the four. The math problems come in four different learning levels. There are 30 math problems to solve with multiple answers shown. After finishing, the score sheet can be printed.
title: Math in a Flash

description: This game is all about guessing colors displayed. The game modes consist of choosing from a selection of eight words, a selection of eight color panels, a selection of three colored squares, or a selection of three color pictures.

sample_screenshots.caption: Match a color to a word

title: Color Fun

description: The game acts as a spelling tutor by prompting the player to correctly spell words in lowercase letters. There is also the option to create custom lists of words and record them.
title: FunSpell

description: This picture matching game is played by two players who compete for a high score by revealing matches from as low as 6 pictures to as high as 40. When a player makes a correct match, they get another go. Each match is worth 2 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Red rose goes to the red player

title: Family Memory Match

description: Win-Flash aids in users learning math skills in the groups of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division which can be practiced in four levels. Included in the game are tables to show all formulas, and a calculator.

sample_screenshots.caption: Can't get it right every time

title: Win-Flash

description: This casino-styled game plays like Hangman. When a player spins, the value the spinners lands on determines what the player gets. A value of $50 equals a free spin, a value of $950 loses the player a turn, a value between $450 and $550 allows a free vowel without any score, and values with three of the same number ($111, $222, $333, etc.) makes the player go broke. In addition to guessing each letter, the player also has the opportunity to guess the phrase.
title: Spin 'n' Win

description: This teaching tool aids players in math with a scalable range for Addition, Subtraction, Division, and Multiplication plus a guessing game with word problems. Answering sums correctly earns points, while each mistake deduct 50 points. Also featured is a printable certificate or practice sheet.
title: Math Wizard

description: This simple memory matching game consists of 26 squares with hidden pictures. The player must look for matching pairs in as few tries as possible. The pictures can be of ABCs, numbers, colors, shapes, and the keyboard-oriented uppercase and lowercase letters.
title: MatchMaker

description: This is a game of dice and chance. First the player rolls five dice. After that, the player can select any die to re-roll for a better score. After each roll, the player earns points either by picking one the six boxes that represent one of six sides of a die, or choosing one of the seven pattern boxes the have poker-style patterns. The object is to use up all thirteen boxes. Extra rolls are awarded for earning points, while running out of rolls means game over. The game can be set as Normal YotZ, YotZ with Bonus, or Triple YotZ.
title: WinYotZ

description: This logic slider puzzles simply requires the player to move the numbers in a 4 x 4 grid so that the sequence is in ascending numerical order from 1 to 15.
title: Numero

description: This application teaches young users how to read and pronounce letters and words. The player is free to add any objects and words to the screen. Animations are triggered by clicking on the set of traffic lights. The animation elements get the attention of the user and anything clicked is sounded out.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sounds and Noises in the sky

title: Sounds and Noises!

description: Quinta is a board game which kind of combines the elements of Go! and Reversi. The object is to place five stones in a row either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. In addition to a player placing stones, it's also possible to capture an opponent's stones by surrounding them with two of the player's.
title: Quinta

description: Q-Tris is a free-to-play Tetris clone, which can be set to the desired level and the number of lines to achieve.
title: Q-Tris

description: This puzzle game requires the player to rotate and position the twelve puzzle pieces so that they all fit perfectly into the indicated rectangle. The challenge can be modified by setting the rectangle size,
title: Pentomino

description: This game is a computerized version of jigsaw puzzles. Puzzles can be scaled to be small, medium, or large with few, medium, or many pieces. Each puzzle piece can be rotated clockwise and where they fit, the joined pieces can be re-positioned. Custom Bitmap and GIF files can be turned into Jigsaw puzzle files for newer pictures to add to the game.
title: Jigsaw 2 for Windows

description: Based on Norman E. Gibat's word game, the player looks for words hidden in a grid of letters. The words are positoned in several directions; horizontally, vertically and diagonally, both forwards and backwards. Some words will overlap others. The player is also able to print puzzles and even build their own custom puzzles.

sample_screenshots.caption: Solved it and found all the candies

title: Wordsearch Mania

description: This take on Space Invaders enables the player to start from the first till the fifth wave and can be played on Slow, Medium, or Fast speed.
title: Aliens

description: This computerized version of the wooden table board game, involves a mix of strategy and luck. Players roll the dice and move their checker pieces around the board until they are removed. The player that removes fifteen pieces first is the winner. The game also allows cheating moves from the human player.
title: Backgammon

description: This simulation of 10-pin bowling is done through a few mouse clicks for each turn after the alignment of the bowling ball. The first and second mouse clicks start up and set the ball speed indicator respectively. The third mouse click bowls the ball across the alley.
title: Bowling

description: In this computerized Simon Says game, the player has to mimic a flashing block sequence generated by the computer. The beginner level has 4 colored blocks, the intermediate level has 6 colored blocks, and the advanced level has 8 colored blocks.
title: Memory

description: A simple game that requires the player to switch the positions of the numerical figures till they are sorted in ascending order from 1 till 9 in the fewest possible turns.
title: Reversal

description: This take on Snake has the player navigating a viper snake across the field to eat all the apples as fast as possible and avoiding colliding with the walls or the length of the viper’s body.
title: Viper

description: The player defends a town from a volley of incoming Scud missiles by targeting and firing the defensive Patriot Missiles. Each missile fired creates an explosion radius to take out one or more incoming projectiles. Points earned are based on the projectiles destroyed and the number of buildings that remain undamaged.
title: Patriot Missile

description: This simplified memory matching game teaches kids how to distinguish objects and figures that are the same or are different. The categories included are Numbers, Alphabet, Colors, Animals, and Toys. There are three difficulty levels to test a user's skills. Beginner Level serves to guide users on every exercise with available hints. Intermediate Level has some degree of challenge, with hints in case the user gets stuck. Advanced Level will truly test the user with no hints or guides available.
title: Kids' Concentration

description: The player participates in a game of Hide and Seek by looking for Peek-A-Boo Bear in one of five dinosaur pictures. The bear can be hidden in the foreground, background, or outside the picture border.
title: Hide-And-Seek

description: The aim of the game is to find all the hidden words in a grid. The game can be set to have a letter or number grid with the words displayed in set directions. The word search puzzles can also be printed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ways you can play the game

title: Hide 'n Seek

description: This arcade-style game teaches players the necessities in the event of an earthquake. The player controls the dinosaur character to move around the screen collecting essential items such as First Aid Kits and Swiss Army Knives, and leave behind luxury items like Radios and Toys. At the same time the player must avoid falling debris.
title: Earthquake Zeeno

description: This software contains predefined coloring pages, with which the player can color in with 12 crayons (as drawing tools), and 12 paintbrushes (as paint bucket tools). There is also an eraser tool, and a clear picture tool. Finally the player has the option to print the picture.
title: My Coloring Book

description:
This educational package contains several activities for young learning users:

  • Counting
  • Alphabet with Pictures
  • Shapes
  • Colors
  • Addition and Subtraction
title: My Program

description: This spelling and word recognition tutor aids users in testing their logic skills to rearrange jumbled up anagrams to form correctly-spelled words. The words generated come from an included dictionary. Points earned for correct guesses, but are deducted for showing answers. Game difficulty comes in Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced levels. The player also has the option to add custom words to the dictionary, as well as create a complete custom dictionary.

sample_screenshots.caption: Spell the name of the game

title: Word Wizard

description: This program makes coloring pictures fun for users by incorporating 125 different colors, 25 different pattern shades, and an eraser tool. There five different coloring books, each with its own theme and 25 pictures that match the theme. Ordering the full version granted the player a physical hard copy of the complete coloring book, plus a box of crayons.

sample_screenshots.caption: Five coloring books to choose from

title: ColorMe!

description: The logic behind the game is to click one of the piles of stones and type in a number to deduct them. The opposing player picks a pile using the same number as the first player. They keep deducting stones until none remain. The winner is the player who removes the last stone.
title: Stones

description: Adapted from the movie of the same name, the player goes through 24 pages either from beginning to end automatically or via clicking on the story map to freely explore each page. Some pages contain puzzle mini-games.
title: All Dogs Go To Heaven 2 Animated Moviebook

description:
Kloks is a puzzle game, based on the "Rubik's Clock" puzzle. The playfield is a 3x3 grid of nine clocks. Each clock has two hands: an upper one (light blue) and a lower one (dark blue). The four corner clocks have both hands aligned together at all times, whereas in the central and edge clocks, the two hands can move independently. At the start, each clock hand is pointing in a random direction.

Only the hands of the four corner clocks can be manipulated directly. Each corner clock is associated with a pushrod, which connects the clock's hands to three other clocks. The color of each pushrod can be changed by clicking, between light blue and dark blue. If the pushrod is light blue (dark blue), rotating the hands of the corner clock also rotates the upper hands (lower hands) of the three connected clocks.

The puzzle is solved once all the clock hands point to 12 o'clock.
title: Kloks

description:
Empires of the Old World contains four European strategy games for Windows.

The 2nd CD in the Stone Master series contains:

  • Dalmatian Pirates and The Volga Bulgars
  • Fox and Geese
  • Mills (Nine Men's Morris)
  • Push 'n Shove

Program includes computer opponents with different personalities and skills to challenge. Also has an internet play option to challenge opponents online. The package comes with a physical copy of the boards for playing on the go.
title: Empires of the Old World

description:
Mephisto Genius 3.5 is a chess simulation. The game is played against the computer. The playing strength can be adjusted by changing parameters. Included is a training function as well as the game variants blitz and tournament chess.

You can play in 2D or 3D with different piece designs and environment graphics.
title: Mephisto Genius 3.5

description: DeapSea is a single-player variation on Battleship, where the player and the computer take turns attempting to sink their opponent's ships by firing shots. In this game, you don't place your ships manually, but get a random setup, which you can reroll if desired. Also different from standard Battleship rules is that there are more ships and sizes of ship, ships can be placed diagonally, and you get an extra shot whenever you hit an opponent's ship.
title: DeapSea

description:
Word Skramble is a Boggle-like game: you are given 16 letters, and are asked to find as many words as possible from those letters in two minutes. The main difference from Boggle is that there's no requirement for the letters to be connected. Any letter can come after any letter. The other difference is that this is a single-player game. Score is still based on the number of words found, and the length of each word.

The game has three difficulty levels; on lower difficulty levels some common letters will always be present. The amount of time given can also be adjusted. There is a high-score table.
title: Word Skramble

description: Galaxy Man is a Hangman game with alien theming. Guess the word but, for every wrong guess, a new piece of the alien is revealed. Three aliens can be chosen, each with two backgrounds. The word difficulty and the number of allowed wrong guesses can also be configured.
title: Galaxy Man

description:
For The Folks Back Home is a choose-your-own adventure game where you make various decisions around missionary work. At any time, there are two paths available to you, each of which takes time, and may or may not create new believers. There is also a diary which will show your decisions up to this point, and your thoughts about those decisions.

You are a new missionary to the country of Bingola. What decisions will you make? Where will you live? Will you concentrate on your evangelical work, or help in the local school? Will you teach people to read, or make new disciples?

For the Folks Back Home was designed to promote Bible translation and missionary work. It was based on the group exercise For Those Back Home.

sample_screenshots.caption: Do you choose to teach at the local Bible College?

title: For The Folks Back Home

description:
Virtual Shooting Gallery is a compilation of two games:

  • Trap Shooting
  • Prairie Dog Hunt 2: Judgement Day
title: Virtual Shooting Gallery

  • 2X Cherry Slots
  • 2X Dynamite Slots
  • 2X Wild Stars
  • 8-Ball Slots
  • A-Z Puzzlemaker
  • Absolute Slots
  • Acey Ducey Backgammon
  • All American Gin Rummy
  • Animated Blackjack
  • Animated Keno
  • Animated Puzzles

  • Bloobs
  • Botz
  • Brickanoid
  • Christmas Slots
  • Collidascope
  • Dominoes Deluxe
  • Dominion
  • Double Wild Slots
  • Game Chest
  • Halloween Slots
  • Home Stretch
  • Mystery Slots
  • Penny's Arcade

  • Pro Backgammon
  • Real Video Blackjack
  • REAL Video Poker
  • Solitary Confinement
  • Total Recall
  • Ultimate Solitaire
  • Uz

  • Wild Ball Keno
  • Wild Wizard Slots

description:
High Roller for Windows: Six Vegas Games is a group of six gambling games:

  • Video Poker: Five Card Draw
  • Video Poker: Joker's Wild
  • Video Poker: Deuces Wild
  • Video Slots
  • Video Roulette
  • Video BlackJack

Eight card backs are available. The game includes sound and music.
title: High Roller for Windows: Six Vegas Games

description:
Jack Thompson is a pilot of an American B-17 bomber during World War II. His plane is shot down by German fighters and is about to crash. However, a mysterious portal appears, transporting Jack into an alternate reality. Jack ends up in a jungle and promptly saves a young woman who is attacked by a gigantic dinosaur. It appears that the woman is a princess who was about to be sacrificed for her father. The two decide to travel together, trying to survive in the dangerous jungle and eventually escape.

Bermuda Syndrome is a cinematic platformer similar in concept to Flashback. The emphasis of the gameplay is on solving problems and carefully proceeding through screens filled with enemies and hazards. Jumping, fighting, and occasionally using items are required to succeed. At some points it is necessary to interact with the princess in order to solve a puzzle.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh look, its a baby T-REX, so cute!

title: Bermuda Syndrome

description:
Casino Games CD is a compilation of Shareware and Freeware casino games for DOS and Windows 3.1. There is a launcher that allows installation or running the games directly from the CD. Games included:

  • Bandit
  • Blackjack by Oleg Goldfayn
  • Craps by Ralph Scott
  • Day at the Races
  • Draw 5 Poker by AT-Ware
  • Keno Plus by Bailey Enterprises
  • Lone Star Lotto by Blue Sky Microware
  • One Armed Bandit by Brett McDonald
  • Poke-It Poker by Viable Software Alternatives
  • Pot 'O' Gold by NightHawk Software
  • Roulette by Pyramid Software Development
  • SMF Casino Poker by Paul D'Ascensio
  • Super Craps by Chris Peterson
  • Handicapper Pro (Thoroughbred Handicapper Pro by Whirlwind Technologies; not a game.)
  • Trix Slots by TrixWare Industries
  • Video Poker by Bitwise Software International, Inc.
  • Draw Poker Challenge by Don Willis
  • WinGo by Bob Dolan
  • 7 Stud Hi Lo by The WorkWare Co.
  • 7 Card Stud
  • Texas Holdem by The WorkWare Co.
title: Casino Games CD

description: This game is designed to help learners with counting. The player clicks the numbers in ascending numerical order. Difficulty can be Beginner with numbers 1 to 9, Intermediate with numbers 1 to 18, and Advanced with number 1 to 28. The numbers can be scrambled for added challenge. Hints can be enabled to ease the difficulty.
title: 123 Learn

description: This game is designed to help children learn the letters of the alphabet. The player clicks the letters in alphabetical order. Difficulty can be Beginner for a simple A to Z exercise, Intermediate for lightly scrambled letters, and Advanced for heavily scrambled letters. Hints can be enabled to ease the difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Let's shake things up a lot

title: ABC Learn

description: Jigsaw puzzles are available in this game to setup either as set configurations or completely customized by the player. The player can also upload their very own pictures. The pieces can rotated 90 degrees clockwise or anti-clockwise and there are hints to aid in solving the puzzle.

sample_screenshots.caption: How do you like your jigsaw?
The most puzzle pieces you can get

title: BrainsBreaker

description: This puzzle game acts a bit like a digital Rubik's Cube, with the object being to flip all the cubes in the fewest moves possible, so that one face of colors are all facing up. The game can be played on various difficulties. Beginner starts the play with 3 by 2 squares, Medium puts 3 by 3 squares, Expert presents a challenge of 4 by 4 square, and Practice ranges from as few as 2 by 2 to 4 by 4 squares and has all the squares faced up on magenta to allow the player to get acquainted with the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Time and Moves to solve the puzzle

title: Volutare 96

description:
The World Series of Poker is being held in the Binion's Horseshoe Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. The player comes to the city with a bankroll of $5,000, hoping to double that amount, which will pay for a place in the tournament with the opportunity to win the million dollar prize, plus being crowned the World Champion of Poker. If not, the player will leave the city flat broke.

The player character is controlled using point-and-click interactions to progress. Most of the time, the player will be playing gambling games including video poker, slot machines, three different kinds of poker games, blackjack, baseball betting, craps, roulette, baccarat, and keno lottery. To skip navigating room by room, the Pick Table option serves to get straight to the games. Outside the casino are services to make purchases for luxury and entertainment. Once the player earns $10,000, the World Series of Poker is unlocked.
title: World Series of Poker Adventure

description: This chess-like board game (also called Rithmomachia), has the player moving the pieces across the board with rook-like moves. The circle pieces move one square, the triangle pieces three, and the square pieces four. The player must capture six of the opponent's pieces to win. There are four strategies to capture a piece, which include surrounding it from two or four sides, or using particular pieces based on the number of empty spaces or current round to land on it.
title: Ambush

description:
Las Vegas Super Casino is a compilation of five casino games:

  • Baccarat for Windows (Listed as PC Baccarat)
  • Video Keno for Windows (Listed as PC Keno)
  • Professional Video Poker for Windows (Listed as PC Video Poker)
  • Ultima 21 Blackjack for Windows (Listed as PC Blackjack)
  • Slot Machine
title: Las Vegas Super Casino

description:
Slot Machine is a basic slot machine game for early Windows. It features betting levels of 1–5 quarters, starting funds of $10, and a single line. It does not save your funds between runs. Options include sound and wheel spin delay.

This game was distributed as shareware, but without missing features.
title: Slot Machine

description:
Atoms is a Black Box-style game with multiple difficulty levels and time-based scoring. Easy has six atoms hidden in a 10 x 10 grid, intermediate has eight atoms hidden in a 10 x 10 grid, hard has 10 atoms hidden in a 16 x 16 grid, and impossible has 14 atoms hidden in a 16 x 16 grid.

Gameplay consists of shooting rays into the grid to determine where the atoms are, judging based purely on where the ray emerges. Unusually, scoring is based on the time taken, not the number of rays used. The game ends once all atoms have been correctly marked, but there is no penalty for incorrectly marking a space; the game will simply continue until all spaces have been correctly marked.

The game was distributed as shareware, but without missing features.
title: Atoms

description:
Blob is a variant of Ataxx. This is a two-player game; each player starts with two pieces in the corners. On each turn, a player can either duplicate a piece to an adjacent space, or move a piece two spaces away. After moving or duplicating a piece, any enemy pieces next to the moved piece will be converted. The winner is the player with the most pieces after no more moves can be made.

The game can be played with zero, one or two human players. Multiple board configurations are included.

Blob was distributed as shareware, but without missing features.
title: Blob

description: This is a variant of Concentration. Thirty cards are dealt face-down, with a different color on the face of each of them. Pick two cards to see if they match; if they do, they will be removed and the player will score 100 points. If they don't, they are turned face-down again, and the player loses 50 points. The score is kept between games, but resets on exit.
title: Concentration

description:
Crazy Ones is an Uno-style card game. This is a multi-player card game, where each player competes to empty their hand of cards first. Play consists of either matching the color or number of the top card on the discard pile, or drawing a new card if matching is not possible. There are also wild cards, draw four wild cards, as well as jump and back cards to change the next player. Play consists of multiple hands, with the ultimate goal being to avoid hitting 300 points. (Points come from having cards after the end of a hand.)

Crazy Ones was distributed as shareware. The shareware version only allows play against one computer opponent. The registered version allows playing against 1-3 computer opponents, with 8 different personalities. It also allows team play with one computer player, saves high scores to disk, and allows for adjusting various game options.

sample_screenshots.caption: Down to a single card, and it matches the last card
Down to only a few cards, but look closer; I actually have four cards

title: Crazy Ones

description:
Herman and the Falling Rocks is a Boulder Dash variant. Like similar games, your goal in each level is to collect all the flowers on the level, while avoiding being trapped or having a rock dropped on your head. Unusually, though, this game allows for diagonal movement, and boulders only fall sideways if directly disturbed.

Herman and the Falling Rocks was distributed as shareware, with multiple registration levels. A new set of levels and a level editor could be gotten through higher registration levels. A later demo version includes the level editor (with no save functionality), but only includes the first two levels.
title: Herman and the Falling Rocks

description:
Magic is a puzzle game where the player is asked to construct a magic square out of dominoes. A magic square is a square where all rows, columns, and the diagonals add up to the same number. The square is 6 x 6, so not every domino will be used. The number to add up to can be changed from 13 to 23.

Magic was distributed as shareware, but without missing features.

sample_screenshots.caption: Finished (with the help of the Internet)

title: Magic

description:
Memory is a memory game. The player selects two face-down tiles from the grid. If they match, the player gets points, and they stay revealed. If they don't, they are turned face-down again. It can be played in three modes:

  • timed play (uncovering all tiles in as little time as possible)
  • two players (players take turns to reveal tiles)
  • computer play (competing against the computer for matches)

The grid size can be changed from 4x4 all the way to 8x9, and matched tiles can be removed from the grid instead of remaining.

Memory was distributed as shareware, but without missing features.
title: Memory

description: TC Robot Bout is a single-player 3D fighting game. The player fights against an opposing robot with their own robot, attempting to destroy the opponent before they do the same. Limbs will become disabled with enough damage. Graphical options are included to make the game less taxing to run, and an automatic mode is included.

sample_screenshots.caption: The other robot has been destroyed

title: TC Robot Bout

description:
BreakThru! is a 3D Breakout variant. The blocks to break are at the "bottom" of the playfield well, and the paddle is at the top. The goal is to break all the blocks by hitting them with the ball. Options are included for game speed, paddle size, and number of balls. The game can also be placed into automatic mode.

BreakThru! was distributed as shareware, but without missing features. Registered users would receive source code and the latest version.

sample_screenshots.caption: Playing with the largest paddle size

title: BreakThru!

description: TC Car War is a 3D car combat game. After choosing a design, the player is dropped into a combat arena, and is asked to destroy all other vehicles. Design options include armor, fuel, bullets, missiles, grenades, mines, guns, and flight. Graphical options to make the game less taxing are included.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fighting a red car, while a green car is off to the side
Destroyed the enemy, but a new challenger has appeared

title: TC Car War

description: Shoot Em All is a first-person shooter. The goal in each level is simple: Reach the flag. By doing so, you will immediately go to the next level. There are, however, enemies in your way; the best way to deal with them is, of course, to shoot them all. This game has a radar to show the locations of enemies. Graphical options are included to make the game less taxing to run.
title: Shoot Em All
